original: stong pa 'ba' zhig gis dmigs par yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: stong pa 'ba' zhig gis dmigs par yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to visualize only emptiness,

original: snying rje chen po'i dbang gis sems can la dmigs shing chags pa bskyed pa'i phyir de'i dus su tshon dmar dgye'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i dbang gis sems can la dmigs shing chags pa bskyed pa'i phyir de'i dus su tshon dmar dgye'o //
translated: because one generates attachment to sentient beings through the power of great compassion. At that time, one applies red color.

original: sems can gyi don la zhugs pas rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la zhugs pas rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: One expands through engaging in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu tshon ser po bri'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu tshon ser po bri'o //
translated: Therefore, one draws the yellow color after that.

original: rgyas shing mthu dang ldan pas na las thams cad nus pa ste /
analyzed: rgyas shing mthu dang ldan pas na las thams cad nus pa ste /
translated: Since one expands and becomes powerful, one is able to perform all activities.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don nus pas na /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don nus pas na /
translated: Since one is able to perform one's own and others' purposes,

original: 'jam po 'dul ba la yang 'jam por ston /
analyzed: 'jam po 'dul ba la yang 'jam por ston /
translated: one teaches gently to those who are gentle to tame.

original: ma rungs pa rnams la yang khro bo //
analyzed: ma rungs pa rnams la yang khro bo //
translated: One is wrathful to the wicked.

original: thabs gzhan gyis ma khugs pa ma rungs pa rnams la thabs gzhan med na /
analyzed: thabs gzhan gyis ma khugs pa ma rungs pa rnams la thabs gzhan med na /
translated: If one cannot subdue the wicked with other methods,

original: mthar drag shul gyis gdul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthar drag shul gyis gdul ba'i phyir /
translated: one should subdue them with wrath in the end.

original: tha mar nag po bzhag ste /
analyzed: tha mar nag po bzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, one applies black in the end.

original: khro bo'i las byed do //
analyzed: khro bo'i las byed do //
translated: One performs wrathful activities.

original: ting nge 'dzin las rnam par grol ba zhes gong du smos pa de 'di man chad 'chad de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las rnam par grol ba zhes gong du smos pa de 'di man chad 'chad de /
translated: The above-mentioned liberation from samādhi is explained from here onward.

original: de bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis de'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs nas zhes pa la sogs pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis de'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs nas zhes pa la sogs pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān Vairocana arose from that samādhi, and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas zhes pa ni /
translated: Having arisen from that samādhi,

original: sngar ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa las bzhengs nas /
analyzed: sngar ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa las bzhengs nas /
translated: having previously entered samādhi,

original: rgyal ba'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'o //
translated: he entered the Victor's samādhi.

original: mtha' yas par rnam par rgyal bzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtha' yas par rnam par rgyal bzhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for victorious in the limitless,

original: grangs med pa'i rgol ba rnams kyis mi tshugs pas na /
analyzed: grangs med pa'i rgol ba rnams kyis mi tshugs pas na /
translated: since he is not harmed by countless opponents,

original: grangs med pa'i rgyal ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: grangs med pa'i rgyal ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: he is the Victor of countless [opponents].🔽The queen of knowledge who is invincible to all, arisen from the domain of all tathāgatas, has been taught.

original: thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa'i rig pa'i rgyal mo zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul las byung ba gsungs so zhes pa de las thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa zhes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam par te /🔽nyon mongs pa dang lha'i bu'i bdud la sogs pas mi tshugs @187a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa'i rig pa'i rgyal mo zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul las byung ba gsungs so zhes pa de las thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa zhes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam par te / nyon mongs pa dang lha'i bu'i bdud la sogs pas mi tshugs @187a * //
translated: As for invincible to all, it is in terms of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means that he is not harmed by afflictions, the māra of the sons of the gods, and so on.

original: da ni phyag rgya'i le'u bshad pa ste /
analyzed: da ni phyag rgya'i le'u bshad pa ste /
translated: Now, the chapter on seals is explained.

original: phyag rgya rnams bshad pa yang spyir gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnam pa gnyis zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa dang dmigs pa can no //🔽de la zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa'i gdul ba'i 'gro ba ni sngags tshig rnams bshad pas sngags tshig de dag gi sgra'i de kho na nyid la dmigs shing /
analyzed: phyag rgya rnams bshad pa yang spyir gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnam pa gnyis zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa dang dmigs pa can no // de la zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa'i gdul ba'i 'gro ba ni sngags tshig rnams bshad pas sngags tshig de dag gi sgra'i de kho na nyid la dmigs shing /
translated: The explanation of the seals is as follows: In general, there are two types of disciples: those who aspire to the profound and vast and those who are focused on the coarse.

original: byang chub kyi sems sgom pa sngon du bar lha'i gzugs sbyor te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems sgom pa sngon du bar lha'i gzugs sbyor te /
translated: Among them, the disciples who aspire to the profound and vast are those who, through the explanation of the mantra words, focus on the reality of those mantra words and, having previously cultivated bodhicitta, apply themselves to the form of the deity.

original: lha'i gzugs sbyor ba de yang ting nge 'dzin dag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa gzhan spangs pa dang / lha'i gzugs su snang ba rdzogs par ro //
analyzed: lha'i gzugs sbyor ba de yang ting nge 'dzin dag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa gzhan spangs pa dang / lha'i gzugs su snang ba rdzogs par ro //
translated: That application to the form of the deity is the purification of samādhi, the abandonment of other concepts, and the perfection of the appearance of the form of the deity.

original: dmigs pa can gyis gdul ba'i 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa can gyis gdul ba'i 'gro ba ni /
translated: The disciples who are focused on the coarse

original: sngags kyi sgra'i de kho na nyid la dmigs pa la sogs pa de dag ma nus te /
analyzed: sngags kyi sgra'i de kho na nyid la dmigs pa la sogs pa de dag ma nus te /
translated: are unable to focus on the reality of the sound of the mantra and so on.

original: phyag rgya tsam bcings nas lha'i gzugs su sbyor bar byed pas na /
analyzed: phyag rgya tsam bcings nas lha'i gzugs su sbyor bar byed pas na /
translated: They apply themselves to the form of the deity by merely binding the seals.

original: dmigs pa can gyis gdul ba'i 'gro ba de dag gi phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa can gyis gdul ba'i 'gro ba de dag gi phyir /
translated: For the sake of those beings to be trained who are focused on objects,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yon tan rnams kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yon tan rnams kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs byin gyis brlab po //
translated: the Blessed One blesses the forms of the seals of his causal and resultant qualities.

original: de la ral gri dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni yid kyi yon tan no //
analyzed: de la ral gri dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni yid kyi yon tan no //
translated: Therein, the seals of the sword, vajra, and so forth are the qualities of mind.

original: dung gi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni gsung gi yon tan no //
analyzed: dung gi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni gsung gi yon tan no //
translated: The seals of the conch and so forth are the qualities of speech.

original: gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni sku'i yon tan te ci ltar rig par so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni sku'i yon tan te ci ltar rig par so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The seals of the uṣṇīṣa and so forth are the qualities of body. They should be individually applied as is known.

original: phyag rgya'i le'u bshad pa de yang de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis 'khor 'dus pa thams cad la gzigs nas /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i le'u bshad pa de yang de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis 'khor 'dus pa thams cad la gzigs nas /
translated: The explanation of the chapter on seals: Then the Blessed One Vairocana, having looked at the entire assembled retinue,

original: phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: said this to the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi:

original: gsang ba'i bdag po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rgyan du gyur pa /
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rgyan du gyur pa /
translated: Lord of Secrets, the tathāgatas are the adornment of the tathāgatas.

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa /
translated: It is the sign of the realization of the dharmadhatu.🔽

original: phyag rgya'i le'u rgyas pa zhes bya ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i le'u rgyas pa zhes bya ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The seal-chapter is called “extensive” because it explains the purpose of the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rgyan du gyur ces pa ni gtsug tor dang spyan gyi phyag rgya la sogs pa sku'i rgyan du gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa zhes pa chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rgyan du gyur ces pa ni gtsug tor dang spyan gyi phyag rgya la sogs pa sku'i rgyan du gyur pa'i phyir ro // chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa zhes pa chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.

original: de rtogs shing chud par mdzad pa'i mtshan ma ni ral gri dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'o //🔽des brgyan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhes pa nas de dag @187b kyang de'i ngag nyan par 'gyur te zhes pa'i bar du phyag rgya de rnams bstan pa'i dgongs pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de rtogs shing chud par mdzad pa'i mtshan ma ni ral gri dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'o //🔽des brgyan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhes pa nas de dag @187b kyang de'i ngag nyan par 'gyur te zhes pa'i bar du phyag rgya de rnams bstan pa'i dgongs pa bshad pa ste /
translated: The seals of the Tathāgatas are the seals of the Tathāgatas, etc.🔽The

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams phyag rgya de dag dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams phyag rgya de dag dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Those bodhisattvas who are endowed with those seals

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub chen po'i mtshan mas btab pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub chen po'i mtshan mas btab pa yin te /
translated: are marked with the great enlightenment of the Tathagata.

original: de dag la lha dang mi dang lha ma yin la sogs pa rnams kyis mi brdzi bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag la lha dang mi dang lha ma yin la sogs pa rnams kyis mi brdzi bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: They cannot be crushed by gods, humans, asuras, and so forth.

original: lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa de rnams kyang /
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa de rnams kyang /
translated: Those gods, asuras, and so forth

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi ngag mnyan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi ngag mnyan par 'gyur ro //
translated: will listen to the words of those bodhisattvas.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten na rgyal po'i phyag rgya 'chang ba'i skyes bu de la 'jig rten pa'i mi rnams kyang mi brdzi bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten na rgyal po'i phyag rgya 'chang ba'i skyes bu de la 'jig rten pa'i mi rnams kyang mi brdzi bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Just as in the world, a person who bears the king's seal cannot be crushed by worldly people,

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyang de'i ngag nyan par 'gyur ba dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyang de'i ngag nyan par 'gyur ba dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: and worldly people will listen to his words.

original: mdor na phyag rgya 'di rnams bshad pas gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams la mthong ba'i chos dang tshe phyi ma la phan par 'gyur bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na phyag rgya 'di rnams bshad pas gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams la mthong ba'i chos dang tshe phyi ma la phan par 'gyur bar bstan pa'o //
translated: In brief, it is taught that by explaining these seals, they will benefit the beings to be trained in this life and in future lives.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das mi tshugs pa'i gnas kyi stobs byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das mi tshugs pa'i gnas kyi stobs byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa ni /
translated: Then the Bhagavat entered the samadhi called “The Empowerment of the Strength of the Unassailable Place.”

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyag rgyas de dag nyid mi tshugs pa'i gnas kyi stobs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyag rgyas de dag nyid mi tshugs pa'i gnas kyi stobs zhes bya ste /
translated: This means that the mudras that will be explained below are called “the strength of the unassailable place.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhugs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhugs nas /
translated: The Bhagavat, having entered into evenness in samadhi,

original: phyag rgya de dag 'chad pas na /
analyzed: phyag rgya de dag 'chad pas na /
translated: explains those mudras.

original: ting nge 'dzin de'i ming mi tshugs pa'i gnas kyi stobs byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de'i ming mi tshugs pa'i gnas kyi stobs byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the name of that samadhi is called “The Empowerment of the Strength of the Unassailable Place.”

original: de la mi tshugs pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rdo rje rgyan de dag ci la yang thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi tshugs pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rdo rje rgyan de dag ci la yang thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: “Unassailable” means that the Bhagavat’s body is inexhaustible and so forth. Those vajra ornaments are unimpeded by anything.

original: gnas zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la bya /
analyzed: gnas zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la bya /
translated: “Place” refers to the Bhagavat’s body.

original: stobs zhes pa ni de ltar thogs pa med pa nyid stobs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: stobs zhes pa ni de ltar thogs pa med pa nyid stobs su gyur pa'o //
translated: “Strength” means that being unimpeded in that way becomes strength.

original: byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The blessing is the Blessed One's inexhaustible body, and so on.

original: rdo rje thogs pa med pa'i stobs su gyur pa de nyid phyag rgya'i ngo bor byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thogs pa med pa'i stobs su gyur pa de nyid phyag rgya'i ngo bor byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: That very vajra, which is the power of non-obstruction, is blessed as the essence of the seal.

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu /
translated: As soon as the Blessed One entered into meditative concentration,

original: de 'di ltar kun gyis mi tshugs pa'i stobs /
analyzed: de 'di ltar kun gyis mi tshugs pa'i stobs /
translated: it became like this: the power of being unassailable,🔽the power equal to the unequalled, the power of entering into the commitment, the power of the knowledge of the power arose.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i stobs dam tshig la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i stobs kyi rig pa 'byung ngo zhes pa mi tshugs pa'i stobs zhes pa ni gong ma bzhin no //🔽mi mnyam pa'i stobs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i stobs dam tshig la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i stobs kyi rig pa 'byung ngo zhes pa mi tshugs pa'i stobs zhes pa ni gong ma bzhin no // mi mnyam pa'i stobs zhes pa ni /
translated: The power of being unassailable is as explained above.

original: mi tshugs pa'i stobs de nyid gang dang yang mi mnyam pa'o //🔽dam tshig @188a * //
analyzed: mi tshugs pa'i stobs de nyid gang dang yang mi mnyam pa'o // dam tshig @188a * //
translated: The power of being unequalled means that very power of being unassailable is unequalled by anything.

original: la 'jug pa'i stobs zhes pa ni dam tshig gi don ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: la 'jug pa'i stobs zhes pa ni dam tshig gi don ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The power of entering into the commitment means that the meaning of commitment has been explained before.

original: dam tshig la 'jug pa ni sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dkyil 'khor lta ba 'og ma'i 'gro ba rnams kyi spyod yul du mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dam tshig la 'jug pa ni sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dkyil 'khor lta ba 'og ma'i 'gro ba rnams kyi spyod yul du mi 'gyur bas /
translated: The entrance into the commitments is the entrance into the mandala of the nature of the inexhaustible body, etc. which is not the domain of experience of beings of lower approaches.

original: de'i byin gyis brlabs su gyur pa /
analyzed: de'i byin gyis brlabs su gyur pa /
translated: It is blessed by that.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang sngags 'di bcings shing brjod pa na rang bzhin gyis dkyil 'khor de mthong ba dang 'dra ba na 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang sngags 'di bcings shing brjod pa na rang bzhin gyis dkyil 'khor de mthong ba dang 'dra ba na 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one binds and recites this commitment seal and mantra, it is as if one sees that natural mandala, and so it is called entrance.

original: gnyis su dam tshig srung ba rnams nyams pa na /
analyzed: gnyis su dam tshig srung ba rnams nyams pa na /
translated: Second, when one has transgressed the commitments,

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang sngags 'di byas na /
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang sngags 'di byas na /
translated: if one performs this commitment seal and mantra,

original: dkyil 'khor mthong ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mthong ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: it is as if one sees the mandala.

original: de byas pa tsam gyis dam tshig las nyams pa de 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: de byas pa tsam gyis dam tshig las nyams pa de 'tsho ba ste /
translated: By merely performing that, one's transgression of the commitments is revived,

original: slar dam tshig tu zhugs par 'gyur bas na dam tshig tu 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slar dam tshig tu zhugs par 'gyur bas na dam tshig tu 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and one again enters into the commitments, and so it is called entrance into the commitments.

original: gsum du na dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / sngags 'dir byas na 'jug pas na /
analyzed: gsum du na dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / sngags 'dir byas na 'jug pas na /
translated: Third, this commitment seal and mantra of entering the mandala is performed here, and so it is called entrance.

original: dam tshig tu 'jug pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: dam tshig tu 'jug pa zhes bya'o//
translated: It is called “entering into the sacred pledge.”

original: gsang ba'i bdag po rig pa'i rgyal mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis ston pa'o zhes pa 'di brjod pas /
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po rig pa'i rgyal mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis ston pa'o zhes pa 'di brjod pas /
translated: “Lord of Secrets, this queen of awareness is taught by all the tathagatas.”

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnas rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor mthong ba dang 'dra bas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnas rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor mthong ba dang 'dra bas na /
translated: Since this is said, it is as if one sees the natural mandala of the place of all the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “taught by all the buddhas.”

original: gnyis sun gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor bris pa yang /
analyzed: gnyis sun gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor bris pa yang /

original: rig pa 'di brjod nas bstan pa'am /
analyzed: rig pa 'di brjod nas bstan pa'am /

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ston pa zhes bya'o //

original: chos lam gsum gyi mtshams las mi 'da'o zhes pa chos lam gsum ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang rdo rje'i yid mi zad pa'i rgyan nam /

translated: “The Dharma will not transgress the boundary of the three paths” means that the three paths of the Dharma are the inexhaustible ornaments of the body, speech, and mind vajras of the tathagatas.

original: sku gsum ste de'i lam ni dam tshig bsrung ba bya ba rnams la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sku gsum ste de'i lam ni dam tshig bsrung ba bya ba rnams la sogs pa ste /

original: lam de de las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: lam de de las mi 'da' ba'o //

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang sa yongs su rdzogs pa ste zhes pa ni dam tshig der zhugs nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa la sogs pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rim gyis rdzogs par byed pa dang / de'i mthus sa las rim gyis 'phar bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: one gradually perfects the perfection of generosity, such as making offerings to the Bhagavān, and so on, and by the power of that, one gradually ascends the stages.

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the stages and perfections are perfected.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi dam tshig ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi dam tshig ni /

original: dam tshig tu bsrung ba las mi 'da' 'am /

original: sku mi zad pa la sogs pa chud par byed pa'am /
analyzed: sku mi zad pa la sogs pa chud par byed pa'am /

original: rgya 'di phyag rgya chen po ste //
analyzed: rgya 'di phyag rgya chen po ste //

original: chos dbyings rnam par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: chos dbyings rnam par spyod pa'o //

analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' de lugs kyi chos dang / thob pa'i chos rnams 'khor lo bskor ba ste /

analyzed: phyag rgya des rdo rje sems dpar gyur nas /

analyzed: ral gri'i phyag rgya ste phyag rgya chen po'o //

analyzed: mgon po sangs rgyas kun gyi ste ;

translated: The perfection of nature is

analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni /
translated: The perfection of consecration is indicated by the words:

analyzed: nam yi ge rnams sngags kyi sgra brjod dam /
translated: “When the letters are uttered as the sound of mantras,

analyzed: las phun sum tshogs pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of activity is fourfold.

original: sngags rnams su sbyor ba dang / lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba dang / ting nge 'dzin du sbyor ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rol mo'o //
analyzed: sngags rnams su sbyor ba dang / lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba dang / ting nge 'dzin du sbyor ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rol mo'o //
translated: It is the application to the mantras, the transformation into the form of a deity, the application to meditative concentration, and the enjoyment of the bodhisattva activities.

original: de la sngags rnams su sbyor ba ni yi ge 'bru de rnams las sngags kyi tshig gi tshul du sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: de la sngags rnams su sbyor ba ni yi ge 'bru de rnams las sngags kyi tshig gi tshul du sbyar ba ste /
translated: The application to the mantras is the application of those syllables in the form of mantra words.

original: sngags kyi tshul la rnam par gnas pa'i cho ga'o zhes pa'i tshig snga ma nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul la rnam par gnas pa'i cho ga'o zhes pa'i tshig snga ma nyid kyis so //
translated: This is by the previous phrase, “the ritual of abiding in the manner of the mantras.”

original: lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba ni yi ge rnams gang yang rung ba las lha'i gzugs su sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba ni yi ge rnams gang yang rung ba las lha'i gzugs su sbyor ba ste /
translated: The transformation into the form of a deity is the application of those syllables to the form of a deity.

original: gzugs yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is by the phrase, “the retention of the form.”

original: ting nge 'dzin du sbyor ba ni yi ge 'bru de rnams las stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin chos kyi skur sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du sbyor ba ni yi ge 'bru de rnams las stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin chos kyi skur sbyor ba ste /
translated: The application to meditative concentration is the application of those syllables to the nature of emptiness, the dharmakāya.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul la mkhas pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul la mkhas pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is by the phrase, “the skill in the manner of the tathāgatas.”

original: spyod pa ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las dang / rab dang 'bring la sogs pa 'grub par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: spyod pa ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las dang / rab dang 'bring la sogs pa 'grub par spyod pa ste /
translated: The conduct is the performance of activities such as pacification and increase, and the conduct of accomplishing the superior, middling, and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rol pa zhes pa'i tshig gis so //🔽thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus rnams ka tsa ta ta pa rnams dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin mang por 'jug pa la nan tan gyis shig dang / byang chub dang spyod pa dang kun du sangs rgyas dang mya ngan @192a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rol pa zhes pa'i tshig gis so // thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus rnams ka tsa ta ta pa rnams dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin mang por 'jug pa la nan tan gyis shig dang / byang chub dang spyod pa dang kun du sangs rgyas dang mya ngan @192a * //
translated: The term “conduct of bodhisattvas” is used.

original: las 'das pa dang bcas par thob par byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: las 'das pa dang bcas par thob par byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: “Practice diligently entering the many samādhis endowed with ka, ca, ṭa, ta, and pa, and you will attain enlightenment, conduct, complete buddhahood, and nirvana.”

original: yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis po de gnyis po de rnams dang po'i aa a'a zhes pa gnyis dang / tha ma'i aam aa zhes pa gnyis dang / dbus kyi ai la sogs pa rnams dang ldan par sbyar na /
analyzed: yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis po de gnyis po de rnams dang po'i aa a'a zhes pa gnyis dang / tha ma'i aam aa zhes pa gnyis dang / dbus kyi ai la sogs pa rnams dang ldan par sbyar na /
translated: If the thirty-two consonants beginning with ka are combined with the two a and ā of the beginning, the two aṃ and aḥ of the end, and the i and so on of the middle,

original: byang chub dang spyod pa dang kun du sangs rgyas pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo ston pa'i rang bzhin pas de rnams dang ting nge 'dzin du sbyar na byang chub la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub dang spyod pa dang kun du sangs rgyas pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo ston pa'i rang bzhin pas de rnams dang ting nge 'dzin du sbyar na byang chub la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it has the nature of showing the door of enlightenment, conduct, complete buddhahood, and nirvana, if those are applied to meditative concentration, one will attain enlightenment and so on.

original: de bzhin du thog ma la sogs pa dang ldan par brjod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du thog ma la sogs pa dang ldan par brjod na /
translated: Similarly, if the vowels are expressed as having a beginning and so on,

original: sngags kyi cho gar 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: sngags kyi cho gar 'gyur gyis /
translated: they become the procedure of mantra.

original: thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus su ldan par de yang rig par bya'o zhes pa thog ma la sogs pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus su ldan par de yang rig par bya'o zhes pa thog ma la sogs pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Also, that should be understood as having a beginning, end, and middle.🔽The vowels a, ā, aṃ, and aḥ are the beginning, end, and middle, respectively.

original: thog ma'i aa a'a dang / tha ma'i aam aa dang / dbus kyi ai la sogs pa dang ldan par ka la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams brjod na /
analyzed: thog ma'i aa a'a dang / tha ma'i aam aa dang / dbus kyi ai la sogs pa dang ldan par ka la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams brjod na /
translated: If the consonants ka and so on are expressed as having those,

original: byang chub la sogs pa thob pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyis sngags kyi tshig rnams su yang 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub la sogs pa thob pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyis sngags kyi tshig rnams su yang 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: not only will one attain enlightenment and so on, but they will also become the words of mantra.

original: mkhas pas ji ltar 'dod pas sngags kyi gtso bor de'i tshig re re dang sbyor cig dang / nges par 'tshang rgya zhing bla na med par gnas mchog sbyin par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas ji ltar 'dod pas sngags kyi gtso bor de'i tshig re re dang sbyor cig dang / nges par 'tshang rgya zhing bla na med par gnas mchog sbyin par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: The wise one should apply the principal mantra as desired, with each of its syllables, and he will certainly attain enlightenment and the unsurpassed bestowal of the supreme abode.

original: gong du smos pa'i tshul la mkhas pas ting nge 'dzin gang 'dod chags pa'am /
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i tshul la mkhas pas ting nge 'dzin gang 'dod chags pa'am /
translated: The wise one, in the manner mentioned above, should apply the samadhi as desired,

original: rang gi lha gang yin par sbyar ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang gi lha gang yin par sbyar ba la sogs pa la /
translated: or to whatever deity is his own, and so forth.

original: ji ltar 'dod par yi ge de rnams gang yang rung ba 'bru gcig la sbyar na yang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod par yi ge de rnams gang yang rung ba 'bru gcig la sbyar na yang /
translated: Even if he applies any of those syllables to a single seed syllable, as desired,

original: ji ltar bsams pa'i don 'grub par byed pa'o zhes pa 'di ni de ltar 'khor lo gcig ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bsams pa'i don 'grub par byed pa'o zhes pa 'di ni de ltar 'khor lo gcig ste /
translated: he will accomplish the intended purpose. This is the wheel in that way.

original: 'khor lo bzhin du 'khor ba ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhin du 'khor ba ni /
translated: The wheel that turns like a wheel

original: yi ge 'khor lo zhes pa ni yi ge aa gcig po las ka la sogs pa du ma'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo lta bur 'khor ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge 'khor lo zhes pa ni yi ge aa gcig po las ka la sogs pa du ma'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo lta bur 'khor ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: is the wheel of syllables, which turns like a wheel of the nature of samadhi, with many syllables such as ka arising from a single syllable a.

original: sngags pa'i yi ge 'khor lo de shes na /
analyzed: sngags pa'i yi ge 'khor lo de shes na /
translated: If the mantra practitioner knows that wheel of syllables,

original: rtag tu ji ltar mdzes pa ni /
analyzed: rtag tu ji ltar mdzes pa ni /
translated: Always, just as is beautiful,🔽like the Bhagavat Vairocana turning the wheel.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'khor lo bskor ba bzhin no zhes pa ni sngags pas gong du smos pa'i yi ge 'khor lo zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'khor lo bskor ba bzhin no zhes pa ni sngags pas gong du smos pa'i yi ge 'khor lo zhe na /
translated: The mantra practitioner, having turned the wheel of syllables as previously explained,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad las dang spyod pa thams cad du spyod nus pa bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad las dang spyod pa thams cad du spyod nus pa bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: will be able to perform all the activities and conduct of the Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: mdzes pa zhes pa ni spyod pa'i tshig tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa zhes pa ni spyod pa'i tshig tu shes par bya'o //
translated: “ Beautiful” should be understood as a word for conduct.

original: da ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan @192b 'das kyi sku mi zad pa dang / gsung mi zad pa dang / yid mi zad pa rdo rje'i rgyan rnams de dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs pa la sku mi zad pa dang / gsung mi zad pa'i byin gyis brlabs kyi dkyil 'khor la snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan @192b 'das kyi sku mi zad pa dang / gsung mi zad pa dang / yid mi zad pa rdo rje'i rgyan rnams de dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs pa la sku mi zad pa dang / gsung mi zad pa'i byin gyis brlabs kyi dkyil 'khor la snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba dang /
translated: Now, the mandala of the consecration of the inexhaustible body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat Buddhas, the inexhaustible body and speech consecration mandala of the arising of the essence of great compassion,

original: yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gong du bshad zin /
analyzed: yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gong du bshad zin /
translated: and the wheel of syllables mandala have been explained above.

original: yid mi zad pa'i dkyil 'khor chos kyi sku'i byin gyis brlabs su 'gyur ba de bstan te /
analyzed: yid mi zad pa'i dkyil 'khor chos kyi sku'i byin gyis brlabs su 'gyur ba de bstan te /
translated: The mandala of the inexhaustible mind is explained to be the blessing of the dharmakāya.

original: de'i zhar la gong du dkyil 'khor gnyis bshad pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de'i zhar la gong du dkyil 'khor gnyis bshad pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: In addition to that, the ritual of the two mandalas explained above is [also explained].

original: lhag ma slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid dang / slob ma'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad du byis pa rnams la gong du rgyas pa ma smos shing /
analyzed: lhag ma slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid dang / slob ma'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad du byis pa rnams la gong du rgyas pa ma smos shing /
translated: The remaining topics, such as the characteristics of the master, the characteristics of the disciples, and so forth, and the ritual articles of the mandala, were not explained extensively above for the sake of the childish.

original: ma rdzogs pa rnams dang sbyin sreg gi cho ga la sogs pa 'di nyid du rgyas par bshad de /
analyzed: ma rdzogs pa rnams dang sbyin sreg gi cho ga la sogs pa 'di nyid du rgyas par bshad de /
translated: The incomplete [topics] and the ritual of the burnt offering and so forth are explained extensively right here.

original: de la chos kyi sku ni mtshan mas bstan pa las 'das te /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku ni mtshan mas bstan pa las 'das te /
translated: Among those, the dharmakāya is beyond being indicated by characteristics.

original: dngos po med pas bstan du mi mngon pa la yon tan gyi rjes su mthun pa las bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pas bstan du mi mngon pa la yon tan gyi rjes su mthun pa las bstan par bya ste /
translated: Since it is not a thing, it is not apparent to be indicated, but it is to be indicated from the perspective of concordant qualities.

original: chos kyi sku'i yon tan ni phyin ci ma log pa dang mi 'gyur bar yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba dang / bya ba thams cad byed nus pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i yon tan ni phyin ci ma log pa dang mi 'gyur bar yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba dang / bya ba thams cad byed nus pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: the complete liberation from all emotional afflictions, and the nature of being able to perform all functions.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i sgo nas de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i sgo nas de bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of that is by way of being in accord with it.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams kyi dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams kyi dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: It is the consecration as the mandala of earth, water, fire and wind.

original: sa ni brtan zhing mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid rdo rje dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: sa ni brtan zhing mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid rdo rje dang 'dra bas /
translated: Earth is the characteristic of being completely perfect, stable and unchanging, like a vajra.

original: dbang chen gyi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs te bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught as the consecration as the mandala of the vajra of great power.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: The nature of the abandonment of all conceptual thought

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs nas bstan pa ste /
translated: is taught as the consecration as the mandala of water.

original: chu ni thams cad 'khru bar byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chu ni thams cad 'khru bar byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Water is the nature of washing everything.

original: de'i snying po ba ni snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i snying po ba ni snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The essence of that should be understood as before.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of complete liberation from all afflictions

original: me'i dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
translated: is the consecration as the maṇḍala of fire,

original: me'i rang bzhin bsreg par bya ba dang / yi ger chos thams cad rdul dang bral bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me'i rang bzhin bsreg par bya ba dang / yi ger chos thams cad rdul dang bral bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of fire is to burn and the syllable raṃ illustrates all phenomena as being free from dust.

original: bya ba thams cad nus pa ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor du byin gyis @193a * //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad nus pa ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor du byin gyis @193a * //
translated: The ability to perform all activities is the consecration as the maṇḍala of air,

original: brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: brlabs pa ste /
translated: because

original: rlung ni kun du 'gro zhing thams cad 'byed pa'o zhes sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung ni kun du 'gro zhing thams cad 'byed pa'o zhes sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is explained that air moves everywhere and separates everything.

original: de ltar chos kyi sku byin gyis brlabs su gyur pa gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor de dang / dkyil 'khor sum char cho ga rdzogs par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi sku byin gyis brlabs su gyur pa gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor de dang / dkyil 'khor sum char cho ga rdzogs par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In that way, in order to explain the consecration of the dharmakāya, the secret maṇḍala, and the complete rite of the three maṇḍalas,

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par zhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par zhugs te /
translated: the Bhagavān entered equipoise in that samādhi.

original: de yang ci byas nas zhugs she na /
analyzed: de yang ci byas nas zhugs she na /
translated: What did he do?

original: gsungs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi khams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyis gzigs nas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi khams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyis gzigs nas zhes pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān, having seen with the eye of a tathāgata the entire realm of sentient beings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis gzigs nas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis gzigs nas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means having seen with the wisdom of a tathāgata.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi mdzod rnam par 'phrul pa de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa'i rgyan gyi snying po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par zhugs so zhes pa chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi mdzod rnam par 'phrul pa de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa'i rgyan gyi snying po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par zhugs so zhes pa chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: He entered the meditative absorption called the essence of the adornment of the equality of the tathāgatas, the emanation of the treasure of the dharmadhātu. The dharmadhātu is suchness.

original: de las sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan rnams kyi mtshan nyid 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de las sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan rnams kyi mtshan nyid 'byung ba ni /
translated: The characteristics of the inexhaustible body and so on, the vajra ornaments, arise from that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa'i rgyan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa'i rgyan zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called the adornment of the equality of the tathāgatas.

original: de dag chos kyi dbyings de las 'byung ba na /
analyzed: de dag chos kyi dbyings de las 'byung ba na /
translated: When they arise from that dharmadhātu,

original: chos kyi dbyings de nyid mdzod ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de nyid mdzod ces bya'o //
translated: that dharmadhātu itself is called the treasure.

original: rnam par sprul pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par sprul pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Emanation means

original: de las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rnam pa sna tshogs su spyod pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rnam pa sna tshogs su spyod pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgatas who arise from that are the various activities.

original: mnyam pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'byung ba de dag nyid tshogs pa dang / chos kyi sku dang sems can gyi don byed par mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'byung ba de dag nyid tshogs pa dang / chos kyi sku dang sems can gyi don byed par mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Equality means that the arising of the Tathāgata’s body is the same in terms of the assembly, the Dharma body, and the benefit of sentient beings.

original: rgya cher zhes bya ba ni mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: rgya cher zhes bya ba ni mang po'i tshig go //
translated: Vast means many.

original: snying po'o zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: snying po'o zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i gnas te /
translated: The essence is the abode of arising.

original: ting nge 'dzin de nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de nyid la bya ste /
translated: It is the samādhi itself.

original: ting nge 'dzin der zhugs na de lta bur 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin der zhugs na de lta bur 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: When one enters that samādhi, it arises in that way.

original: ting nge 'dzin du zhugs nas kyang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du zhugs nas kyang /
translated: Having entered the samādhi,

original: ji ltar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan zhe na /
translated: how is it taught?

original: gsungs pa chos kyi dbyings mi zad pa mang po mngon par bstan pa dang / sngags kyi spyod pa 'di las sems can gyi khams ma lus par gdon pa'i yi dam bcas par rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa chos kyi dbyings mi zad pa mang po mngon par bstan pa dang / sngags kyi spyod pa 'di las sems can gyi khams ma lus par gdon pa'i yi dam bcas par rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said: in order to fully accomplish the teaching of the inexhaustible dharmadhātu and the resolve to liberate the entire realm of sentient beings from this mantra conduct.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes pa ni skabs 'dir sems can gyi khams la bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes pa ni skabs 'dir sems can gyi khams la bya ste /
translated: The Dharma realm here refers to the realm of sentient beings.

original: de mngon par 'byung ba bstan pa yang las dang tshe'i rnam par smin pa dang / 'bras bu zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba bshad do //
analyzed: de mngon par 'byung ba bstan pa yang las dang tshe'i rnam par smin pa dang / 'bras bu zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba bshad do //
translated: The teaching of its manifestation is explained by the words karma, the ripening of life, result, and so forth that will occur below.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa 'di nyid las sems can gyi khams ma lus par gdon par yi dam @193b bca' ba rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor bstan du zin kyang //
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa 'di nyid las sems can gyi khams ma lus par gdon par yi dam @193b bca' ba rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor bstan du zin kyang //
translated: In order to fulfill the vow to liberate the entire realm of sentient beings from this very practice of mantra, even though the maṇḍala of the origin of great compassion and the maṇḍala of the wheel of syllables have been taught,

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor ma bstan na /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor ma bstan na /
translated: if the secret maṇḍala is not taught,

original: dam tshig lnga la sogs pa dang yang ldan par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dam tshig lnga la sogs pa dang yang ldan par mi 'gyur la /
translated: one will not possess the five samayas, and so on.

original: de'i zhar la snga ma'i cho ga lhag ma rnams kyang rdzogs par bshad par bya ba ma bstan na /
analyzed: de'i zhar la snga ma'i cho ga lhag ma rnams kyang rdzogs par bshad par bya ba ma bstan na /
translated: Moreover, if the remaining rites of the previous [maṇḍalas] are not taught in order to complete the explanation,

original: sngags pa rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sngags pa rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: the mantra practitioner will not be complete.

original: dam tshig ma rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dam tshig ma rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not complete the commitments,

original: de bas na de dag kun rdzogs par bstan na /
analyzed: de bas na de dag kun rdzogs par bstan na /
translated: then if one teaches all of them,

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus par gdon pa'i yi dam bcas pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus par gdon pa'i yi dam bcas pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will complete the commitment to liberate the entire realm of sentient beings.🔽Then, in this way, through the door of emanation into the realm of sentient beings, one will experience the ripening of karma and life,

original: de nas 'di ltar sems can gyi khams su rnam par sprul pa'i sgo nas las dang tshe'i rnam par smin pa dang / 'bras bu za ba dang // zar 'jug pa dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / dbyangs dang / 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: de nas 'di ltar sems can gyi khams su rnam par sprul pa'i sgo nas las dang tshe'i rnam par smin pa dang / 'bras bu za ba dang // zar 'jug pa dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / dbyangs dang / 'gro ba dang /
translated: the experience of the result, the engagement in eating, color, shape, voice,🔽movement,

original: spyod pa dang / nges pa'i tshig 'byung ba dang / ji lta bur bsams pa bzhin pas sems can thams cad so sor mgu bar byed pa /
analyzed: spyod pa dang / nges pa'i tshig 'byung ba dang / ji lta bur bsams pa bzhin pas sems can thams cad so sor mgu bar byed pa /
translated: conduct, the arising of definitive words, and the satisfaction of all sentient beings according to their thoughts.

original: ba sbu'i bu ga thams cad nas chos kyi dbyings nas rnam par 'phel ba'i sku 'byung zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ba sbu'i bu ga thams cad nas chos kyi dbyings nas rnam par 'phel ba'i sku 'byung zhes pa ni /
translated: “The kāya that increases from the dhātu of phenomena arises from all the pores” means that the kāya that increases from the dhātu of phenomena arises from all the pores.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par zhugs ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyi sku ba spu'i bu ga thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sems can thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par zhugs ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyi sku ba spu'i bu ga thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sems can thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa /
translated: As soon as the Lord had entered into evenness in meditative concentration, in all the pores of the Lord's body there appeared the bodies of Tathagatas, in accordance with all sentient beings,

original: las dang tshe'i rnam par smin pa dang / 'bras bu dang / za ba dang zar 'jug pa la sogs pa ston pa 'byung po zhes pa ste /
analyzed: las dang tshe'i rnam par smin pa dang / 'bras bu dang / za ba dang zar 'jug pa la sogs pa ston pa 'byung po zhes pa ste /
translated: teaching the ripening of karma, the ripening of life, the fruit, eating, and causing to eat.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang tshe'i 'bras bu za bar ston pa'i las legs nyes ci spyad pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam par rang rang spyod pa snang ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang tshe'i 'bras bu za bar ston pa'i las legs nyes ci spyad pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam par rang rang spyod pa snang ba'o //
translated: The fruit of the ripening of karma and the fruit of life are taught. The fruit of whatever good or bad karma one has practiced is the experience of happiness and suffering, respectively.

original: zar 'jug pa ni rgyal po dang sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zar 'jug pa ni rgyal po dang sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Causing to eat is like a king, a guardian of the hells, and so on.

original: de dag gis dbang byas nas gzhan rnams la bde ba dang sdug bsngal spyod du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis dbang byas nas gzhan rnams la bde ba dang sdug bsngal spyod du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Having been empowered by them, others are caused to experience happiness and suffering.

original: de dag nyid kyi bye brag tu gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi bye brag tu gsungs pa /
translated: The specific ones are stated:

original: gzugs dang kha dog dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang kha dog dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Form, color, etc.

original: sems can rnams kyi gzugs dang kha dog dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rjes su mthun par chos 'chad pa'i sku rnams 'byung ngo zhes pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi gzugs dang kha dog dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rjes su mthun par chos 'chad pa'i sku rnams 'byung ngo zhes pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The bodies of the Dharma preachers appear in accordance with the forms, colors, thoughts, etc. of sentient beings.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: sems can thams cad so sor mgu bar byed pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad so sor mgu bar byed pa zhes pa'o //
translated: They satisfy all sentient beings individually.

original: sems can gyi khams su rnam par sprul @194a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams su rnam par sprul @194a * //
translated: The door of emanations in the realm of sentient beings.

original: pa'i sgo'o zhes pa'i tshig gong ma de ba spu'i khung bu zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: pa'i sgo'o zhes pa'i tshig gong ma de ba spu'i khung bu zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The previous phrase is connected with the word “pores.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ba spu'i khung bu de sems can gyi khams rnam par sprul pa las dang che'i rnam par smin pa dang / 'bras bu za ba dang zar 'jug pa rnams snang ba'i sku rnams 'byung ba'i sgo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ba spu'i khung bu de sems can gyi khams rnam par sprul pa las dang che'i rnam par smin pa dang / 'bras bu za ba dang zar 'jug pa rnams snang ba'i sku rnams 'byung ba'i sgo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that pore of the Tathāgata’s body is the door of the appearance of bodies that are the results of the evolution of the realm of sentient beings, of the evolution of karma, and of the enjoyment of the results of evolution.

original: de byung nas nam mkha' dang 'dra ba 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par khyab pa dang / dbyangs sgra gcig tu chos dbyings rig par byed cing /
analyzed: de byung nas nam mkha' dang 'dra ba 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par khyab pa dang / dbyangs sgra gcig tu chos dbyings rig par byed cing /
translated: After that, it pervades the world, which is like space, and the sound of the single verse causes the dharmadhatu to be known.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad ces bsgrags so zhes pa ni tshig tu 'og nas 'byung ba de bsgrags te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad ces bsgrags so zhes pa ni tshig tu 'og nas 'byung ba de bsgrags te /
translated: The verse that is proclaimed is as follows.

original: de yang thams cad tshig gcig tu sgra sgrogs pa na /
analyzed: de yang thams cad tshig gcig tu sgra sgrogs pa na /
translated: When all proclaim the verse with a single voice,

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad du thos shing chud par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad du thos shing chud par byed pa ste /
translated: it is heard and penetrates the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes pa'i tshig ni 'dir sems can gyi khams su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes pa'i tshig ni 'dir sems can gyi khams su shes par bya'o //
translated: The term dharmadhatu should be understood here as the realm of sentient beings.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: In this regard, it is said:

original: sgra sgrogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa de chos kyi dbyings su dmigs pa ston pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: sgra sgrogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa de chos kyi dbyings su dmigs pa ston pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The verse that is proclaimed is the term that teaches the observation of the dharmadhatu.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa de la chud cing goms par byas nas /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa de la chud cing goms par byas nas /
translated: Having penetrated and become accustomed to the verse that is taught,

original: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bas na /
translated: one will become a tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The verse declares the origin of the Tathagata.🔽The verse declares:

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa 'di ltar gang nas 'byung ba de kun zhes pa nas /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa 'di ltar gang nas 'byung ba de kun zhes pa nas /
translated: All that originates from the characteristics of phenomena

original: sangs rgyas rdzogs pas bshad pa'o //🔽zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdzogs pas bshad pa'o // zhes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: is explained by the perfect Buddha.🔽What originates?

original: gang nas zhes pa ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang nas zhes pa ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid nas zhes pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of phenomena.

original: 'byung ba de kun zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang nyan thos la sogs pa ming gis smos pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'byung ba de kun zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang nyan thos la sogs pa ming gis smos pa rnams te /
translated: All that originates is the mention of names such as the Buddha, sravakas and so on.

original: mdo ran chos rnams kyi chos nyid mtshan nyid ni chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid las sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / kun du sangs rgyas pa dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dang chos rnams 'byung zhing gnas pa dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdo ran chos rnams kyi chos nyid mtshan nyid ni chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid las sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / kun du sangs rgyas pa dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dang chos rnams 'byung zhing gnas pa dag 'byung ste /
translated: The reality dharmata of phenomena originates from the dharmadhatu tathata, from which the world of sentient beings, the world of the environment, the Buddha, sravakas, bodhisattvas, the completely enlightened and phenomena originate and abide.

original: de dag rtag tu ji ltar 'byung ba shes rab dang thabs su ldan pas lam 'di khyed kyis bsgom par gyis shig ces pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rtag tu ji ltar 'byung ba shes rab dang thabs su ldan pas lam 'di khyed kyis bsgom par gyis shig ces pa ste /
translated: You should cultivate this path by means of wisdom and method, always understanding how they occur.

original: de yang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa zhes pa'o //
translated: And this is what the perfect Buddha has explained.

original: rnam par brtag pa'o zhes pa na kun rdzob tu 'ang zhes pa ste /🔽mdor na chos rnams kyi dbyings mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba dang / de'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa las sprul pa'i @194b sku la sogs pa 'byung ba dang de la dmigs nas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa mthar sangs rgyas pa'i bar du /
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa'o zhes pa na kun rdzob tu 'ang zhes pa ste / mdor na chos rnams kyi dbyings mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba dang / de'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa las sprul pa'i @194b sku la sogs pa 'byung ba dang de la dmigs nas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa mthar sangs rgyas pa'i bar du /
translated: The phrase “in terms of conceptualization” means “even conventionally.”🔽In brief, you should understand the path by which the realm of phenomena, which is similar to a characteristic, and by the power of that, the emanation body of the Tathāgata and so on arise, and by observing that, śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on finally become buddhas.

original: ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ba'i lam de khyed kyis shes par byos shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ba'i lam de khyed kyis shes par byos shig ces pa'o //
translated: How is that accomplished?

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin der zhugs nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin der zhugs nas /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān, having entered that samādhi,

original: 'jig rten pa'i tshig dang 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tshig dang 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: taught both mundane and supramundane words.

original: 'jig rten pa'i las dang / tshe'i rnam par smin pa dang / 'bras bu za ba dang zar 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i las dang / tshe'i rnam par smin pa dang / 'bras bu za ba dang zar 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: worldly actions, the ripening of life, the eating of fruits, and the engaging in eating, and so forth.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni tshigs su bcad pa'i 'di nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni tshigs su bcad pa'i 'di nyid do //
translated: The supramundane is just this verse.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sems kyi dbang tsam gyis spu'i bu ga thams cad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sems kyi dbang tsam gyis spu'i bu ga thams cad nas /
translated: Then, by the mere power of the mind of the Bhagavān Vairocana, from all the pores of his body,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i rgyu byin gyi rlabs chos kyi dbyings las 'phrul pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku chos kyi dbyings thams cad du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i rgyu byin gyi rlabs chos kyi dbyings las 'phrul pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku chos kyi dbyings thams cad du /
translated: the causes of the arising of the buddhas, the blessings, the emanations from the dharmadhātu, the bodies of the tathāgatas, the dharmadhātu in all places,

original: rang gi sku rig par byed pa /
analyzed: rang gi sku rig par byed pa /
translated: making his own body visible,

original: sprul pa'i sprin khyab par byas nas /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sprin khyab par byas nas /
translated: having pervaded with clouds of emanations,

original: chos kyi dbyings rang rang gi gnas su slar zhugs so zhes pa ni ;
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rang rang gi gnas su slar zhugs so zhes pa ni ;
translated: dissolved back into the dharmadhātu in their own places.

original: gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas /
analyzed: gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas /
translated: This is saying that above, from all the pores of the body of the Bhagavān,

original: chos kyi dbyings nas 'phrul pa'i sku 'byung ba de dag bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sems kyi dbang tsam gyis /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nas 'phrul pa'i sku 'byung ba de dag bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sems kyi dbang tsam gyis /
translated: Those emanated bodies that arise from the dharmadhātu are, by the mere power of the mind of the Bhagavat Vairocana,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku mngon par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa sems can gyi khams thams cad du rang gi sku rig par byed pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku mngon par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa sems can gyi khams thams cad du rang gi sku rig par byed pa /
translated: the manifest enlightenment of the buddha body, the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, and so forth, which are known by all the realms of sentient beings through their own bodies.

original: sprul pa'i sku mang pos khyab par byas nas /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku mang pos khyab par byas nas /
translated: Having pervaded with many emanated bodies,

original: sems kyi dbang tsam gyis rang rang gi chos kyi dbyings su slar zhugs pa bstan to zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang tsam gyis rang rang gi chos kyi dbyings su slar zhugs pa bstan to zhes pa ste /
translated: they are shown to reenter their own dharmadhātu by the mere power of mind.

original: sems kyi dbang tsam gyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang tsam gyis zhes pa ni /
translated: The mere power of mind refers to

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: the Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: sgrub pa po lta bur blta /
analyzed: sgrub pa po lta bur blta /
translated: He should be viewed as the practitioner.

original: sbrul pa'i sku rnams 'byung ba ni bsgrub pa'i lha rnams lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: sbrul pa'i sku rnams 'byung ba ni bsgrub pa'i lha rnams lta bur blta'o //
translated: The arising of the emanated bodies should be viewed as the deities of the practice.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi las 'phrul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi las 'phrul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes pa ni /
translated: The emanated bodies of the tathāgatas of the dharmadhātu

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sprul pa'i sku rnams 'byung zhes pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sprul pa'i sku rnams 'byung zhes pa ste /
translated: The emanation bodies of the Bhagavat Vairocana arise by the blessing of the realm of phenomena.

original: des kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sgrub pa po'i sems kyi dbang tsam gyis rang gi sku'i gzugs su snang bar gyur pa /
analyzed: des kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sgrub pa po'i sems kyi dbang tsam gyis rang gi sku'i gzugs su snang bar gyur pa /
translated: By that, the blessing of the realm of phenomena and the mere power of the mind of the practitioner, the appearance of his own body appears.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gdul pa'i 'gro ba rnams la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gdul pa'i 'gro ba rnams la bstan pa'o //
translated: It is shown to the beings of the future to be tamed.

original: chos kyi dbyings rang rang gi gnas su slar zhugs so zhes pa ni slar bsdu'i bu ga rnams su zhugs pa la ni mi bya'i /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rang rang gi gnas su slar zhugs so zhes pa ni slar bsdu'i bu ga rnams su zhugs pa la ni mi bya'i /
translated: The realm of phenomena dissolves back into its own place means that it should not be taken as dissolving back into the pores,

original: gang @195a * //
analyzed: gang @195a * //
translated: but

original: du byung ba de dag gi gnas nyid du chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi snang bar gyur pa la bya'o //
analyzed: du byung ba de dag gi gnas nyid du chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi snang bar gyur pa la bya'o //
translated: that it is the very place where it arose, and it is taken as the appearance of the nature of emptiness, the realm of phenomena.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gis sku las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams 'byung bas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gis sku las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams 'byung bas /
translated: In that way, since the bodies of the tathagatas arise from the body of the Bhagavat,

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad du khyab par byas te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad du khyab par byas te /
translated: the entire realm of sentient beings is pervaded.

original: slar mi snang bar gyur pa bstan nas /
analyzed: slar mi snang bar gyur pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the disappearance of the mandala,

original: yid mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor gsum gyi cho ga'i lhag ma rnams bshad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: yid mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor gsum gyi cho ga'i lhag ma rnams bshad par gsungs pa /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares that he will explain the remaining ritual of the secret mandala and the three mandalas through the blessing of the inexhaustible mind vajra.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' la bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' la bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi and so on.

original: gsang ba zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'di'i yid kyi rang bzhin chos kyi sku'i byin gyis brlabs pas yid kyi rang bzhin chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'di'i yid kyi rang bzhin chos kyi sku'i byin gyis brlabs pas yid kyi rang bzhin chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The secret is the mind-nature dharmakāya mandala, blessed by the mind-nature dharmakāya.

original: dngos por bstan pa'i rang bzhin ma yin to /
analyzed: dngos por bstan pa'i rang bzhin ma yin to /
translated: It is not a nature that is taught as an entity.

original: phra bas na gsang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phra bas na gsang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called secret because it is subtle.

original: gnyis su na sku dang gsung gi rang bzhin phyag bzhin phyag rgya'i rang bzhin du bsgyur bas sku dang gsung du mi mngon pa la'ang bya'o //
