translated: But this is closer and more important than the others.

original: de gnyis las gzhan pa slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid dang / tshon 'gyed pa la sogs pa ji srid dris pa de dag thams cad gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bri ba zhes pa'i nang du 'dus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las gzhan pa slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid dang / tshon 'gyed pa la sogs pa ji srid dris pa de dag thams cad gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bri ba zhes pa'i nang du 'dus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Other than those two, all the questions asked, such as the characteristics of the master, the distribution of colors, and so on, should be understood as included in the question, “How does one draw the secret maṇḍala?”

original: de la skabs 'dir gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gsum char gyi cho ga spyir dris pa'i dngos bo de dag nyid chen po 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gsum char gyi cho ga spyir dris pa'i dngos bo de dag nyid chen po 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes pa'o //
translated: In that regard, here in this context, the “secret maṇḍala” is the general question about the rite of all three maṇḍalas.

original: dam tshig can ma yin pa las mi bstan pas gsang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig can ma yin pa las mi bstan pas gsang zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is not taught to those who do not have the samaya, it is called “secret.”

original: gzhan ni gong du smos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni gong du smos pa bzhin no //
translated: The other [answers] are as stated above.

original: 'byung ba chen po zhes gong du dris pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu she dag dris pa'i dngos po de dag nyid chen po 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po zhes gong du dris pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu she dag dris pa'i dngos po de dag nyid chen po 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: All those [answers] to the question What are the great elements? are the causes of unsurpassed enlightenment. Those very things that were asked about are called the causes of the arising of the great ones.

original: snying rje chen po rtsa las 'byung //🔽zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor de dag snying rje chen po las byung bas /
analyzed: snying rje chen po rtsa las 'byung // zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor de dag snying rje chen po las byung bas /
translated: Arising from the root of great compassion.🔽Since those maṇḍalas arise from great compassion,

original: de'i yo byad dris pa'i dngos po de dag snying rje chen po'i rtsi las 'byung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i yo byad dris pa'i dngos po de dag snying rje chen po'i rtsi las 'byung zhes bya'o //
translated: those very things that were asked about as the requisites are called arising from the root of great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas rdzogs pa'i gsang chen po //🔽zhes pa ni theg pa chen po'i gnas mchog de dag la sogs pa snod ma yin @197a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdzogs pa'i gsang chen po // zhes pa ni theg pa chen po'i gnas mchog de dag la sogs pa snod ma yin @197a * //
translated: The great secret of perfect buddhahood.

original: pa'i sems can rnams la mi bshad pas gsang ba chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i sems can rnams la mi bshad pas gsang ba chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since those supreme abodes of the Mahāyāna are not explained to sentient beings who are not suitable vessels, they are called the great secret.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi ni thog ma ru //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi ni thog ma ru //
translated: In the beginning of the maṇḍala,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: so so'i las la 'dod bzhin du'o //
analyzed: so so'i las la 'dod bzhin du'o //
translated: as one wishes for one's individual activity.

original: zhes pa'i bar du'o zhes pa dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sngon rol du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du'o zhes pa dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sngon rol du /
translated: Before drawing the maṇḍala,

original: slob dpon gyis bdag dang slob ma bsrung ba la sogs pa'i las byas pa'i sngags rnams la yun du bsnyen pa byas nas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis bdag dang slob ma bsrung ba la sogs pa'i las byas pa'i sngags rnams la yun du bsnyen pa byas nas /
translated: the master performs the rites of protecting oneself and the disciples, and so on, and recites the mantras for a long time.🔽Then, they are applied to their individual rites.

original: so so'i las la sbyar ro zhes gsang ba'i rgyud la sogs pa nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: so so'i las la sbyar ro zhes gsang ba'i rgyud la sogs pa nas 'byung ste /
translated: This is stated in the Secret Tantra and so forth.

original: de'i phyir rig pa'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sngon rol du bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rig pa'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sngon rol du bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: Therefore, before drawing the maṇḍala of the king of knowledge, one should recite [the mantra]

original: mtshan ma byung ba'i bar du bzlas na /
analyzed: mtshan ma byung ba'i bar du bzlas na /
translated: until the signs arise.🔽If one recites until all of those signs arise,

original: de dag thams cad mtshan ma byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad mtshan ma byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will all be made into signs.

original: 'di'i mtshan ma yang dkyil 'khor gyi lhag mar gnas pa na /
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan ma yang dkyil 'khor gyi lhag mar gnas pa na /
translated: Also, regarding the signs of this [maṇḍala], when the maṇḍala remains incomplete,

original: sngags pa'i rmi lam du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las rtsom pa mthong na zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngags pa'i rmi lam du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las rtsom pa mthong na zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: if the mantra practitioner sees in a dream the buddhas and bodhisattvas beginning the work of drawing the maṇḍala, it is connected with that.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis tshig las byung //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis tshig las byung //
translated: Arising from the words of the twelve branches,

original: zhes pa ni yig 'bru yan lag bcu gnyis sngags tshig tu gyur pa la yang bya /
analyzed: zhes pa ni yig 'bru yan lag bcu gnyis sngags tshig tu gyur pa la yang bya /
translated: This refers to the letters, which are the twelve branches [of the scriptures] in the form of mantra words.

original: gnyis su na yi ge 'bru bcu gnyis las /
analyzed: gnyis su na yi ge 'bru bcu gnyis las /
translated: In another way, it refers to the twelve-syllable mantra

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du chud par 'gyur ba la yang bya ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du chud par 'gyur ba la yang bya ste /
translated: penetrating into the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: yan lag ces pa ni yi ge 'bru'o //
analyzed: yan lag ces pa ni yi ge 'bru'o //
translated: The branches are the letters.

original: pad ces pa ni chud pa la bya'o //
analyzed: pad ces pa ni chud pa la bya'o //
translated: The lotus refers to penetrating [into the ultimate].

original: rig pa'i rgyal po stobs chen po //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po stobs chen po //
translated: The king of knowledge is of great power

original: zhes pa ni don dam par kyang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ston par byed pa dang / kun rdzob tu yang sbrul pa la sogs pa byed pas na mthu che ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni don dam par kyang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ston par byed pa dang / kun rdzob tu yang sbrul pa la sogs pa byed pas na mthu che ba'o //
translated: because it reveals the nature of emptiness ultimately, and because it has great power in the conventional by performing emanations and so forth.

original: de nas rim gyis bzlas par bya //
analyzed: de nas rim gyis bzlas par bya //
translated: Then, one should recite in sequence.

original: zhes pa ni rtsa ba dang snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i rim bzhin bzlas zhes pa ste tshig bcu gnyis po tshang bar bzlas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtsa ba dang snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i rim bzhin bzlas zhes pa ste tshig bcu gnyis po tshang bar bzlas zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that one should recite the root mantra, the essence mantra, the near essence mantra, and the near essence mantra in sequence, reciting all twelve syllables.

original: rang gi ting 'dzin la gnas te //
analyzed: rang gi ting 'dzin la gnas te //
translated: Abiding in one's samadhi,

original: zhes pa ni slob dpon rang gi ring nge 'dzin la rigs gsum gyi snying po gnas gsum du bzhag pa dang / dpa' po chen po'i snying po gnas ldar dgod pa dang / yan lag thams cad du yi ge dgong pa gang yang rung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas bzlas par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob dpon rang gi ring nge 'dzin la rigs gsum gyi snying po gnas gsum du bzhag pa dang / dpa' po chen po'i snying po gnas ldar dgod pa dang / yan lag thams cad du yi ge dgong pa gang yang rung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas bzlas par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that one should recite while abiding in any of the meditative stabilizations, such as placing the essence of the three clans in the three places, setting out the essence of the great hero in the four places, and placing the syllables in all the limbs.

original: ji ltar rim pa'i tshul shes nas //
analyzed: ji ltar rim pa'i tshul shes nas //
translated: Knowing the method of the stages,

original: so so'i las la 'dod bzhin du'o //
analyzed: so so'i las la 'dod bzhin du'o //
translated: one should do the recitations as one wishes for each action.

original: zhes pa de ltar rim pa dang sngon du bsnyen pa byas nas /
analyzed: zhes pa de ltar rim pa dang sngon du bsnyen pa byas nas /
translated: Having thus performed the prior approximation by the stages,

original: bdag dang / gnas dang / slob ma srung ba la sogs pa'i sngags rnams ji ltar rim par sbyar ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang / gnas dang / slob ma srung ba la sogs pa'i sngags rnams ji ltar rim par sbyar ro zhes pa ste /
translated: one should apply the mantras for protecting oneself, the place, the disciples, and so forth, in the proper order.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po 'di sngon du bsnyen pa bya ba yang dkyil @197b 'khor gsum du sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po 'di sngon du bsnyen pa bya ba yang dkyil @197b 'khor gsum du sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should also know that the prior approximation of this king of knowledge is to be applied to the three mandalas.

original: slob dpon gnyis su shes par bya //
analyzed: slob dpon gnyis su shes par bya //
translated: One should know the two masters,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: and so forth up to

original: sangs rgyas rkang gnyis gtso bos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rkang gnyis gtso bos so //
translated: the Buddha, chief of two-legged beings.

original: zhes pa'i bar du slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid dang bye brag bshad pa ste /🔽de 'ang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang bye brag bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid dang bye brag bshad pa ste / de 'ang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang bye brag bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the general and specific characteristics of the master.🔽The general characteristics have been explained above.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The specific characteristics are explained here.

original: theg pa gsum 'byed mkhas ba /
analyzed: theg pa gsum 'byed mkhas ba /
translated: The master who is skilled in distinguishing the three vehicles,

original: byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bshad zin to //
translated: who is endowed with the thought of enlightenment, and so on.

original: 'dir ni zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa dang / dmigs pa can gyi bye brag bshad pa ste de bas na /
analyzed: 'dir ni zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa dang / dmigs pa can gyi bye brag bshad pa ste de bas na /
translated: Here, the master is explained as being of two kinds, according to whether he is devoted to the profound and the magnificent, and according to whether he is a conceptualist.

original: de yi mtshan ma rtogs par bya //
analyzed: de yi mtshan ma rtogs par bya //
translated: Therefore, one should understand his characteristics.

original: zab mo dang yang ba yin zhes pa la mos pa'o //
analyzed: zab mo dang yang ba yin zhes pa la mos pa'o //
translated: The master is devoted to the profound and the magnificent.

original: phyag rgya sngags rgyud rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: phyag rgya sngags rgyud rtogs pa ste //
translated: The master is skilled in the knowledge of the seals, mantras, and tantras.

original: zhes pa ni slob dpon gnyis kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid de phyag rgya dang sngags rnams gzhung las ji skad bshad pa bzhin shes pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob dpon gnyis kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid de phyag rgya dang sngags rnams gzhung las ji skad bshad pa bzhin shes pa zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the general characteristic of the two kinds of master. The master is skilled in the knowledge of the seals and mantras as they are explained in the texts.

original: zab ste rgya cher shes par bya //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zab ste rgya cher shes par bya // zhes pa nas /
translated: He is skilled in the knowledge of the profound and the magnificent.🔽He is skilled in the knowledge of the seals, mantras, and tantras.

original: mthong ba'i chos ni rnam par spang ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos ni rnam par spang ba'o //
translated: He is skilled in the knowledge of the profound and the magnificent.🔽He is skilled in the knowledge of the seals, mantras, and tantras.🔽He is skilled in the knowledge of the profound and the magnificent.🔽He is skilled in the knowledge of the seals, mantras, and tantras.🔽He is skilled in the knowledge of the profound and the magnificent.

original: zhes pa'i bar du zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa'i slob dpon gyi bye brag ste zab pa ni stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa la mos pas /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa'i slob dpon gyi bye brag ste zab pa ni stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa la mos pas /
translated: The master who is devoted to the profound and the vast is a particular kind of master.

original: de'i sems kyi rgyud sus kyang rig par mi nus te dpag dka' zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sems kyi rgyud sus kyang rig par mi nus te dpag dka' zhes pa'o //
translated: The profound is the non-apprehension of emptiness, and the mind of one who is devoted to that is not apprehensible by anyone else.

original: rgya chen po'i don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid nam mkha'i rang bzhin lta bur chud pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po'i don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid nam mkha'i rang bzhin lta bur chud pa'o //
translated: The vast is the understanding that ultimately all phenomena are emptiness, which is like the nature of space.

original: kun rdzob tu 'ang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur shes nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu 'ang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur shes nas /
translated: And even conventionally, one should understand that they are like illusions and mirages.

original: mchod pa la sogs pa rgya chen por sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa rgya chen por sbyor ba'o //
translated: And one should engage in the vast, such as making offerings.

original: sems can rnams la yid mi ches pa ni sems can rnams dang / spyod lam mi mthun pas gcig la gcig yid mi rton pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la yid mi ches pa ni sems can rnams dang / spyod lam mi mthun pas gcig la gcig yid mi rton pa'o //
translated: Lack of confidence in sentient beings is the lack of trust in sentient beings, because their behavior is inconsistent.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sras mchog ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sras mchog ste //
translated: The supreme sons of the buddhas

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: are so called because they are in accord with the conduct of the buddhas.

original: 'jig rten na yang ba'i spyod pa dang mi 'gal bar spyod pa ni be'u mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang ba'i spyod pa dang mi 'gal bar spyod pa ni be'u mchog ces bya'o //
translated: The conduct that does not contradict worldly conduct is called the conduct of the supreme calf.

original: mthong ba'i chos ni rnam par spang ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos ni rnam par spang ba'o //
translated: The visible world is to be abandoned.

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi chos rnams lam chags pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi chos rnams lam chags pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the attachment to the phenomena of worldly convention.

original: gnyis po da ltar yis ni zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gnyis po da ltar yis ni zhes pa nas /
translated: The second is from “the present” up to

original: sangs rgyas rkang gnyis gtso bos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rkang gnyis gtso bos so //
translated: the Buddha, the chief of humans.

original: zhes pa'i bar du dmigs pa can gyi slob dpon gyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du dmigs pa can gyi slob dpon gyi bye brag ste /
translated: This is the particular master of the observer.

original: mthong ba yi ni chos kyis su //
analyzed: mthong ba yi ni chos kyis su //
translated: By the visible world

original: mos nas dmigs par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: mos nas dmigs par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: one becomes devoted and observes.

original: zhes pa ni nyan pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa thos shing /
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyan pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa thos shing /
translated: This is the devotion to the mantra tantras and so forth through the wisdom of listening and reflection.

original: bsam pa stong pa'i rang bzhin @198a * //
analyzed: bsam pa stong pa'i rang bzhin @198a * //
translated: Although one is devoted to the nature of emptiness,

original: du mos su zin kyang bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis goms par bya bar mi nus pas /
analyzed: du mos su zin kyang bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis goms par bya bar mi nus pas /
translated: one is unable to cultivate it through the wisdom of meditation.

original: phyi rol gyi spyod pa rnams la mos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi spyod pa rnams la mos par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, one becomes devoted to the external conduct.

original: de 'jig rten gyi dkyil 'khor tshon la sogs pas bri bar bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang bskur zhing lung stsal to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'jig rten gyi dkyil 'khor tshon la sogs pas bri bar bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang bskur zhing lung stsal to zhes pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One conferred empowerment and gave the transmission for drawing the maṇḍala of the world with colors and so forth.

original: 'jig rten gyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni tshon la sogs pas bris nas 'jig rten pa rnams kyi lta ba'i spyod yul du gyur pas 'jig rten gyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya'i mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni tshon la sogs pas bris nas 'jig rten pa rnams kyi lta ba'i spyod yul du gyur pas 'jig rten gyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya'i mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la ni mi bya'o //
translated: The so-called maṇḍala of the world is drawn with colors and so forth and becomes the domain of the view of worldly people, and therefore it is called the maṇḍala of the world. It is not the maṇḍala of tīrthikas and so forth.

original: de bas na slob dpon dmigs pa can gyis phyi rol gyi tshon la sogs pas dkyil 'khor bri bar dbang bskur gyi /
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon dmigs pa can gyis phyi rol gyi tshon la sogs pas dkyil 'khor bri bar dbang bskur gyi /
translated: Therefore, the master who is focused on the external is empowered to draw the maṇḍala with external colors and so forth.

original: sems kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bas yid kyis dkyil 'khor bri bas ni dbang mi bskur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bas yid kyis dkyil 'khor bri bas ni dbang mi bskur ro //
translated: Since he is not under the power of the mind, he is not empowered to draw the maṇḍala with the mind.

original: zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa'i slob dpon de ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor dang / nang gi dkyil 'khor gnyis ka bri bar dbang bskur te phyi rol gyi spyod pa rnams la mi chags shing /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa'i slob dpon de ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor dang / nang gi dkyil 'khor gnyis ka bri bar dbang bskur te phyi rol gyi spyod pa rnams la mi chags shing /
translated: The master who is devoted to the profound and vast is empowered to draw both the external maṇḍala and the internal maṇḍala. He is not attached to external activities and

original: sems kyi dbang du gyur bas nang gi dkyil 'khor bri bar dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang du gyur bas nang gi dkyil 'khor bri bar dbang bskur ro //
translated: Since they are under the power of the mind, they are empowered to draw the inner maṇḍala.

original: slob ma rnams kyi yid dang sbyar ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor yang bri bar gsungs so //🔽slob ma rnams rig bya zhes pa nas /
analyzed: slob ma rnams kyi yid dang sbyar ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor yang bri bar gsungs so // slob ma rnams rig bya zhes pa nas /
translated: In order to apply to the minds of the disciples, the outer maṇḍala is also said to be drawn.🔽The explanation of the different types of disciples, from “the disciples to be known” up to “that disciple is the supreme victor,” is the division of the timely and the untimely.

original: slob ma de ni rgyal ba'i mchog / ces bya ba'i bar du slob ma'i bye brag bshad pa ste dus dang dus ma yin par dbye ba zhes pa ni spyir slob ma rnams pa bzhi slob ma kha cig sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa thos shing shes /
analyzed: slob ma de ni rgyal ba'i mchog / ces bya ba'i bar du slob ma'i bye brag bshad pa ste dus dang dus ma yin par dbye ba zhes pa ni spyir slob ma rnams pa bzhi slob ma kha cig sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa thos shing shes /
translated: In general, there are four types of disciples: Some disciples hear and understand the tantras of mantra, and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyang bsgoms pas ni dkyil 'khor du bcug pa nyid kyi tshe na bsgrub par dbang bskur /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyang bsgoms pas ni dkyil 'khor du bcug pa nyid kyi tshe na bsgrub par dbang bskur /
translated: Since they also cultivate bodhicitta, they are empowered to practice at the time of being admitted into the maṇḍala.

original: byang chub kyi sems dang mi ldan pas kyang slob dpon dmigs pa can gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan na de nyid kyi tshe na slob dpon du dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang mi ldan pas kyang slob dpon dmigs pa can gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan na de nyid kyi tshe na slob dpon du dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Even those who do not have bodhicitta should be empowered as masters at that time if they have the characteristics of a master with a focus.

original: de dag ni gcig ni de'i dus na bsgrub ces pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gcig ni de'i dus na bsgrub ces pa'o //
translated: One is to be accomplished at the time of the first, and the other is to be accomplished at the time of the second.

original: gcig ni sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa thos shing shes kyang byang chub kyi sems ma bsgoms na bsgrub par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gcig ni sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa thos shing shes kyang byang chub kyi sems ma bsgoms na bsgrub par mi rung ste /
translated: The first is that even though one has heard and understood the Mantra Tantra, etc., if one has not cultivated the Thought of Enlightenment, it is not proper to accomplish it.

original: der dkyil 'khor du bcug nas byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa'i thabs bstan te /
analyzed: der dkyil 'khor du bcug nas byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa'i thabs bstan te /
translated: Having been admitted into the mandala there, the method of cultivating the Thought of Enlightenment is taught.

original: byang chub kyi sems goms par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems goms par gyur na /
translated: When one has become accustomed to the Thought of Enlightenment,

original: phyis sgrub par dbang bskur bar bya ba ni gnyis po'i dus na bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: phyis sgrub par dbang bskur bar bya ba ni gnyis po'i dus na bsgrub pa'o //
translated: the subsequent consecration for accomplishment is to be accomplished at the time of the second.

original: de bzhin du slob dpon du dbang bskur na yang sngar sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa ni mi shes na /
analyzed: de bzhin du slob dpon du dbang bskur na yang sngar sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa ni mi shes na /
translated: Similarly, when one is consecrated as a master, if one does not previously know the Mantra Tantra, etc.,

original: der dbang mi bskur bar sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa rdzogs par @198b slob tu bcug ste slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan na /
analyzed: der dbang mi bskur bar sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa rdzogs par @198b slob tu bcug ste slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan na /
translated: one is not consecrated there, but is made to study the Mantra Tantra, etc., completely, and if one is endowed with the characteristics of a master,

original: slob dpon du dbang bskur ba ni gnyis po'i dus na bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon du dbang bskur ba ni gnyis po'i dus na bsgrub pa'o //
translated: the consecration as a master is to be accomplished at the time of the second.

original: de kha cig snga nas kyang rgyud la sogs pa mi shes shing byang chub kyi sems kyang ma bsgoms /
analyzed: de kha cig snga nas kyang rgyud la sogs pa mi shes shing byang chub kyi sems kyang ma bsgoms /
translated: Some, from the beginning, do not know the tantras and so forth, and do not cultivate the thought of awakening.

original: phyis kyang mi slob la /
analyzed: phyis kyang mi slob la /
translated: Later, they do not train,

original: sgom par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor du gzud pa tsam yin gyi dus gnyis kar yang slob dpon dang / bsgrub par dbang mi bskur ba ni gnyis kar ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgom par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor du gzud pa tsam yin gyi dus gnyis kar yang slob dpon dang / bsgrub par dbang mi bskur ba ni gnyis kar ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: and do not meditate. Therefore, they are only admitted into the maṇḍala, but are not given empowerment to practice at both times.

original: mtshan rnams kun ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan rnams kun ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: “ All the characteristics are complete”

original: slob ma de ni rgyal ba'i mchog / ces pa ni rgyud la sogs pa yang rdzogs par shes /
analyzed: slob ma de ni rgyal ba'i mchog / ces pa ni rgyud la sogs pa yang rdzogs par shes /
translated: means that the disciple also completely knows the tantras and so forth.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyang tshul bzhin du bsgoms /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyang tshul bzhin du bsgoms /
translated: The thought of awakening is also properly cultivated.

original: 'ga' zhig bsod nams spel ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor du 'ugs pa de yang slob ma'i grangs su yang gtogs te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bsod nams spel ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor du 'ugs pa de yang slob ma'i grangs su yang gtogs te /
translated: Some are admitted into the maṇḍala in order to increase their merit. They are also counted among the disciples.

original: de ni dbang la sogs pa bskur bas 'dir dbang la sogs pa gdod bskur mi dgos te /
analyzed: de ni dbang la sogs pa bskur bas 'dir dbang la sogs pa gdod bskur mi dgos te /
translated: Since they are given empowerment and so forth, it is not necessary to give them empowerment and so forth here.

original: de ni mtshan rnams kun rdzogs pa //
analyzed: de ni mtshan rnams kun rdzogs pa //
translated: “ All the characteristics are complete”🔽means that they are not given empowerment and so forth at both times.

original: zhes bya'o // da ni thog mar rig bya ba //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // da ni thog mar rig bya ba //
translated: This is the first thing to be understood.🔽

original: zhes pa nas /🔽de bas rtog pa rnams spangs la //
analyzed: zhes pa nas / de bas rtog pa rnams spangs la //
translated: Thus it is.

original: sa kun yang ni sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa kun yang ni sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Now, first, the ground to be purified

original: zhes pa'i bar du sa sbyang bar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du sa sbyang bar bshad pa ste /
translated: is explained from “the ground of the mind” up to🔽“the ground of buddhahood.”

original: sa la phyi nang gi rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sa la phyi nang gi rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The ground is twofold, outer and inner.

original: de la phyi'i sa sbyang ba ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la phyi'i sa sbyang ba ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The purification of the outer ground has already been explained.

original: 'dir ni nang gi sa sbyang bar bshad de /
analyzed: 'dir ni nang gi sa sbyang bar bshad de /
translated: Here, the purification of the inner ground is explained.

original: sems kyi sa zhes bya ba yin //
analyzed: sems kyi sa zhes bya ba yin //
translated: The ground is called the ground of the mind.

original: zhes pa'o // sbyang ba sngon du bshad pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // sbyang ba sngon du bshad pa ste //

original: zhes pa ni sngar byang chub kyi sems rang gi sems ji lta bu nyid du shes pa ste kha dog tu yang ma yin /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar byang chub kyi sems rang gi sems ji lta bu nyid du shes pa ste kha dog tu yang ma yin /
translated: The purification of the ground of the mind is explained first.🔽The purification of the ground

original: dbyibs su yang ma yin zhes pa nas rnam pa thams cad du btsal kyang mi rnyed do zhes pa la sogs pa'i bar du ste de'i tshul du ting nge 'dzin dag pa dang ji bzhin pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rnam rtog dang bral bas na sems kyi dri ma dag pa ste /
analyzed: dbyibs su yang ma yin zhes pa nas rnam pa thams cad du btsal kyang mi rnyed do zhes pa la sogs pa'i bar du ste de'i tshul du ting nge 'dzin dag pa dang ji bzhin pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rnam rtog dang bral bas na sems kyi dri ma dag pa ste /
translated: In that way, since all purity and reality are abandoned, and since it is free from conceptuality, the stains of the mind are purified.

original: de ltar dag par byas nas phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor ram nang gi dkyil 'khor gang yang rung ba bri bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dag par byas nas phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor ram nang gi dkyil 'khor gang yang rung ba bri bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Having purified it in that way, one should draw either an external maṇḍala or an internal maṇḍala.

original: de yis ni yongs su sbyang ba zhes pa ni sngar byang chub kyi sems sbyang ba bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de yis ni yongs su sbyang ba zhes pa ni sngar byang chub kyi sems sbyang ba bshad pa ste /
translated: “Purified” is the previously explained training in bodhicitta.

original: sems kyis sbyang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis sbyang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “Purified by the mind” is the training in the mind.

original: nam zhig nyes dang bral ba ni //
analyzed: nam zhig nyes dang bral ba ni //
translated: “When free from faults”

original: mi 'jigs pa ni sems kyis zhes pa ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi sa'i nyes pa rus pa dang rdo ba la sogs pa med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni sems kyis zhes pa ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi sa'i nyes pa rus pa dang rdo ba la sogs pa med pa bzhin du /
translated: means that just as the faults of the external earth, such as bones and rocks, do not exist,

original: 'dir ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa dang 'dod chags la sogs @199a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa dang 'dod chags la sogs @199a * //
translated: Here, the term “conceptualization” refers to desire and so on.🔽

original: pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral na bgegs la sogs pas skabs mi rnyed pas mi 'jigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral na bgegs la sogs pas skabs mi rnyed pas mi 'jigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, when one is free from the afflictions such as discursive thought and attachment, then the obstacles and so forth do not find an opportunity, and so it is called “fearless.”

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,🔽it is said:

original: gsungs pa de ni dag pa ste //
analyzed: gsungs pa de ni dag pa ste //
translated: That is pure,

original: nyes pa kun dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa kun dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from all faults.

original: zhes pa'o // de bas 'di ltar rig par bya //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de bas 'di ltar rig par bya //
translated: Thus, one should know

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to:

original: rtog pa sdug bsngal rgyud 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa sdug bsngal rgyud 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Discursive thought is the cause of suffering.

original: zhes pa'i bar du phyi rol gyi sa rnams sbyang ba yang byang chub kyi sems dang mi ldan par rtog pa la gnas te sbyong ba ni mi dbang ngo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du phyi rol gyi sa rnams sbyang ba yang byang chub kyi sems dang mi ldan par rtog pa la gnas te sbyong ba ni mi dbang ngo zhes pa ste /
translated: Even the purification of the external grounds is not for one who is not endowed with the thought of awakening, but abides in discursive thought.

original: de las gzhan yang ni zhes pa gong gi sbyang ba las gzhan pa ste phyi'i sa la bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang ni zhes pa gong gi sbyang ba las gzhan pa ste phyi'i sa la bya'o //
translated: “ Other than that” means other than the above purification, which is to be applied to the external grounds.

original: sngags mkhan rtog pa la gnas te //
analyzed: sngags mkhan rtog pa la gnas te //
translated: The mantrin abides in discursive thought.

original: zhes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i dngos por yod par rtogs te sbyang bar bya ba'i sa dang / rus pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yang dngos po yod par rtog cing sa de sbyang na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i dngos por yod par rtogs te sbyang bar bya ba'i sa dang / rus pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yang dngos po yod par rtog cing sa de sbyang na /
translated: as existent things,

original: de byang chub sems dang mi ldan pas de dag par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de byang chub sems dang mi ldan pas de dag par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes pa ste /
translated: then that is not purified by one who is not endowed with the Thought of Enlightenment.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de bas na gsungs pa de bas rnam par spangs pa la sogs pa phyi rol gyi sbyang ba /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa de bas rnam par spangs pa la sogs pa phyi rol gyi sbyang ba /
translated: “Therefore, the external purification of abandonment, etc.,

original: rgya cher bshad pa de yang rtog pa 'ba' zhig gnas nas sbyang ba ngas bshad pa ni byang chub kyi sems sngon du bar sa de sbyang bar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa de yang rtog pa 'ba' zhig gnas nas sbyang ba ngas bshad pa ni byang chub kyi sems sngon du bar sa de sbyang bar bshad pa ste /
translated: is explained as the purification of that stage by me, the teacher, who abides in mere imagination, but the purification of that stage is explained as the purification of that stage by the one who is endowed with the Thought of Enlightenment.”

original: byang chub kyi sems sngon du ba yang ni slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid smos pa nyid na slob dpon shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la mkhas pa theg pa gsum 'byed mkhas pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos pas byang chub kyi sems sngon du🔽rig par bya ste /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la mkhas pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la mkhas par mngon no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems sngon du ba yang ni slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid smos pa nyid na slob dpon shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la mkhas pa theg pa gsum 'byed mkhas pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos pas byang chub kyi sems sngon du rig par bya ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la mkhas pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la mkhas par mngon no //
translated: Also, the master's qualifications mentioned in the first chapter indicate that the master is skilled in the perfection of wisdom and skilled in discerning the three vehicles, and so forth, and so the master's skill in the perfection of wisdom is clearly his skill in the nature of emptiness.

original: theg pa gsum 'byed mkhas pa yang gang zag dang tshes la bdag med pa'i bye brag la mkhas pas stong pa nyid la mkhas par mngon te /
analyzed: theg pa gsum 'byed mkhas pa yang gang zag dang tshes la bdag med pa'i bye brag la mkhas pas stong pa nyid la mkhas par mngon te /
translated: And his skill in discerning the three vehicles is his skill in the distinctions between the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena, and so his skill in discerning the three vehicles is also his skill in emptiness.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi las 'di rnams thams cad kyang slob dpon gyi bya ba byas pas slob dpon de lta bu dang ldan bas sa sbyang bar bya na rtog pa 'ba' zhig la mi gnas kyi byang chub kyi sems dang ldan par 'jig rten pa rnams kyi sems dang
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi las 'di rnams thams cad kyang slob dpon gyi bya ba byas pas slob dpon de lta bu dang ldan bas sa sbyang bar bya na rtog pa 'ba' zhig la mi gnas kyi byang chub kyi sems dang ldan par 'jig rten pa rnams kyi sems dang
translated: If the master, endowed with such qualities, purifies the ground, he does not remain in mere imagination, but in order to purify the minds of worldly people

original: sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: who are endowed with the thought of enlightenment,🔽the Bhagavat has extensively explained the purification of the external grounds.

original: phyi rol gyi sa rnams sbyang bar bcom ldan 'das kyis rgya cher bshad pa de'i dgongs pa de ma mos pa rnams kyis shes par mi 'gyur ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sa rnams sbyang bar bcom ldan 'das kyis rgya cher bshad pa de'i dgongs pa de ma mos pa rnams kyis shes par mi 'gyur ba zhes pa'o //
translated: Those who do not believe in that will not understand the intention of that.

original: gang gis de lta bu'i rtog pa ma spangs pa de ni sangs rgyas dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis de lta bu'i rtog pa ma spangs pa de ni sangs rgyas dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who do not abandon such imagination will not become the cause of Buddhahood and omniscience.

original: @199b de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: @199b de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'jig rten du na sangs rgyas ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa /🔽byang chub sems kyis sbyang ba ru //
analyzed: 'jig rten du na sangs rgyas ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa / byang chub sems kyis sbyang ba ru //
translated: In the world, there is no Buddha, etc.🔽One should purify the disciples

original: slob ma rnams la nan tan bya //
analyzed: slob ma rnams la nan tan bya //
translated: with the thought of enlightenment.

original: zhes pa ni slob ma sbyang ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob ma sbyang ba ste /
translated: This is the purification of the disciples.

original: de yang smon lam gyi byang chub kyi sems dang 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems gnyis kyis sbyang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang smon lam gyi byang chub kyi sems dang 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems gnyis kyis sbyang bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one should train with both the aspiration thought of awakening and the entrance thought of awakening.

original: 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis sngar bsgoms na de yang sbyang ba ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis sngar bsgoms na de yang sbyang ba ste /
translated: If one has previously cultivated the entrance thought of awakening, then that is the training.

original: phyis dkyil 'khor du 'jug kar smon lam gyi byang chub kyi sems sbyin pa dang gnyis kyis sa sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: phyis dkyil 'khor du 'jug kar smon lam gyi byang chub kyi sems sbyin pa dang gnyis kyis sa sbyang ba'o //
translated: Later, at the time of entering the mandala, one should train in the aspiration thought of awakening and the entrance thought of awakening.

original: de ste sngar 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems goms par ma byas na dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe smon lam gyi byang chub kyi sems byin la phyis 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems sgom du gzhug pa ste /
analyzed: de ste sngar 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems goms par ma byas na dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe smon lam gyi byang chub kyi sems byin la phyis 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems sgom du gzhug pa ste /
translated: But if one has not previously cultivated the entrance thought of awakening, then at the time of entering the mandala, one should give the aspiration thought of awakening, and later one should cause one to cultivate the entrance thought of awakening.

original: de ni slob ma rnams byang chub kyi sems kyis sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: de ni slob ma rnams byang chub kyi sems kyis sbyang ba'o //
translated: That is the training of the disciples in the thought of awakening.

original: srung ba mi g-yo mgon po ste //
analyzed: srung ba mi g-yo mgon po ste //
translated: The protector Acala is the protection.

original: yang khams rnams brtul bas zhes pa ni slob ma rnams kyi srung ba ste /
analyzed: yang khams rnams brtul bas zhes pa ni slob ma rnams kyi srung ba ste /
translated: Moreover, “by subduing the elements” is the protection of the disciples.

original: slob ma rnams thog mar nang du 'ong ba'i tsha srung ba dang lhag par gnas pa'i tshe srung ba la sogs pa thams cad 'di gnyis gang yang rung bas bsrung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma rnams thog mar nang du 'ong ba'i tsha srung ba dang lhag par gnas pa'i tshe srung ba la sogs pa thams cad 'di gnyis gang yang rung bas bsrung zhes pa'o //
translated: The protection of the disciples when they first enter, and especially the protection during the consecration, and so on, are all to be done with either of these two.

original: slob ma nam zhig mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: slob ma nam zhig mi g-yo ba //
translated: When the disciples are immovable,🔽and when they are always

original: dmigs pa rnams kyis nam yang rung //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnams kyis nam yang rung //
translated: the objects of observation,

original: de tshe yongs su dag pa ste //
analyzed: de tshe yongs su dag pa ste //
translated: then they are completely pure,

original: nam mkha' dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dri ma med pa'o //
translated: like stainless space.

original: zhes pa ni slob ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ste /
translated: This teaches the characteristics of pure disciples.

original: de yang nam slob ma de sbyor ba la gnas pa'i tshe ting nge 'dzin dag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa spangs pa dang ji bzhin pa nyid dang bral ba ste dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis ka la dmigs pas ma g-yos pa dang /
analyzed: de yang nam slob ma de sbyor ba la gnas pa'i tshe ting nge 'dzin dag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa spangs pa dang ji bzhin pa nyid dang bral ba ste dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis ka la dmigs pas ma g-yos pa dang /
translated: Moreover, when those disciples are abiding in the yoga, they are pure in samadhi, they are free from conceptual thought, and they are unmoved by the objects of observation, whether virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: sbyor ba las langs nas yang mchod pa la sogs pa'i dge ba ni spyod kyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba las langs nas yang mchod pa la sogs pa'i dge ba ni spyod kyi /
translated: When they rise from the yoga, they again practice virtue such as making offerings.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul la dmigs pas mi g-yo bar gyur na de dag pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul la dmigs pas mi g-yo bar gyur na de dag pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa'o //
translated: When it becomes unshakable by focusing on objects such as desire, it is called the characteristic of purity.

original: dri med nam mkha' 'dra'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dri med nam mkha' 'dra'o zhes pa ni /
translated: It is stainless, like space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' cis kyang ma bsdus pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' cis kyang ma bsdus pa'i tshe /
translated: When space is not enclosed by anything,

original: rang bzhin gyis dangs pa dang / glo bur gyi sprin la sogs pas chod na yang nam mkha' rang bzhin dag pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dangs pa dang / glo bur gyi sprin la sogs pas chod na yang nam mkha' rang bzhin dag pa ste /
translated: it is naturally clear, and even when it is obstructed by temporary clouds and so forth, space is naturally pure.

original: de nyams par mi 'gyur ba bzhin du 'di yang ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de nyams par mi 'gyur ba bzhin du 'di yang ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: Just as it is not damaged, when one abides in samādhi,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis la rtog pa'i dri ma med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'i tshe mchod pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa byed kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du @200a * //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis la rtog pa'i dri ma med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'i tshe mchod pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa byed kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du @200a * //
translated: there is no stain of conceptualizing virtue and nonvirtue, and when one rises from samādhi, one engages in conduct such as making offerings, but one does so with the nature of an illusion and so forth.

original: byed de dngos po yod par rtog pa'i dri mas mi gos pa'i phyir ro //🔽byin gyis brlab pa dang po ste //
analyzed: byed de dngos po yod par rtog pa'i dri mas mi gos pa'i phyir ro // byin gyis brlab pa dang po ste //
translated: Because one is not sullied by the stain of conceptualizing things as existent.🔽The first is consecration,

original: yongs su dag ces bya ba yin //
analyzed: yongs su dag ces bya ba yin //
translated: and the second is complete purity.

original: gnyis pos sme skyid bang gis te //
analyzed: gnyis pos sme skyid bang gis te //
translated: The two, the middle and the end, are the two middle ones.

original: gzhan gyi su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi su ni ma yin no //
translated: The other is not.

original: zhes pa ni sngar snying rje chen pos sa yongs su gzung ba'i tshe dkyil 'khor gyis sbyangs pa der /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar snying rje chen pos sa yongs su gzung ba'i tshe dkyil 'khor gyis sbyangs pa der /
translated: This is the discussion here of what was previously said about the purification of the mandala site by great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas lnga bsam pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de nyid 'dir gleng ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga bsam pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de nyid 'dir gleng ste /
translated: The five buddhas are the five colors.

original: rim du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rim du bshad pa ste /
translated: The explanation is in stages.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi sa de dang por sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams der bsams nas byin gyis brlab /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi sa de dang por sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams der bsams nas byin gyis brlab /
translated: First, the Bhagavan Buddhas bless that mandala site by thinking of it.

original: de'i 'og tu sems kyis bdag gi bar gzung /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems kyis bdag gi bar gzung /
translated: After that, one should hold it as one's own with the mind.

original: de'i 'og tu sngags kyis bsrung ba ste de gsum gyis yongs su gzung gi de las gzhan du ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sngags kyis bsrung ba ste de gsum gyis yongs su gzung gi de las gzhan du ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: After that, one should protect it with mantra. It is held by those three, not by anything else.

original: srad bu rnam pa bzhir bshad de //
analyzed: srad bu rnam pa bzhir bshad de //
translated: The four types of string are explained

original: zhes pa nas /🔽lnga po nam mkha' 'dra bar bshad //
analyzed: zhes pa nas / lnga po nam mkha' 'dra bar bshad //
translated: up to🔽the five are explained as being like space.

original: ces pa'i bar du ni sngar tshon lnga'i srad bu zhes spyir bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa'i bar du ni sngar tshon lnga'i srad bu zhes spyir bshad pa ste /
translated: Previously, the five-colored string was explained in general.

original: tshon sna lnga gang yin pa 'dir ming gis smos pa gsal bar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshon sna lnga gang yin pa 'dir ming gis smos pa gsal bar bshad pa'o //
translated: The five colors are mentioned by name here, and are explained clearly.

original: bar snang la ni bzung nas su //
analyzed: bar snang la ni bzung nas su //
translated: Having held it in the space,

original: de yang dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
analyzed: de yang dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
translated: one should draw the maṇḍala there.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor snga ma la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor snga ma la /
translated: This is a general statement about the previous maṇḍala.

original: lte ba'i thad kar srad bu gzung //
analyzed: lte ba'i thad kar srad bu gzung //
translated: The thread should be held at the level of the navel.

original: zhes spyir gsungs kyi dkyil 'khor gar bri bar ma bshad de /
analyzed: zhes spyir gsungs kyi dkyil 'khor gar bri bar ma bshad de /
translated: Although it is explained in general, it is not explained where the maṇḍala is to be drawn.

original: de nyid gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: That is clearly explained:

original: bar snang la srad bu bzung nas bar snang der dkyil 'khor bri zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bar snang la srad bu bzung nas bar snang der dkyil 'khor bri zhes pa'o //
translated: “Having held the thread in space, the maṇḍala should be drawn in that space.”

original: srad bu gnyis pa de yis nam //
analyzed: srad bu gnyis pa de yis nam //
translated: The second thread should be held in the space

original: sa la dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa la dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: and the maṇḍala should be drawn on the ground.

original: zhes pa ni sngar srad bu gnyis po blangs nas kha shar phyogs su blta zhes pa la sogs pa'i spyir smos te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar srad bu gnyis po blangs nas kha shar phyogs su blta zhes pa la sogs pa'i spyir smos te /
translated: Having taken up the two threads, one should face east, and so on.

original: dkyil 'khor nyid gang bris bzhin du ma bshad de /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor nyid gang bris bzhin du ma bshad de /
translated: Although it is explained in general, it is not explained which maṇḍala is to be drawn.

original: de nyid la gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid la gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: That is clearly explained:

original: bar snang la bri zhes pa'i 'og tu srad bu gnyis pa blangs pa des sa la dkyil 'khor bri'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bar snang la bri zhes pa'i 'og tu srad bu gnyis pa blangs pa des sa la dkyil 'khor bri'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The second thread, which is taken below the one that says in space, is the one that says on the ground, a maṇḍala is drawn.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gdan dang ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gdan dang ni /
translated: The seat of all the buddhas

original: de'i sras dpa' bo rnams kyis yang //
analyzed: de'i sras dpa' bo rnams kyis yang //
translated: and also of their heroic sons

original: padmo yid du 'ong mchog ste /
analyzed: padmo yid du 'ong mchog ste /
translated: is the supreme, delightful lotus,

original: kra shi 'jig rten gyis bsngags so //
analyzed: kra shi 'jig rten gyis bsngags so //
translated: praised by the world as a kṛṣṇa.

original: zhes pa ni gdan padmo dkar pos bya'o zhes pa ste /🔽yid las byung ba'i mchog ces pa ni sngar bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gdan padmo dkar pos bya'o zhes pa ste / yid las byung ba'i mchog ces pa ni sngar bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: This means that the seat should be a white lotus.

original: snying gar padmo dkar po bsam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: snying gar padmo dkar po bsam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: The phrase supremely mental refers to the explanation given earlier, when the four branches of repetition were explained, that one should imagine a white lotus in the heart.

original: 'dir padmo dkar po zhes ma bshad pas yid las byung ba'i padmo smos pas yid kyis bsams pa'i padmo dkar po @200b de dang 'dra ba'i gdan bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir padmo dkar po zhes ma bshad pas yid las byung ba'i padmo smos pas yid kyis bsams pa'i padmo dkar po @200b de dang 'dra ba'i gdan bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Here, since it is not explained as a white lotus, by mentioning a mental lotus, it means that one should make a seat that is like that white lotus imagined by the mind.

original: rang rgyal dgra bcom rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: rang rgyal dgra bcom rnams kyis ni //
translated: The pratyekabuddhas and arhats

original: phyogs gcig ces par bsgrags pas na //
analyzed: phyogs gcig ces par bsgrags pas na //
translated: are proclaimed to be in one part,

original: de dag stan du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag stan du rig par bya'o //
translated: and one should know that they are the seats.

original: padmo rnams kyi 'dab ma zhes pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ye shes phyogs gcig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi stan padmo dkar po 'dab ma gcig gi steng du bya zhes pa'o //🔽'jig rten gyi lha rnams la zhes pa nas /🔽rgyal por bsgrags pa de'i stan no //
analyzed: padmo rnams kyi 'dab ma zhes pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ye shes phyogs gcig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi stan padmo dkar po 'dab ma gcig gi steng du bya zhes pa'o // 'jig rten gyi lha rnams la zhes pa nas / rgyal por bsgrags pa de'i stan no //
translated: The petals of the lotuses means that the seats of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who possess one-sided wisdom, should be made on a white lotus with one petal.

original: zhes pa'i bar du 'jig rten pa'i lha tshangs pa la sogs pa rgyal po chen po'i gzugs can de dag 'dod chags dang bcas pas padmo dkar po'i stan du bshad pa'o //🔽lhag ma rnams ni gar rigs par sa'i rim pa las bsam par bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du 'jig rten pa'i lha tshangs pa la sogs pa rgyal po chen po'i gzugs can de dag 'dod chags dang bcas pas padmo dkar po'i stan du bshad pa'o // lhag ma rnams ni gar rigs par sa'i rim pa las bsam par bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: The worldly gods up to the seat of the proclaimed king means that the worldly gods such as Brahmā and so forth, who have the form of great kings, are explained to have seats of white lotuses due to their attachment.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'khor phal ba rnams bla ma'i drung na bla ma dang 'dra ba'i padmo'i stan ni mi rigs pas de las dma' ba'i stan rnams gar rigs par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'khor phal ba rnams bla ma'i drung na bla ma dang 'dra ba'i padmo'i stan ni mi rigs pas de las dma' ba'i stan rnams gar rigs par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: The rest should be understood according to the stages of the ground, as appropriate means that it is not appropriate for the ordinary retinue of the world to have lotus seats equal to the guru in front of the guru, so seats lower than that should be made as appropriate.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi stan 'dir bshad pa yang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi stan 'dir bshad pa yang /
translated: The seats of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and worldly gods explained here

original: 'di rnams dkyil 'khor 'dir ma smos pas zhar la bshad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams dkyil 'khor 'dir ma smos pas zhar la bshad par shes par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as explained incidentally, since they are not mentioned in this maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor bar ma la gshin rje la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi lha rnams smos pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku las sbrul pa sha stag pas padmo'i gdan nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bar ma la gshin rje la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi lha rnams smos pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku las sbrul pa sha stag pas padmo'i gdan nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The worldly gods such as Yama mentioned in the middle maṇḍala should also be understood as lotus seats, since they are emanations solely from the body of the Tathāgata.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ma yin no //
translated: They are not of the worldly ones.

original: mchod pa rnams ba bzhir shes par bya'o zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mchod pa rnams ba bzhir shes par bya'o zhes pa nas /
translated: One should know the four types of offerings, up to

original: 'jig rten gyi rim bzhin du'o zhes pa'i bar du mchod pa rnams bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rim bzhin du'o zhes pa'i bar du mchod pa rnams bshad pa ste /
translated: according to the worldly order.

original: de la spyir mchod pa rnam bzhi ste thal mo sbyar ba dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pa dang yid kyis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyir mchod pa rnam bzhi ste thal mo sbyar ba dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pa dang yid kyis mchod pa'o //
translated: Here, in general, there are four types of offerings: joining the palms, love, compassion, and mental offerings such as flowers, incense, and so on.

original: de la sngags pa zab cing rgya che ba las mchod pa ni mchod pa 'di bzhi char spyod de yid kyi mchod pa yang byed /
analyzed: de la sngags pa zab cing rgya che ba las mchod pa ni mchod pa 'di bzhi char spyod de yid kyi mchod pa yang byed /
translated: The mantra practitioner, from the profound and vast [teachings], performs all four of these offerings: mental offerings,

original: phyi rol gyi mchod pa yang mthong /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mchod pa yang mthong /
translated: outer offerings,

original: dmigs pa can gyi sngags pa ni phyi rol gyi mchod pa rnams byed kyi //
analyzed: dmigs pa can gyi sngags pa ni phyi rol gyi mchod pa rnams byed kyi //
translated: and the mantra practitioner with conceptual [thought] performs outer offerings,

original: ting nge 'dzin mi 'khrugs pas yid kyi mchod pa med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mi 'khrugs pas yid kyi mchod pa med do //
translated: but does not have mental offerings because samādhi is disturbed.

original: byams pa dang snying rje ni nan tan gyis mchod pa ste phyi dang nang gi mchod pa gang yang rung ba byas nas /
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje ni nan tan gyis mchod pa ste phyi dang nang gi mchod pa gang yang rung ba byas nas /
translated: Loving kindness and compassion are the offerings of practice. Having performed any outer or inner offering,

original: sems can rnams la byams pa dang snying rje bskyed nas mchod pa de dag nyid sems can rnams la sngo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la byams pa dang snying rje bskyed nas mchod pa de dag nyid sems can rnams la sngo bar byed pa'o //
translated: one should generate loving kindness and compassion for sentient beings and dedicate those offerings to sentient beings.

original: de la phyi rol gyi mchod pa @201a * //
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi mchod pa @201a * //
translated: Among those, the outer offerings

original: rnams ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnams ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: have already been explained.

original: da 'dir ni yid kyi mchod pa bshad par bya ste /🔽de la / thal sbyar me tog 'gyur ba yis //
analyzed: da 'dir ni yid kyi mchod pa bshad par bya ste / de la / thal sbyar me tog 'gyur ba yis //
translated: Now here, mental offerings will be explained.

original: zhes pa la sogs te de la /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs te de la /
translated: Among those, [the verse] beginning with with joined palms and changing flowers and so forth.

original: thal sbyar me tog 'gyur ba yis //
analyzed: thal sbyar me tog 'gyur ba yis //
translated: With the flower of palms joined,🔽one should offer to the protectors.

original: zhes pa ni de thal mo sbyar ba las me tog 'byung ba des mgon po rnams la gsol zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de thal mo sbyar ba las me tog 'byung ba des mgon po rnams la gsol zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that from the palms joined a flower arises, and with that one should make offerings to the protectors.

original: de nyid dgrol ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid dgrol ba gsungs pa /
translated: The same text explains the gesture:

original: phyag rgya yan lag kun 'byung bas //
analyzed: phyag rgya yan lag kun 'byung bas //
translated: The gesture is the source of all limbs,

original: byang chub sems ni rnam bsgoms nas //🔽zhes pa ste yid kyi mchod pa bya ba yang thog mar bdag gis phyag rgya 'di bcings pas ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mchod pa'i sprin 'byung bar shog cig ces smon lam btab nas stong pa nyid kyi ting
analyzed: byang chub sems ni rnam bsgoms nas // zhes pa ste yid kyi mchod pa bya ba yang thog mar bdag gis phyag rgya 'di bcings pas ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mchod pa'i sprin 'byung bar shog cig ces smon lam btab nas stong pa nyid kyi ting
translated: and one should visualize the spirit of enlightenment.🔽One should make mental offerings, thinking, “Having first bound this gesture, may clouds of offerings arise for the buddhas and bodhisattvas, just as I imagine them.”

original: nge 'dzin du gnas te byang chub kyi sems de mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: nge 'dzin du gnas te byang chub kyi sems de mngon du bya'o //
translated: Having made this aspiration, one should abide in the meditative concentration of emptiness and actualize the spirit of enlightenment.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa nyid na yang yid la nam mkha' mdzod kyi rig pa bzlas te /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa nyid na yang yid la nam mkha' mdzod kyi rig pa bzlas te /
translated: While abiding in that meditative concentration, one should recite the spell of the sky treasury.

original: de nas phyag rgya de las mchod pa rgya chen po 'og nas smos pa rnams char bzhin bab par bsam mo //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya de las mchod pa rgya chen po 'og nas smos pa rnams char bzhin bab par bsam mo //
translated: Then, from that seal, imagine that a great rain of offerings, as will be mentioned below, falls like rain.

original: de ltar bsams nas chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyis brlab /
analyzed: de ltar bsams nas chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyis brlab /
translated: Having imagined that, bless the realm of phenomena.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang dang sngags kyi mthus de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar char bzhin du bab par gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang dang sngags kyi mthus de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar char bzhin du bab par gyur te /
translated: By the power of samādhi and the power of mantra, at that time, it falls like rain in the presence of the buddhas.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de ni nyes med me tog ste //
analyzed: de ni nyes med me tog ste //
translated: That is the faultless flower.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rjes su bsngags pa dang bcas par gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rjes su bsngags pa dang bcas par gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said with praise, and so forth.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi lha rnams la //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi lha rnams la //
translated: For the remaining deities,

original: zhes pa nas rnam par soms shig / gar rigs par zhes pa'i bar du gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor tshon gyis bris pa'i lha rnams la phyi'i mchod pa me tog la sogs pa dbul ba'i rim pa bstan pa ste so so'i sngags kyis btab nas thog mar bcom
analyzed: zhes pa nas rnam par soms shig / gar rigs par zhes pa'i bar du gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor tshon gyis bris pa'i lha rnams la phyi'i mchod pa me tog la sogs pa dbul ba'i rim pa bstan pa ste so so'i sngags kyis btab nas thog mar bcom
translated: up to imagine as appropriate, the stages of offering external flowers and so forth to the deities of the maṇḍala of images drawn with colors are taught. Having empowered them with individual mantras, first offer to the principal deity.

original: ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs mchod de /
analyzed: ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs mchod de /
translated: Having worshipped the Tathagata's family, beginning with the Lord Vairocana,

original: de nas padmo'i rigs la sogs pa la rim bzhin du mchod pa byas te de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas padmo'i rigs la sogs pa la rim bzhin du mchod pa byas te de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: then, having worshipped the lotus family, etc. , in order, he should worship the worldlings,

original: gang du ji ltar rim bzhin du //
analyzed: gang du ji ltar rim bzhin du //
translated: as it is said, wherever, in whatever order, etc. .🔽Having worshipped the worldlings, he should worship the Tathagatas,🔽as it is said, having worshipped the worldlings, etc. .🔽Having worshipped the Tathagatas, he should worship the Bodhisattvas,🔽as it is said, having worshipped the Tathagatas, etc. .🔽Having worshipped the Bodhisattvas, he should worship the worldlings,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: as it is said, having worshipped the Bodhisattvas, etc. .

original: mthe bong srin lag rtse sbyar te //
analyzed: mthe bong srin lag rtse sbyar te //
translated: Having worshipped the worldlings, he should worship the Tathagatas,🔽as it is said, having worshipped the worldlings, etc. .🔽Having worshipped the Tathagatas, he should worship the Bodhisattvas,🔽as it is said, having worshipped the Tathagatas, etc. .🔽Having worshipped the Bodhisattvas, he should worship the worldlings,

original: zhes pa nas 'jig rten gyi sde rim bzhin du'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes pa nas 'jig rten gyi sde rim bzhin du'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: as it is said, having worshipped the Bodhisattvas, etc. .🔽Having worshipped the worldlings, he should worship the Tathagatas,

original: mchod pa rnams dbul ba'i thabs bstan pa ste me tog dbul bar gsungs pa /🔽mthe bong srin lag rtse sbyar nas //
analyzed: mchod pa rnams dbul ba'i thabs bstan pa ste me tog dbul bar gsungs pa / mthe bong srin lag rtse sbyar nas //
translated: as it is said, having worshipped the worldlings, etc. .🔽Having worshipped the Tathagatas, he should worship the Bodhisattvas,🔽as it is said, having worshipped the Tathagatas, etc. .🔽Having worshipped the Bodhisattvas, he should worship the worldlings,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi lha rnams @201b las gzhan ni lte ba'i thad kar rig par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi lha rnams @201b las gzhan ni lte ba'i thad kar rig par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: as it is said, having worshipped the Bodhisattvas, etc. .🔽Having worshipped the worldlings, he should worship the Tathagatas,

original: 'jig rten zhes pa ni 'dir gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes pa ni 'dir gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams la bya ste /
translated: as it is said, having worshipped the worldlings, etc. .

original: de'i lha rnams la lte ba'i thad ka nas me tog dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lha rnams la lte ba'i thad ka nas me tog dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Having worshipped the Tathagatas, he should worship the Bodhisattvas,🔽as it is said, having worshipped the Tathagatas, etc. .🔽Having worshipped the Bodhisattvas, he should worship the worldlings,🔽as

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid kyi dkyil 'khor rnams la ni snying ga nas dbul bar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid kyi dkyil 'khor rnams la ni snying ga nas dbul bar bshad pa'o //
translated: For the supramundane mind maṇḍalas, it is explained that one should offer from the heart.

original: bdug pa khu tshur rdo rjes so //
analyzed: bdug pa khu tshur rdo rjes so //
translated: One should offer incense with the vajra fist,

original: yang na padmo phreng gis te //
analyzed: yang na padmo phreng gis te //
translated: or else with the lotus garland.

original: bar snang la ni bzung nas su //
analyzed: bar snang la ni bzung nas su //
translated: Having held it in the space,

original: 'jig rten mgon po rnams la'o //🔽zhes pa ni bdug pa gsol ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i khu tshur ram /🔽padmo'i phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po rnams la'o // zhes pa ni bdug pa gsol ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i khu tshur ram / padmo'i phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: for the lords of the world.🔽One should offer incense by forming the vajra fist or the lotus gesture.

original: pog snod can du byas na ni rdo rje khu tshur gyis gzung /
analyzed: pog snod can du byas na ni rdo rje khu tshur gyis gzung /
translated: If one makes a vessel for incense, one should hold it with the vajra fist.🔽If it is a clay pot, one should hold it with the lotus gesture.

original: kham phor ni padma'i phyag rgyas bzung ste yid kyi dkyil 'khor lha rnams la bar snang la stod de bzung nas gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kham phor ni padma'i phyag rgyas bzung ste yid kyi dkyil 'khor lha rnams la bar snang la stod de bzung nas gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: One should offer it to the mind maṇḍala deities, having held it in the space.🔽For the deities of the reflected image maṇḍala, one should offer it from the level of the navel.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor lha rnams la lte ba'i thad ka nas rim bzhin du gsol zhes pa ste de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor lha rnams la lte ba'i thad ka nas rim bzhin du gsol zhes pa ste de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de las lha rnams gzhan dag ni //
analyzed: de las lha rnams gzhan dag ni //
translated: For the other deities,

original: 'jig rten gyi rim bzhin du zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rim bzhin du zhes pa'o //
translated: as in the world.

original: sbyin sreg gnyis su rig par bya ste zhes pa nas /
analyzed: sbyin sreg gnyis su rig par bya ste zhes pa nas /
translated: The two fire sacrifices should be known.

original: sngags kyi shes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi shes pa med pa'o //
translated: He does not know the mantra.

original: zhes pa'i bar du phyi nang gnyis kyi sbyin sreg bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du phyi nang gnyis kyi sbyin sreg bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the external and internal fire sacrifices.

original: de la phyi'i sbyin sreg ni bsreg par bya ste /
analyzed: de la phyi'i sbyin sreg ni bsreg par bya ste /
translated: The external fire sacrifice is to be sacrificed,

original: sreg pa'i me la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa la ltos pa'o//
analyzed: sreg pa'i me la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa la ltos pa'o//
translated: the fire of the sacrifice, and so forth, in dependence on external things such as form.

original: nang gi sbyin sreg ni de rnams ni sems nyid kyis bya ste /
analyzed: nang gi sbyin sreg ni de rnams ni sems nyid kyis bya ste /
translated: The internal fire sacrifice is to be done by the mind itself,

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa la ltos pa ma yin te de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa la ltos pa ma yin te de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: not in dependence on external form and so forth. Therefore it is said:

original: las dang skye ba rnam par bral //
analyzed: las dang skye ba rnam par bral //
translated: Free from action and birth.

original: zhes pa ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams 'jig par byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis chos rnams stong pa zhig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams 'jig par byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis chos rnams stong pa zhig ste /
translated: The mind of enlightenment that destroys the phenomena of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so forth, is empty of phenomena.

original: las dang skye ba la sogs pa dmigs su med par rab tu mi 'pho ba'i shes rab kyis chud de yid la phung po la sogs pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dmigs su med par gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: las dang skye ba la sogs pa dmigs su med par rab tu mi 'pho ba'i shes rab kyis chud de yid la phung po la sogs pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dmigs su med par gyur pa de ni /
translated: The wisdom that does not transfer to the non-perception of karma, birth, and so on, and that is not burned by the fire of wisdom, is the wisdom that does not transfer to the non-perception of the causes and effects of the aggregates and so on, and of the mind and mental factors.

original: las dang skye ba rnam par bral //
analyzed: las dang skye ba rnam par bral //
translated: That is free from karma and birth.

original: zhes bya ba ste de la sreg par byed pa'i bar du mi 'pho ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste de la sreg par byed pa'i bar du mi 'pho ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: There, the wisdom that does not transfer to burning is the wisdom that does not transfer to the non-perception of the aggregates and so on, and of the mind and mental factors.

original: sreg par byed pa ni las dang skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sreg par byed pa ni las dang skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Burning is karma, birth, and so on.

original: sreg pa'i me ni ji bzhin pa dang bral ba'i yid la bya'o //🔽sa bon du ni phyis 'gyur zhes pa ni las dang skye ba sred pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas snying rje'i @202a * //
analyzed: sreg pa'i me ni ji bzhin pa dang bral ba'i yid la bya'o // sa bon du ni phyis 'gyur zhes pa ni las dang skye ba sred pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas snying rje'i @202a * //
translated: The fire of burning is the mental activity of being free from just as it is.

original: dbang gis lha'i gzugs su bya ba la bya ste /
analyzed: dbang gis lha'i gzugs su bya ba la bya ste /
translated: Seeds later arise means that, having arisen from that concentration of emptiness that has the characteristic of craving for karma and birth, through the power of compassion, one should act in the form of a deity.

original: bdag gi lha gang yin pa'i sngags kyi sa bon las lhar bsgyur ba'i rim pa ji skad du gsungs pa'i tshul gyis bdag nyid kyi lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba la bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi lha gang yin pa'i sngags kyi sa bon las lhar bsgyur ba'i rim pa ji skad du gsungs pa'i tshul gyis bdag nyid kyi lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba la bya ste /
translated: The transformation of oneself into the form of one's deity is done by means of the seed syllable of the mantra of one's deity, in the manner described.

original: de la dang po phung po la sogs pa 'jig pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de la dang po phung po la sogs pa 'jig pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The awakening mind of the first stage, which is the destruction of the aggregates and so forth, is the entering awakening mind.

original: ji ltar 'jig cing rtog pa de yang spangs te rab tu mi 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig cing rtog pa de yang spangs te rab tu mi 'phro ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of such destruction and conceptualization, and the complete absence of proliferation, is the abiding awakening mind.

original: shes rab rnam par mi rtog pa las dang skye ba sreg par byed pa so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par mi rtog pa las dang skye ba sreg par byed pa so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The wisdom that is nonconceptual, that burns karma and birth, and that abides in the nature of self-cognizance is the awakening mind.

original: slar rang gi sa bon las lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba ni ldang ba'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: slar rang gi sa bon las lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba ni ldang ba'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The transformation into the form of one's deity from one's seed syllable is the rising awakening mind.

original: las su 'dod pas sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: las su 'dod pas sbyin sreg bya //
translated: One should perform the fire sacrifice with the desire for the result.

original: zhes pa ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las rnams grub par 'dod pa'i phyir dang nang gi sbyin sreg de bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las rnams grub par 'dod pa'i phyir dang nang gi sbyin sreg de bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: This is because one should perform that inner fire sacrifice in order to accomplish the activities of pacifying, increasing and so on.

original: mtshan ma can gyis mtshan ma dang bcas par 'grub /
analyzed: mtshan ma can gyis mtshan ma dang bcas par 'grub /
translated: One with signs accomplishes that with signs.

original: mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa gnyis ka 'grub /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa gnyis ka 'grub /
translated: One without signs accomplishes both that with signs and that without signs.

original: bya ba dang sbyar te nang gi sbyin sreg phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa la ltos par mtshan ma med pa des kyang shing la sogs pa mtshan ma dang bcas pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang sbyar te nang gi sbyin sreg phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa la ltos par mtshan ma med pa des kyang shing la sogs pa mtshan ma dang bcas pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: In connection with the activities, that inner fire sacrifice which is dependent on external form and so on, that without signs, will also produce the arising of those with signs such as wood.

original: phyi rol gyi gsum ldan zhing zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi sbyin sreg byed pa na gsum dang ldan par bya ba ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon par spyod pa'i las gang yang rung ba'i kha dog dang tshul du ldan par bya ba dang rdzas rnams
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gsum ldan zhing zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi sbyin sreg byed pa na gsum dang ldan par bya ba ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon par spyod pa'i las gang yang rung ba'i kha dog dang tshul du ldan par bya ba dang rdzas rnams
translated: The external one is in a place with three features. When performing the external fire sacrifice, one should have three features. One should have the color and manner of any activity such as pacifying, increasing or acting. The substances

original: kyang de'i kha dog dang ldan par bsam pa dang / bdag nyid kyang de'i kha dog dang mtshungs shing ldan pa'i lhar bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: kyang de'i kha dog dang ldan par bsam pa dang / bdag nyid kyang de'i kha dog dang mtshungs shing ldan pa'i lhar bsgyur ba ste /
translated: Also, one should imagine that one has the same color as the deity.

original: de ltar me dang rdzas dang bdag gsum zhib la sogs pa'i las gang yang rung ba'i kha dog dang tshul du ldan par bya ba gsum dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar me dang rdzas dang bdag gsum zhib la sogs pa'i las gang yang rung ba'i kha dog dang tshul du ldan par bya ba gsum dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should have the three: the color of the fire, the color of the substance, and the color of oneself as the deity.

original: gsum dang ldan pa zhes pa ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon par spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor dbang chen dang chu dang rlung gi gnas gsum dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gsum dang ldan pa zhes pa ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon par spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor dbang chen dang chu dang rlung gi gnas gsum dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The three are the three places of the maṇḍala of pacifying, increasing, and overpowering, which are the great maṇḍala of fire, water, and wind.
