original: gsum la gnas te zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i zhugs thab zlum po dang gru bzhi dang / gru gsum po la bsreg pa'i rdzas la sogs pa gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsum la gnas te zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i zhugs thab zlum po dang gru bzhi dang / gru gsum po la bsreg pa'i rdzas la sogs pa gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: The three places are the hearth of pacifying, and so on, which are round, square, and triangular.

original: las gsum ni gnas grub pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: las gsum ni gnas grub pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The three activities are the three activities of pacifying, increasing, and overpowering.

original: zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon par spyod pa'i 'bras bu gsum 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon par spyod pa'i 'bras bu gsum 'grub pa'o //
translated: The three results are the three results of pacifying, increasing, and overpowering.

original: phyi nang gang yang rung ba'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga de las gzhan du byas na de @202b dag gi 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi nang gang yang rung ba'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga de las gzhan du byas na de @202b dag gi 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one performs the rite of fire sacrifice, whether outer or inner, in any way other than that, one will not obtain the result of those.

original: de bas na gnyis ka'i spyir gsungs pa gang gis gzhan du byas na ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis ka'i spyir gsungs pa gang gis gzhan du byas na ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said in the general teaching for both, “If one performs in any other way than that,” and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i sngags dang zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i sngags dang zhes pa nas /
translated: The Tathāgata’s mantra,

original: lha rnams kyang de bzhin te zhes pa'i bar du sngags kyi lha la sogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs dang tshad rnams bshad pa ste /
analyzed: lha rnams kyang de bzhin te zhes pa'i bar du sngags kyi lha la sogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs dang tshad rnams bshad pa ste /
translated: up to the gods are also like that, explains the color, shape, and size of the mantra deities, and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa /
translated: The Tathāgata’s praise,

original: sangs rgyas rdzogs par gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdzogs par gsungs pa ni //
translated: the perfect Buddha’s teaching,

original: dkar dang ser du rig par bya //
analyzed: dkar dang ser du rig par bya //
translated: should be known as white and yellow.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid zhi ba'i rang bzhin pas kha dog dkar por rig par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid zhi ba'i rang bzhin pas kha dog dkar por rig par bya'o zhes so //
translated: This means that the Tathāgata’s family is the nature of peace, the characteristic of the complete purity of all phenomena, and should be known as the color white.

original: sangs rgyas rdzogs par gsungs zhes pa ni sh'akya thub pa dang 'phags pa 'jam dpal la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' kun du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdzogs par gsungs zhes pa ni sh'akya thub pa dang 'phags pa 'jam dpal la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' kun du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The perfect Buddhas are the Bodhisattvas who are fully enlightened, such as Sakyamuni and the noble Manjusri.

original: de dag ni ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs nas sems can gyi don la sogs pa spyod pas na tshogs mdzad de /
analyzed: de dag ni ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs nas sems can gyi don la sogs pa spyod pas na tshogs mdzad de /
translated: They perform the accumulation because they rise from samadhi and engage in the welfare of sentient beings, etc.

original: rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid pas kha dog ser por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid pas kha dog ser por rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the increasing is yellow in color, because it has the characteristic of increase.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i thams cad du //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i thams cad du //
translated: In all the rites of Vajrapani,

original: zhes pa ni phyag na rdo rje bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin sems can gyi don spyod pa thams cad pas kha dog thams cad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyag na rdo rje bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin sems can gyi don spyod pa thams cad pas kha dog thams cad du rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that the color is all colors, because Vajrapani, the nature of the gnosis of successful activities, engages in the welfare of sentient beings in all ways.

original: 'jig rten dbang po'i sngags rnams ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang po'i sngags rnams ni //
translated: The mantras of Lokesvara

original: dkar te las kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: dkar te las kyi rim pa'o //
translated: are white, in the order of the activities.

original: zhes pa ni spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin chos thams cad 'khru bar byed pa'i bdag nyid pas kha dog dkar por shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin chos thams cad 'khru bar byed pa'i bdag nyid pas kha dog dkar por shes par bya'o //
translated: It is said that the mandala of the earth is square,

original: gru bzhi ldan par gdon mi za //🔽zlum por yang ni rim bzhin te //
analyzed: gru bzhi ldan par gdon mi za // zlum por yang ni rim bzhin te //
translated: and the mandala of water is round.🔽The mandala of fire is triangular, and the mandala of wind is like a half-vajra.

original: zla ba kham 'dra khru gsum du /
analyzed: zla ba kham 'dra khru gsum du /
translated: The mandala of the sky is like a half-moon, and the mandala of the mind is three cubits.

original: de 'dra dbyibs zhes sgrogs pa yin //
analyzed: de 'dra dbyibs zhes sgrogs pa yin //
translated: Such are the shapes that are proclaimed.

original: zhes pa ni lha de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor dbang chen la sogs pa'i dbyibs bshad pa ste rim bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor dbang chen la sogs pa'i dbyibs bshad pa ste rim bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: This explains the shapes of the mandalas of those deities, such as the great earth and so forth, which should be known in order.

original: gzugs ni gnyis su rig par bya //
analyzed: gzugs ni gnyis su rig par bya //
translated: The forms of the deities should be known as twofold:

original: bud med dang ni skyes par ro //
analyzed: bud med dang ni skyes par ro //
translated: female and male.

original: zhes pa ni lha rnams kyi gzugs bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha rnams kyi gzugs bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the forms of the deities.

original: de la lha rnams kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la lha rnams kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the deities are also threefold:

original: rnam par smin pa'i gzugs dang gnas yongs su gyur pa dang sprul pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i gzugs dang gnas yongs su gyur pa dang sprul pa ste /
translated: the form of karmic ripening, the form of the transformed basis, and the form of emanation.

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i gzugs ni rang gi las dang bsod nams las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i gzugs ni rang gi las dang bsod nams las skyes pa'o //
translated: The form of karmic maturation arises from one's own karma and merit.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa ni bsgrubs pa las grub pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa ni bsgrubs pa las grub pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The transformed basis is the form established by accomplishment.

original: sprul pa ni ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i dbang gis yid la @203a * //
analyzed: sprul pa ni ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i dbang gis yid la @203a * //
translated: Emanation is the mental transformation through the power of samadhi and so on.

original: bsams par gyur pa ste de dag la la ni skyes par snang /
analyzed: bsams par gyur pa ste de dag la la ni skyes par snang /
translated: Some of those appear as men,

original: la la ni bud med du snang ba'o //
analyzed: la la ni bud med du snang ba'o //
translated: some appear as women.

original: yang na kun du thams cad kyang //
analyzed: yang na kun du thams cad kyang //
translated: Or else, all of them

original: kha dog gzugs dang dbyibs rnams ni //
analyzed: kha dog gzugs dang dbyibs rnams ni //
translated: are colors, forms, and shapes.

original: zhes pa yang na gong du kha dog dkar gnag la sogs pa smos pa dang dbyibs gru bzhi la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes pa yang na gong du kha dog dkar gnag la sogs pa smos pa dang dbyibs gru bzhi la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Or else, the colors mentioned above such as white and black and the shapes such as square are mentioned.

original: gzugs bud med dang skyes par smos pa de dag chad pa med de /
analyzed: gzugs bud med dang skyes par smos pa de dag chad pa med de /
translated: The forms mentioned as female and male are not excluded.

original: de dag kun kyang kha dog thams cad dang dbyibs thams cad dang gzugs thams cad du shes par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kun kyang kha dog thams cad dang dbyibs thams cad dang gzugs thams cad du shes par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: All of those should be known as all colors, all shapes, and all forms.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is that? It is said:

original: bsam yas ye shes las byung bas //
analyzed: bsam yas ye shes las byung bas //
translated: Arising from inconceivable wisdom.

original: de bas de yang bsam yas te //
analyzed: de bas de yang bsam yas te //
translated: Therefore, they are also inconceivable.

original: zhes pa ste de thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes bsam du med par 'byung ba sha stag gi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa chad pa med pas bsam du med do //
analyzed: zhes pa ste de thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes bsam du med par 'byung ba sha stag gi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa chad pa med pas bsam du med do //
translated: All of these are inconceivable because of the absence of color, shape, etc. , which arise from the inconceivable intuition of reality.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can don byed tha dad pas //
analyzed: sems can don byed tha dad pas //
translated: Because of the different ways of working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: ye shes mkhas pas rtag tu mkhyen //
analyzed: ye shes mkhas pas rtag tu mkhyen //
translated: The wise know them always through intuition.

original: zhes pa ste de dag kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa spyad pa med pa yang sems can gyi don sna tshogs la mkhas pa'i ye shes des gdul ba'i 'gro ba dang rjes su mthun pa gzugs la sogs pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ste de dag kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa spyad pa med pa yang sems can gyi don sna tshogs la mkhas pa'i ye shes des gdul ba'i 'gro ba dang rjes su mthun pa gzugs la sogs pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they are devoid of color, shape, etc. , the wise know them always through intuition skilled in the various ways of working for the benefit of sentient beings, because they manifest form, etc. , in accordance with the inclinations of the beings to be trained.

original: ji tsam rgya cher yid gyur pa //
analyzed: ji tsam rgya cher yid gyur pa //
translated: To the extent that the mind is transformed,

original: de yi tshad du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yi tshad du shes par bya'o //
translated: to that extent should one know the measure.

original: stan rnams dang ni phyag rgya dang // lha rnams go rims kyang de bzhin //
analyzed: stan rnams dang ni phyag rgya dang // lha rnams go rims kyang de bzhin //
translated: The seats, the seals, and the deities are also in that order.

original: zhes pa ni lha la sogs pa'i tshad bshad pa ste nang du yid la bsam pa'am phyi rol du bri ba la sogs pa kun kyang yid la ji tsam du 'dod pa de tsam du bsam pa'am bri bar bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha la sogs pa'i tshad bshad pa ste nang du yid la bsam pa'am phyi rol du bri ba la sogs pa kun kyang yid la ji tsam du 'dod pa de tsam du bsam pa'am bri bar bya zhes pa'o //
translated: This explains the measure of the deities, etc. All of them, whether imagined in the mind or drawn externally, should be imagined or drawn to the extent that one desires.

original: lha rnams rim kyang de bzhin te //
analyzed: lha rnams rim kyang de bzhin te //
translated: The sequence of the deities is also like that.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du bri ba'i lha rnams kyang snying po'i dkyil 'khor du bri ba rnams ni dkyil 'khor sa'i zheng che bas lha'i gzugs kyang che bar bya /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du bri ba'i lha rnams kyang snying po'i dkyil 'khor du bri ba rnams ni dkyil 'khor sa'i zheng che bas lha'i gzugs kyang che bar bya /
translated: This explains that the deities drawn in the mandala, those drawn in the essence mandala, should be drawn as large as possible due to the vastness of the mandala ground.

original: de'i go rims kyang de bzhin du rim gyis chud par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i go rims kyang de bzhin du rim gyis chud par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Their sequence should also be gradually adjusted accordingly.

original: sangs rgyas gang las byung ba nas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gang las byung ba nas //
translated: From which buddha did the mudra arise?

original: phyag rgya'ang de nas byung zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya gang nas byung ba'i khungs bshad pa sta /
analyzed: phyag rgya'ang de nas byung zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya gang nas byung ba'i khungs bshad pa sta /
translated: This explains the origin of the mudra.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings las byung ba'i phyag rgya des bdag dang slob ma la sogs pa lha'i lus byin gyis brlab pa dang / phyag rgya des slob ma la sogs pa bsrung ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings las byung ba'i phyag rgya des bdag dang slob ma la sogs pa lha'i lus byin gyis brlab pa dang / phyag rgya des slob ma la sogs pa bsrung ba ste /
translated: By that seal which arises from the Dharma-dhātu of the Buddhas, the consecration of the body of oneself, the disciples, and so on, as the body of a deity, and by that seal, the protection of the disciples, and so on.🔽If they are protected, they are sealed with the character of the Dharma-dhātu, and so cannot be harmed by anything, just as a person who has the seal of a world-conquering king cannot be harmed by anyone.

original: de bsrungs na chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid kyis btab pas cis kyang mi tshugs par 'gyur ba ni 'jig @203b rten rgyal po'i rgya dang ldan pa'i skyes bu la sus kyang gtse bar mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o zhes sngar yang zhib tu bshad do //
analyzed: de bsrungs na chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid kyis btab pas cis kyang mi tshugs par 'gyur ba ni 'jig @203b rten rgyal po'i rgya dang ldan pa'i skyes bu la sus kyang gtse bar mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o zhes sngar yang zhib tu bshad do //
translated: This has been explained in detail above.

original: de bas chos dbyings mdo ru ni //
analyzed: de bas chos dbyings mdo ru ni //
translated: Therefore, in the Dharma-dhātu Sūtra,

original: phyag rgya'i mtshan ma zhes kyang bya //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i mtshan ma zhes kyang bya //
translated: It is also called the seal-sign.

original: zhes pa ni mdor na phyag rgya rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mdor na phyag rgya rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: In brief, it should be understood that the seals are the sign of the Dharma-dhātu.

original: dbang sbyin rnam gsum rig par bya //
analyzed: dbang sbyin rnam gsum rig par bya //
translated: The empowerment should be known as threefold.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: de'i sngags bsgrags pa yin zhes pa'i bar du dbang bskur ba rnam pa gsum bshad pa ste phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba /
analyzed: de'i sngags bsgrags pa yin zhes pa'i bar du dbang bskur ba rnam pa gsum bshad pa ste phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba /
translated: the empowerment of the master,🔽and the empowerment of the disciple.🔽The empowerment of the seal is explained in the first two lines:

original: de ni las dang bya ba ste //
analyzed: de ni las dang bya ba ste //
translated: The empowerment of the seal is the activity of the master.

original: zhes pa ni snying rje chen po las 'byung ba dang / yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor du nam slob dpon dang slob ma rgya che ba la mos pa dag / phyag rgyas dbang bskur bar bya bar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni snying rje chen po las 'byung ba dang / yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor du nam slob dpon dang slob ma rgya che ba la mos pa dag / phyag rgyas dbang bskur bar bya bar bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the empowerment of the seal, which is conferred on the master and disciple of the mandala of the wheel of syllables who are devoted to the extensive path, who arise from great compassion, and who are conferred empowerment in the mandala of the wheel of syllables.

original: dkyil 'khor de gnyis gang yang rung ba'i mdun du dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / bum pa la sogs pa la mi ltos par kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i phyag rgya dang 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de gnyis gang yang rung ba'i mdun du dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / bum pa la sogs pa la mi ltos par kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i phyag rgya dang 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The empowerment of the seal is conferred in front of either of the two mandalas, the mandala of the wheel of syllables and the mandala of the great maṇḍala, without relying on the vase empowerment and so on, by the mudra of the bodhisattvas such as Samantabhadra and so on, and by the mudras that will be explained below.

original: las dang bya bar bral zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba'i bum pa dang dkyil 'khor dang dung dang 'khor lo la sogs pa'i cho ga rnams dang bral ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: las dang bya bar bral zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba'i bum pa dang dkyil 'khor dang dung dang 'khor lo la sogs pa'i cho ga rnams dang bral ba zhes pa'o //
translated: Free from action and performance means free from the rites of the vase, maṇḍala, conch, wheel, and so on, of conferring empowerment.

original: gnyis po kun gyi gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: gnyis po kun gyi gsungs pa ni //
translated: The speech of both is

original: las dang bya ba las byung zhes pa ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba dang / yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor bris nas /
analyzed: las dang bya ba las byung zhes pa ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba dang / yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor bris nas /
translated: The arising of great compassion and the maṇḍala of the wheel of syllables are the arising of the maṇḍala of empowerment in front.

original: ji skad du sngar gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin du dbang bskur gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin du dbang bskur gsungs pa'o //
translated: As it was said before, the empowerment is conferred according to the rite.

original: gsum po yid kyis rig par bya //
analyzed: gsum po yid kyis rig par bya //
translated: The third is to be understood mentally.

original: dus dang dus yul spangs pa'o//
analyzed: dus dang dus yul spangs pa'o//
translated: The time and place are abandoned.

original: zhes pa ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du yid kyis dbang bskur ba ste dngos kyi 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du yid kyis dbang bskur ba ste dngos kyi 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The mental conferral of empowerment in the secret maṇḍala is the actual [empowerment] that arises below.

original: bla ma tshul bzhin rim gro byas //
analyzed: bla ma tshul bzhin rim gro byas //
translated: Having properly served the guru,

original: ji ltar phan par bstan pa ni //
analyzed: ji ltar phan par bstan pa ni //
translated: the benefit is taught.

original: dbang bskur ba'o zhes sangs rgyas pa //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'o zhes sangs rgyas pa //
translated: The empowerment is said to be buddhahood.

original: de ni bsngags shing bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: de ni bsngags shing bsgrags pa yin //
translated: That is praised and proclaimed.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gong ma gnyis su phyag rgyas dbang bskur nas rjes su gnang ba'i tshig smras pa la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gong ma gnyis su phyag rgyas dbang bskur nas rjes su gnang ba'i tshig smras pa la bya ste /
translated: This refers to the words of permission spoken after the empowerment is conferred with the seal in the two higher mandalas.

original: phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba'i 'og tu slob dpon slob ma'i nan tan dang rim gro la sogs pas mgu nas /
analyzed: phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba'i 'og tu slob dpon slob ma'i nan tan dang rim gro la sogs pas mgu nas /
translated: After the empowerment with the seal, the master, pleased with the disciple's diligence, service, and so forth,

original: khyod kyis deng phan chad chos kyi 'khor lo bskor cig ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu shes par bya'o //🔽phyag rgyas @204a * //
analyzed: khyod kyis deng phan chad chos kyi 'khor lo bskor cig ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu shes par bya'o // phyag rgyas @204a * //
translated: should understand the words, From now on, you should turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: dbang bskur ba dang po dang dbang bskur ba gnyis pa ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba dang yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor du bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang po dang dbang bskur ba gnyis pa ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba dang yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor du bya'o //
translated: The first empowerment with the seal and the second empowerment should be performed in the mandala of the origin of great compassion and the mandala of the wheel of letters.

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du ni yid kyis dbang bskur ba dngos su gsungs pas /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du ni yid kyis dbang bskur ba dngos su gsungs pas /
translated: In the secret mandala, the mental empowerment is actually taught,

original: gong ma gnyis mi bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma gnyis mi bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: so it should be understood that the two higher ones are not performed.

original: 'di rnams kyang 'dir tshig tsam bshad kyi don gtan la dbab par bsdus pa'i don nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang 'dir tshig tsam bshad kyi don gtan la dbab par bsdus pa'i don nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: These are also explained here as mere words, but the meaning has already been explained in the section on the summarized meaning.

original: dam tshig rnam pa lnga ru ni //
analyzed: dam tshig rnam pa lnga ru ni //
translated: The five types of commitments🔽are explained in the section on the stages of those with commitments, from

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: dam tshig ces su gzhan mi bya'o //🔽zhes pa'i bar du dam tshig can gyi rim pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ces su gzhan mi bya'o // zhes pa'i bar du dam tshig can gyi rim pa bshad pa ste /
translated: should not be called by any other name.

original: de la spyir slob ma rnams dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa yang kha cig ni dam tshig can du 'dod pa'i phyir 'jug / kha cig ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'jug / kha cig ni slob dpon du 'dod pa'i phyir 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la spyir slob ma rnams dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa yang kha cig ni dam tshig can du 'dod pa'i phyir 'jug / kha cig ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'jug / kha cig ni slob dpon du 'dod pa'i phyir 'jug ste /
translated: In general, disciples enter the maṇḍala for the sake of having a commitment, for the sake of practice, and for the sake of being an ācārya.

original: de la dam tshig can du 'dod pa'i phyir 'jug pa ni dkyil 'khor du 'di gsum gang yang rung ba la zhugs te /
analyzed: de la dam tshig can du 'dod pa'i phyir 'jug pa ni dkyil 'khor du 'di gsum gang yang rung ba la zhugs te /
translated: Among those, entering for the sake of having a commitment is entering any of these three in the maṇḍala.

original: dam tshig can du gyur na dkyil 'khor lhag ma gnyis mi ltos /
analyzed: dam tshig can du gyur na dkyil 'khor lhag ma gnyis mi ltos /
translated: If one becomes one who has a commitment, one does not rely on the other two maṇḍalas.

original: sgrub pa dang slob dpon du 'dod pa ni dkyil 'khor gsum char ltos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang slob dpon du 'dod pa ni dkyil 'khor gsum char ltos par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that desiring practice and desiring to be an ācārya rely on all three maṇḍalas.

original: dkyil 'khor de nyid mthong ba ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de nyid mthong ba ni //
translated: Seeing that very maṇḍala

original: dam tshig shes pa cig ces bya //
analyzed: dam tshig shes pa cig ces bya //
translated: is called ‘knowing the pledge.’

original: zhes pa ni dam tshig gi don ni 'dir tshul las mi 'gal ba'i don te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dam tshig gi don ni 'dir tshul las mi 'gal ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of pledge here is the meaning of not transgressing the rule.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum las gang yang rung ba cig mthong na dam tshig can cig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum las gang yang rung ba cig mthong na dam tshig can cig ces bya ba ste /
translated: If one sees any of the three maṇḍalas, one is called ‘one who has a pledge.’

original: des sngar byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa na ni de la phyag rgya dang sngags sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: des sngar byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa na ni de la phyag rgya dang sngags sbyin par bya ste /
translated: For that person, the seal and mantra should be given after previously cultivating the thought of awakening.

original: sngar byang chub kyi sems ma bsgoms na de la phyag rgya dang sngags sbyin du mi rung ste de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngar byang chub kyi sems ma bsgoms na de la phyag rgya dang sngags sbyin du mi rung ste de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: If the thought of awakening has not been previously cultivated, it is not suitable to give the seal and mantra to that person. Therefore it is said:

original: de la phyag rgyas btab pa'ang med //
analyzed: de la phyag rgyas btab pa'ang med //
translated: There is no sealing with the seal

original: de bzhin sngags kyang gzung du med //
analyzed: de bzhin sngags kyang gzung du med //
translated: for that person, and likewise, the mantra is not to be held.

original: ces pa'o // de ltar dkyil 'khor der zhugs na phyag rgya dang sngags mi sbyin par byang chub kyi sems bsgom du bcug ste /
analyzed: ces pa'o // de ltar dkyil 'khor der zhugs na phyag rgya dang sngags mi sbyin par byang chub kyi sems bsgom du bcug ste /
translated: Thus, if one enters that maṇḍala, the seal and mantra are not given, but one is made to cultivate the thought of awakening.

original: goms par gyur nag gdod phyag rgya dang sngags sbyin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: goms par gyur nag gdod phyag rgya dang sngags sbyin par gsungs pa /
translated: When one has become familiar with that, then the seal and mantra are given.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi khyad par ni phyag rgya dang sngags gzung ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi khyad par ni phyag rgya dang sngags gzung ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: The special feature of the Thought of Enlightenment is the retention of the seal and the mantra.🔽The one who sees the mandala is called the one with two commitments.

original: dkyil 'khor kyang mthong ba de dam tshig gnyis zhes bya'o zhes pa ni de ltar byang chub kyi sems goms nas yang dkyil 'khor du bcug ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor kyang mthong ba de dam tshig gnyis zhes bya'o zhes pa ni de ltar byang chub kyi sems goms nas yang dkyil 'khor du bcug ste /
translated: Thus, having become familiar with the Thought of Enlightenment, one is again admitted to the mandala.

original: phyag rgya dang sngags sbyin pa de ni dam tshig can gnyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang sngags sbyin pa de ni dam tshig can gnyis zhes bya'o //
translated: The bestowal of the seal and the mantra is called the one with two commitments.

original: dkyil 'khor phyag rgya mthong ba ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor phyag rgya mthong ba ni //
translated: The one who sees the mandala and the seal🔽is also engaged in the activity.

original: @204b las su bya ba la yang 'jug / bla mas lung ni ma byin pa //
analyzed: @204b las su bya ba la yang 'jug / bla mas lung ni ma byin pa //
translated: The one who is not given the prediction by the master

original: de yang dam tshig shes zhes bya //
analyzed: de yang dam tshig shes zhes bya //
translated: is also called the one who knows the commitment.

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor yang mthong la rgyud dang rtog pa la sogs pa yang nyan du bcug la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor yang mthong la rgyud dang rtog pa la sogs pa yang nyan du bcug la /
translated: The one who sees the mandala and is admitted to hear the tantra, the commentary, and so forth,

original: slob dpon du lung ma bstan pa de ni dam tshig shes pa gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon du lung ma bstan pa de ni dam tshig shes pa gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: but is not given the prediction as a master, is called the one with three commitments.

original: phyag rgya dkyil 'khor bri ba rnams //
analyzed: phyag rgya dkyil 'khor bri ba rnams //
translated: The one who draws the mandala of the seal

original: de tshe cho ga bzhin du bstan //
analyzed: de tshe cho ga bzhin du bstan //
translated: is then taught according to the rite.

original: sngags pa dbang ni ma thob pa //
analyzed: sngags pa dbang ni ma thob pa //
translated: The mantra practitioner who has not received empowerment

original: gsang ba'i ye shes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i ye shes 'byung ba'o //
translated: The secret pristine awareness arises.

original: zhes pa ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba dang / yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba dkyil 'khor pa'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kar dbang bskur ba'am gang yang rung ba cig tu dbang bskur te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba dang / yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba dkyil 'khor pa'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kar dbang bskur ba'am gang yang rung ba cig tu dbang bskur te /
translated: This is the arising of great compassion, and the empowerment is conferred in both the maṇḍala of the wheel of syllables and the maṇḍala of the maṇḍala of the maṇḍala, or it is conferred in whichever one is appropriate.🔽Having drawn the maṇḍala of the maṇḍala of the maṇḍala, and having explained the maṇḍala of the maṇḍala of the maṇḍala, that empowerment is conferred on others in accordance with the rite.

original: phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bri ba dang bshad pa de dag cho ga bzhin du des gzhan la yang bstan pa gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor 'ba' zhig tu dbang bskur ba de ni dam tshig shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bri ba dang bshad pa de dag cho ga bzhin du des gzhan la yang bstan pa gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor 'ba' zhig tu dbang bskur ba de ni dam tshig shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The empowerment conferred in the maṇḍala that is explained is called “knowing the sacred pledge.”

original: sngags pa tshul bzhin dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: sngags pa tshul bzhin dbang bskur ba //
translated: The mantra practitioner is properly empowered

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus su ste //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus su ste //
translated: in the center of the secret maṇḍala.

original: dam tshig shes pa lngar rig bya //
analyzed: dam tshig shes pa lngar rig bya //
translated: One should know the five who know the sacred pledge.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gong ma gnyis su yang dbang bskur ba la gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba de ni dam tshig shes pa lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gong ma gnyis su yang dbang bskur ba la gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba de ni dam tshig shes pa lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: In the two higher maṇḍalas, the empowerment conferred in the secret maṇḍala is called “the five who know the sacred pledge.”

original: dam tshig can zhes gzhan mi bya //
analyzed: dam tshig can zhes gzhan mi bya //
translated: The others are not called “having the sacred pledge.”

original: zhes pa ni de ltar gong du smos pa las gzhan du cho ga las 'gal bar byas na dam tshig can zhes mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar gong du smos pa las gzhan du cho ga las 'gal bar byas na dam tshig can zhes mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that if one acts contrary to the rite as described above, one is not called a “pledge-holder.”

original: gang gis rtag tu bsgoms pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gang gis rtag tu bsgoms pa zhes pa nas /
translated: The question “By what is one always in meditation?”

original: bden pa mthong zhes bya ba yin //🔽zhes pa'i bar du sngar ji ltar /🔽byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi zhes //🔽ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa lags //🔽ji ltar bden pa mthong ba lags //
analyzed: bden pa mthong zhes bya ba yin // zhes pa'i bar du sngar ji ltar / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi zhes // ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa lags // ji ltar bden pa mthong ba lags //
translated: up to “One is called a seer of the truth”

original: zhes dris pa de dag bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes dris pa de dag bshad pa ste /
translated: is explained by the answer,

original: gang gis rtag tu bsgoms pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis rtag tu bsgoms pa ni //
translated: “By what is one always in meditation?”

original: dka' thub byang chub sems la ste //
analyzed: dka' thub byang chub sems la ste //
translated: The ascetic is in the thought of awakening.

original: gnas gsum du ni mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: gnas gsum du ni mi dmigs pa //
translated: The non-apprehension in the three spheres

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang bya //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang bya //
translated: is called the thought of awakening.

original: zhes pa ni gang byang chub kyi sems rtag tu bsgoms te lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas gsum mam /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang byang chub kyi sems rtag tu bsgoms te lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas gsum mam /
translated: This means that one who is always in meditation on the thought of awakening, who is in the three spheres of body, speech, and mind,

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs yod pa'i khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi gnas gsum 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis bshig ste dmigs su med par byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs yod pa'i khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi gnas gsum 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis bshig ste dmigs su med par byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva destroys the three realms of desire, form and formlessness with the bodhicitta that engages them and makes them unobservable.

original: sems can la ni thabs bskyed nas //
analyzed: sems can la ni thabs bskyed nas //
translated: Having generated the method for sentient beings,

original: sems @205a * //
analyzed: sems @205a * //
translated: the bodhisattva

original: can don la rab 'jug pa //🔽dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pa yi //
analyzed: can don la rab 'jug pa // dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pa yi //
translated: engages in the benefit of sentient beings.🔽This is known as the supreme conduct of the victors,

original: rgyal ba'i mchog tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i mchog tu rig par bya'o //
translated: which is free from reference points.

original: zhes pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pa thob nas de las langs te chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur shes bzhin du thabs kyis sems can gyi don du spyod pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ste /🔽dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pa thob //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pa thob nas de las langs te chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur shes bzhin du thabs kyis sems can gyi don du spyod pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ste / dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pa thob //
translated: Once one has attained the conduct that is free from reference points, one rises from that state and, while knowing that phenomena are like illusions, one engages in conduct for the benefit of sentient beings through skillful means. This is known as omniscience.🔽The conduct that is free from reference points

original: ces pa'i mos pa spyod pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: ces pa'i mos pa spyod pa'i tshe na /
translated: is attained on the level of earnest aspiration.

original: 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi chos rnams bshigs nas gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la gnas pa na don dam par yang chos rnams dmigs su med de /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi chos rnams bshigs nas gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la gnas pa na don dam par yang chos rnams dmigs su med de /
translated: When the phenomena of the engaged spirit of enlightenment are destroyed, and one abides in the reality of the abiding spirit of enlightenment, emptiness, then ultimately phenomena are not perceived.

original: kun rdzob tu yang chos rnams 'khrul pa'am sgyu ma lta bur chud pas ni mi dmigs pa'i spyod pa thob ces pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang chos rnams 'khrul pa'am sgyu ma lta bur chud pas ni mi dmigs pa'i spyod pa thob ces pa'o //
translated: And because conventionally phenomena are understood to be like illusions or errors, one attains the practice of nonperception.

original: rgyal ba'i mchog ces pa ni de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam par chos rnams dmigs su med par chud pa ni bdud bzhi dngos su ma bcom yang bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'i ngang tshul can bas rgyal ba'i mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i mchog ces pa ni de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam par chos rnams dmigs su med par chud pa ni bdud bzhi dngos su ma bcom yang bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'i ngang tshul can bas rgyal ba'i mchog ces bya'o //
translated: The best of victors: thus, one who understands that ultimately phenomena are not perceived, and that conventionally they are like illusions or errors, is called the best of victors, because he has the nature of having already conquered the four demons, even though he has not actually destroyed them.

original: thog ma nas su zhi ba'i chos //
analyzed: thog ma nas su zhi ba'i chos //
translated: From the beginning, phenomena are peace.

original: rang bzhin med la gang gis ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin med la gang gis ni //
translated: For whom there is no intrinsic reality,

original: sems ni ri rab bzhin 'dug na //🔽de ni bden pa mthong zhes bya //
analyzed: sems ni ri rab bzhin 'dug na // de ni bden pa mthong zhes bya //
translated: whose mind abides like Mount Meru,🔽he is said to have seen the truth.

original: zhes pa ni bden pa mthong ba bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bden pa mthong ba bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the seeing of the truth.

original: de rnams chos rnams thog ma nas zhi zhing rang bzhin med par gang gis chud de ;
analyzed: de rnams chos rnams thog ma nas zhi zhing rang bzhin med par gang gis chud de ;
translated: Whoever understands that those phenomena are primordially peaceful and essenceless,

original: de nyid la sems ni ri rab bzhin du mi g-yo bar gyur na de ni bden pa mthong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid la sems ni ri rab bzhin du mi g-yo bar gyur na de ni bden pa mthong zhes bya ste /
translated: and whose mind becomes as unshakable as Mount Meru, is said to have seen the truth.

original: de la mdor na thog ma ni 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mdor na thog ma ni 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In brief, the first is the engaged awakening mind.

original: bden pa mthong ba zhes pa ni gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba zhes pa ni gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems bshad pa'o //
translated: “ Seeing the truth” refers to the abiding awakening mind.

original: rgyal ba'i mchog ces pa ni ldang ba'i byang chub kyi sems su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i mchog ces pa ni ldang ba'i byang chub kyi sems su bstan pa ste /
translated: “ Supreme Victor” indicates the emanating awakening mind.

original: de dag kyang mos pa spyod pa'i sa nyid la gnas pa'i yon tan du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mos pa spyod pa'i sa nyid la gnas pa'i yon tan du shes par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as the qualities of abiding on the level of engagement through aspiration.🔽“ This truth” refers to the truth of the path.

original: 'di bden pa yang bdag nyid ces pa nas /
analyzed: 'di bden pa yang bdag nyid ces pa nas /
