original: sangs rgyas 'grub dang 'og rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'grub dang 'og rnams so //
translated: “ The truth of origin” refers to the truth of the path.🔽“ The truth

original: zhes pa'i bar du grub pa'i rigs rnams bshad pa ste 'di bden pa yang bdag nyid mi 'grub pa yang de bzhin du yang dag mthong ba de bzhin sangs rgyas kyang de bzhin ngas kyang mngon ba'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du grub pa'i rigs rnams bshad pa ste 'di bden pa yang bdag nyid mi 'grub pa yang de bzhin du yang dag mthong ba de bzhin sangs rgyas kyang de bzhin ngas kyang mngon ba'o zhes pa ni /
translated: This explains the types of establishment.🔽The truth is also not established by itself.

original: gang gis byang chub sems dpa' thob //
analyzed: gang gis byang chub sems dpa' thob //
translated: The Buddha, the Bodhisattvas, and I have seen it as it is.

original: zhes pa de nyid kyi rjes su bsngags pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: zhes pa de nyid kyi rjes su bsngags pa'i khyad par te /
translated: This is the special praise of the verse,🔽“Whoever attains the thought of awakening.”

original: gang yang byang chub kyi sems thob pa de bden pa yang dag pa nyid kyi mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang byang chub kyi sems thob pa de bden pa yang dag pa nyid kyi mi slu ba ste /
translated: The truth is also not established by itself.

original: sngon @205b gyi sangs rgyas dang ngas kyang yang dag pa nyid kyi slu ba yin zhes par mthong zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon @205b gyi sangs rgyas dang ngas kyang yang dag pa nyid kyi slu ba yin zhes par mthong zhes pa'o //
translated: The Buddha, the Bodhisattvas, and I have seen it as it is.

original: gang gis byang chub sems thob pa yang bsgrubs nas kun du bzang po'am 'phags pa 'jam dpal cig gis klad pa la byugs na byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa zhes bya ba 'thob bo zhes gong du bshad pa de lta bu'i grub pa thob pa ni byang
analyzed: gang gis byang chub sems thob pa yang bsgrubs nas kun du bzang po'am 'phags pa 'jam dpal cig gis klad pa la byugs na byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa zhes bya ba 'thob bo zhes gong du bshad pa de lta bu'i grub pa thob pa ni byang
translated: And, having accomplished the attainment of the Thought of Enlightenment, if one of the two, Samantabhadra or Manjusri, anoints one's head, one attains what is called the non-forgetting of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: chub kyi sems thob pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chub kyi sems thob pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Such an attainment of the Thought of Enlightenment is called the attainment of the Thought of Enlightenment.🔽If one has such an attainment, that is the attainment, and what else is needed?

original: de lta bu grub na de nyid grub pa yin gyi gzhan ci dgos pa zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de grub pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu grub na de nyid grub pa yin gyi gzhan ci dgos pa zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de grub pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that attainment of the Thought of Enlightenment is the cause of other attainments.

original: de bas gzhan yang grub pa ni //
analyzed: de bas gzhan yang grub pa ni //
translated: Moreover, there is another attainment,

original: grub pa rnam pa lnga zhes bsgrags //
analyzed: grub pa rnam pa lnga zhes bsgrags //
translated: which is proclaimed to be the fivefold attainment.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems grub pa de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems grub pa de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: This is other than the attainment of the Thought of Enlightenment.🔽The other is taken to be the five elements, which are the following:🔽The one who engages in the practice,

original: gzhan ming gis 'byung ba lnga la byas te de rnams kyang spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la spyod pa'i rjes su zhugs //
analyzed: gzhan ming gis 'byung ba lnga la byas te de rnams kyang spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la spyod pa'i rjes su zhugs //
translated: and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa las 'phar te ye shes kyi sa la 'jug pa'i skabs su snang ba thob pa dang / snang ba mched pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa las 'phar te ye shes kyi sa la 'jug pa'i skabs su snang ba thob pa dang / snang ba mched pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par grub pa'o //
translated: This is the attainment of the stage of light and the accomplishment of the special samadhis called light, increase of light, etc., when one has risen from the stage of devoted conduct and is entering the stage of wisdom.

original: sa las 'phar ba'ang de bzhin te //
analyzed: sa las 'phar ba'ang de bzhin te //
translated: Rising from the stage is also like that.

original: zhes pa ni sa rab tu dga' ba thob par grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa rab tu dga' ba thob par grub pa'o //
translated: This is the accomplishment of attaining the stage of joy.🔽The five mundane higher perceptions

original: 'jig rten mngon shes lnga rnams dang // zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi lnga mngon par shes pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten mngon shes lnga rnams dang // zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi lnga mngon par shes pa grub pa'o //
translated: This is the accomplishment of the five mundane higher perceptions.🔽Accomplishment of the Buddha

original: sangs rgyas grub dang zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su gyur pa'i rig 'dzin du grub pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas grub dang zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su gyur pa'i rig 'dzin du grub pa'o //
translated: This is the accomplishment of the vidyadhara who has become the form of a buddha.🔽The majority

original: phal rnams zhes pa ni rig 'dzin phal rnams grub pa ste de gnyis ni gzugs kyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: phal rnams zhes pa ni rig 'dzin phal rnams grub pa ste de gnyis ni gzugs kyis grub pa'o //
translated: This is the accomplishment of the majority of vidyadharas. These two are accomplishments by form.

original: gong ma gsum ni sems kyis grub pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma gsum ni sems kyis grub pa shes par bya'o //
translated: The three above should be understood as accomplishments by mind.

original: rgyud nas rgyud du ba rnams kyis //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: rgyud nas rgyud du ba rnams kyis // zhes pa nas /
translated: The majority of the tantras🔽This is from the line “The majority of the tantras…”

original: sngags pa yid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngags pa yid las byung ba'o //
translated: up to “The mantra practitioner is mentally arisen.”

original: zhes pa'i bar du grub pa'i dus bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du grub pa'i dus bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the time of accomplishment.

original: de las grub pa'i dus kyang tshe 'di la grub pa dang tshe phyi ma la grub pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de las grub pa'i dus kyang tshe 'di la grub pa dang tshe phyi ma la grub pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The time of accomplishment is twofold: accomplishment in this life and accomplishment in a future life.

original: rgyud nas rgyud du ba rnams kyi //
analyzed: rgyud nas rgyud du ba rnams kyi //
translated: For those who continue from one life to another,

original: las rnams ji srid ma zad cing //🔽smin pa rnams par de smin pa //
analyzed: las rnams ji srid ma zad cing // smin pa rnams par de smin pa //
translated: as long as their karma is not exhausted,

original: de ni grub pa yin zhes bsgrags //
analyzed: de ni grub pa yin zhes bsgrags //
translated: when it ripens, it is said to be accomplished.

original: zhes pa ni tshe 'di las grub pa ste /🔽rgyud nas rgyud du ba rnams kyi las rnams rgyud ma zad ces pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni tshe 'di las grub pa ste / rgyud nas rgyud du ba rnams kyi las rnams rgyud ma zad ces pa ni /
translated: This is accomplishment in this life.🔽For those who continue from one life to another, as long as their karma is not exhausted,

original: tshe snga ma'i rgyud sgo drug la sogs pa nas las bsags pa'i tshe 'di'i rgyud la zad par ma gyur te /
analyzed: tshe snga ma'i rgyud sgo drug la sogs pa nas las bsags pa'i tshe 'di'i rgyud la zad par ma gyur te /
translated: when the continuum of karma accumulated in the continuum of a past life is not exhausted in the continuum of this life,

original: bdag gi phung po gson na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phung po gson na zhes pa'o //
translated: as long as the aggregates of this self are alive,

original: smin pa rnam par de smin na //
analyzed: smin pa rnam par de smin na //
translated: when it ripens, it is said to be accomplished.

original: zhes pa ni da lta yang gson la tshe dang @206a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni da lta yang gson la tshe dang @206a * //
translated: This is accomplishment in a future life.

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i rgyu btab pa'i 'bras bu yang 'dir smin par gyur na snga ma'i las rnams ma zad pas bdag tshe ring smin pa rnam par smin pas bdag gi bsod nams kyi rgyu mthus rtag par gyur te /
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i rgyu btab pa'i 'bras bu yang 'dir smin par gyur na snga ma'i las rnams ma zad pas bdag tshe ring smin pa rnam par smin pas bdag gi bsod nams kyi rgyu mthus rtag par gyur te /
translated: If the result of the cause of merit and so on were to ripen here, then since former karma would not be exhausted, one would have long life.

original: sgrub pa'i tshe de ltar tshe dang bsod nams gnyis kas bsrungs na de nyid tshe 'di nyid la 'grub par bshad do //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i tshe de ltar tshe dang bsod nams gnyis kas bsrungs na de nyid tshe 'di nyid la 'grub par bshad do //
translated: If one protects both life and merit in that way during the practice, it is explained that one will accomplish it in this very lifetime.

original: mdo ru dus gcig tu yang na nam zhig dang / tshe zad na tshe de grub pa thob pa ni sngags pa yid las byung ba'o zhes pa ni sgrub pa bsgrubs pas las dang tshes ma bstangs te /
analyzed: mdo ru dus gcig tu yang na nam zhig dang / tshe zad na tshe de grub pa thob pa ni sngags pa yid las byung ba'o zhes pa ni sgrub pa bsgrubs pas las dang tshes ma bstangs te /
translated: In the sutra, “at one time” or “some time,” when life is exhausted, the attainment of accomplishment is the mental creation of the mantra practitioner.

original: dus gcig tu ni las dang tshe zad par gyur na /
analyzed: dus gcig tu ni las dang tshe zad par gyur na /
translated: If at one time, life and karma are exhausted,

original: sgrub pa bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu sngags pa des tshe phyi ma la bsgrub mi dgos par rdo rje la sogs pa'i rigs su skye ba dang / rig 'dzin la sogs par skye ba 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu sngags pa des tshe phyi ma la bsgrub mi dgos par rdo rje la sogs pa'i rigs su skye ba dang / rig 'dzin la sogs par skye ba 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The result of the accomplishment of the practice is that the mantrin will be born in the family of the vajra and so forth in the next life without having to practice, and will attain birth as a knowledge-holder and so forth.

original: sngags pa yid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngags pa yid las byung ba'o //
translated: The mantrin is mentally produced.

original: zhes pa ni rdzas la sogs pa bsgrub mi dgos par tshe 'phos ma thag tu yid nyid kyis grub pa de dag thob par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdzas la sogs pa bsgrub mi dgos par tshe 'phos ma thag tu yid nyid kyis grub pa de dag thob par 'gyur ro ;
translated: This means that without having to practice with substances and so forth, they will attain those as soon as they transfer their lives, by the mind alone.

original: / grub nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba //
analyzed: / grub nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba //
translated: Having accomplished, they go in the sky.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: sangs rgyas gcig brjod par mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gcig brjod par mi 'gyur //
translated: They will not utter a single buddha.

original: zhes pa'i bar du grub pa'i 'bras bu rnams dris pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du grub pa'i 'bras bu rnams dris pa bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the answers to the questions about the results of accomplishment.

original: grub nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba //
analyzed: grub nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba //
translated: Having accomplished, they go in the sky.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhas pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhas pa bzhin //
translated: Like a skilled magician,

original: sngags kyi dra bas bslus pa ni //
analyzed: sngags kyi dra bas bslus pa ni //
translated: Deceived by the net of mantra,

original: ji ltar mig 'phrul chen po bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar mig 'phrul chen po bzhin //
translated: Like a great illusion.

original: zhes pa ni grub nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni grub nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains going in the sky after accomplishment.

original: ji ltar mig 'phrul mkhan de nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs byed pa bzhin du sngags pa de yang rig 'dzin la sogs par grub nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / sngags kyi mthus rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa la sogs pa ston par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mig 'phrul mkhan de nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs byed pa bzhin du sngags pa de yang rig 'dzin la sogs par grub nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / sngags kyi mthus rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa la sogs pa ston par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as the magician moves through the sky and performs various miracles, so too the mantrin, having achieved mastery of awareness and so forth, moves through the sky and displays various emanations and so forth by the power of mantra.

original: gang na lus dang ngag med par dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du de bzhin mi snang bar 'gyur zhes bya /
analyzed: gang na lus dang ngag med par dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du de bzhin mi snang bar 'gyur zhes bya /
translated: Where there is no body or speech, like a gandharva city, it does not appear in that way.

original: de'i gnas ni de yin no zhes pa ni rig 'dzin la sogs pa grub nas mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i dpe dri za'i grong khyer las blangs te bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas ni de yin no zhes pa ni rig 'dzin la sogs pa grub nas mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i dpe dri za'i grong khyer las blangs te bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the abode of that, the example of the gandharva city is taken for the non-appearance of the one who has achieved mastery of awareness and so forth.

original: ji ltar dri za'i grong khyer lus la sogs pa dngos su mi snang zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar dri za'i grong khyer lus la sogs pa dngos su mi snang zhing /
translated: Just as a gandharva city does not actually appear as a body and so forth,

original: bar snang la gnas par byed pa de bzhin du sngags pa de yang grub nas lus kyang mi snang la tshig tu brjod pa yang mi thos par nam mkha' la mi snang bar gyur cing bar snang la gnas par byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bar snang la gnas par byed pa de bzhin du sngags pa de yang grub nas lus kyang mi snang la tshig tu brjod pa yang mi thos par nam mkha' la mi snang bar gyur cing bar snang la gnas par byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Just as the garuḍa soars in the sky, the mantra practitioner, having attained accomplishment, becomes invisible and, without being heard to speak, becomes invisible in the sky and soars in the sky.

original: ji ltar nyal ba'i rmi lam na @206b sum cu rtsa gsum gnas su phyin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nyal ba'i rmi lam na @206b sum cu rtsa gsum gnas su phyin te /
translated: Just as in a dream while lying down one goes to the Heaven of the Thirty-Three,

original: de'i lus dang bral ba yang med /
analyzed: de'i lus dang bral ba yang med /
translated: one is not separated from one’s body,

original: de la ni der phyin pa yang med /
analyzed: de la ni der phyin pa yang med /
translated: and one does not go there.

original: de bzhin sbyor ba gnyis kyis kyang sngags pa sngags kyi rgyud nas /
analyzed: de bzhin sbyor ba gnyis kyis kyang sngags pa sngags kyi rgyud nas /
translated: In the same way, the mantra practitioner, through the two yogas,

original: lus ni 'ja' zug pa dang 'dra //
analyzed: lus ni 'ja' zug pa dang 'dra //
translated: the body is like a rainbow.

original: las dang bsod nams las rnyed pa //
analyzed: las dang bsod nams las rnyed pa //
translated: Obtained from karma and merit,

original: zhes pa ni sngags pa de rig 'dzin la sogs pa grub nas lus 'di yang mi 'dor bar nam mkha' la sogs pa la 'gro ba'i dpe rmi lam las blangs te bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags pa de rig 'dzin la sogs pa grub nas lus 'di yang mi 'dor bar nam mkha' la sogs pa la 'gro ba'i dpe rmi lam las blangs te bshad pa ste /
translated: this explains that the mantra practitioner, having attained accomplishment as a knowledge-holder and so forth, does not abandon this body but takes the example of a dream to explain how it moves through space and so forth.

original: ji ltar skyes bu nyal ba'i rmi lam na /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu nyal ba'i rmi lam na /
translated: Just as a person lying down in a dream

original: sum cu rtsa gsum la sogs pa'i gnas mthong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du sngags pa de yang sbyor ba'i dbang gis lus 'di nyid ma bor bar nam mkha' la sogs par 'gro ba yang rang gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum la sogs pa'i gnas mthong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du sngags pa de yang sbyor ba'i dbang gis lus 'di nyid ma bor bar nam mkha' la sogs par 'gro ba yang rang gis mthong ngo //
translated: Just as the gods of the Thirty-three and so on see their own abodes, in the same way, the mantrin, by the power of his practice, sees himself going through the sky and so on without abandoning this very body.

original: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyang ston nus par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyang ston nus par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: He is able to display various forms.

original: lus ni 'ja' zug pa dang 'dra //
analyzed: lus ni 'ja' zug pa dang 'dra //
translated: The body is like a rainbow.

original: zhes pa ni gzugs sna tshogs ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs sna tshogs ston pa'o //
translated: This is the display of various forms.

original: sngags ni yid bzhin nor bu 'dra //
analyzed: sngags ni yid bzhin nor bu 'dra //
translated: The mantra is like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid las byung //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid las byung //
translated: Arising from body, speech, and mind,

original: de las don du brtsams pa ni //
analyzed: de las don du brtsams pa ni //
translated: The purpose of that is accomplished

original: ma brtags bzhin du grub pa yin //
analyzed: ma brtags bzhin du grub pa yin //
translated: Without being examined.

original: zhes pa ni sngags kyi grub pa yid bzhin nor bu las dpe blangs te bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags kyi grub pa yid bzhin nor bu las dpe blangs te bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the accomplishment of mantra by taking the example of a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: ji ltar yid bzhin nor bu gang bsams pa'i don rnams ma brtags par dgos pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byor par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sngags 'grub pa'i 'bras bu yang gang 'dod pa rnams brtag mi dgos par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byor par🔽'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yid bzhin nor bu gang bsams pa'i don rnams ma brtags par dgos pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byor par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sngags 'grub pa'i 'bras bu yang gang 'dod pa rnams brtag mi dgos par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byor par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as the wish-fulfilling gem spontaneously and effortlessly provides whatever is desired without being examined, so also the result of the accomplishment of mantra will spontaneously and effortlessly provide whatever is desired without the need for examination.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' phyogs rnams la 'dus byas spyod yul thams cad kyis mi gos pa de bzhin sngags pa yang rtog pa'i spyod yul kun gyis so //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' phyogs rnams la 'dus byas spyod yul thams cad kyis mi gos pa de bzhin sngags pa yang rtog pa'i spyod yul kun gyis so //
translated: Just as space is not sullied by any of the objects of the sphere of the conditioned, so also the mantrin is not sullied by any of the objects of the sphere of conceptualization.

original: grub pa thob pa de yang gza' dang skar ma dang ltas ngan la sogs pas mi tshugs par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: grub pa thob pa de yang gza' dang skar ma dang ltas ngan la sogs pas mi tshugs par bshad pa ste /
translated: It is explained that one who has attained accomplishment is not harmed by planets, stars, bad omens, and so forth.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' 'dus byas la sogs pa'i dri mas mi gos pa bzhin du grub pa'i sngags de yang gza' dang skar ma la sogs pa bzang ngan gyi las su mi rtog ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' 'dus byas la sogs pa'i dri mas mi gos pa bzhin du grub pa'i sngags de yang gza' dang skar ma la sogs pa bzang ngan gyi las su mi rtog ste /
translated: Just as space is not sullied by the stains of the conditioned and so forth, the accomplished mantra practitioner does not conceptualize good and bad actions such as planets, stars, and so forth.

original: de dag gis ltas ngan pa la sogs pas kyang mi tshugs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ltas ngan pa la sogs pas kyang mi tshugs zhes pa'o //
translated: By these, one is not harmed even by bad omens and so forth.

original: 'di dag thams cad 'du shes tsam //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad 'du shes tsam //
translated: All of these are mere ideas.

original: de ltar rnam par sgom par byed //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par sgom par byed //
translated: Thus, one should meditate.

original: sngags pa de ltar bsgoms na ni //
analyzed: sngags pa de ltar bsgoms na ni //
translated: The mantra practitioner, meditating in this way,

original: sangs rgyas lhan cig brjod 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lhan cig brjod 'gyur ro //
translated: will be in the company of the Buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni sngags grub pa thob nas sangs rgyas dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa thob par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags grub pa thob nas sangs rgyas dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa thob par bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains that, having attained the accomplishment of mantra, one attains the company of the Buddhas.

original: de dag thams cad 'du shes tsam //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'du shes tsam //
translated: All of these are mere ideas.

original: zhes pa ni @207a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni @207a * //
translated: This means

original: 'dus byas la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag thams cad dngos su yod pa ma yin gyi /🔽'du shes tsam du byang chub kyi sems sgom pa'i tshe bsgom pas kun du sangs rgyas pa dang lhan cig tu 'grogs shing /
analyzed: 'dus byas la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag thams cad dngos su yod pa ma yin gyi / 'du shes tsam du byang chub kyi sems sgom pa'i tshe bsgom pas kun du sangs rgyas pa dang lhan cig tu 'grogs shing /
translated: that all of these phenomena, compounded and so forth, are not actually existent.🔽When meditating on the thought of awakening, one meditates on them as mere ideas.

original: de la chos nyan pa la sogs pas dga' bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos nyan pa la sogs pas dga' bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: By meditating in this way, one is in the company of the fully awakened Buddhas, and one delights in listening to the Dharma from them and so forth.

original: sbyin sreg gnyis su gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gnyis su gsungs pa ni //
translated: The two fire sacrifices are taught.

original: sangs rgyas rkang gnyis gtso bo ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rkang gnyis gtso bo ste //
translated: The Buddha is the chief of two-legged beings.

original: phyi rol gyi dang nang gi ste //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dang nang gi ste //
translated: External and internal,

original: de yang tshim byed bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang tshim byed bcas pa'o //
translated: and also with satisfaction.

original: zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi las me rnams su zhes sngar dris pa la rnam pa gnyis ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi las me rnams su zhes sngar dris pa la rnam pa gnyis ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This is the answer to the question about the rite of fire sacrifice in the fires. The two kinds have already been explained.

original: 'dir ni sbyin sreg rnam pa gnyis bshad pa'i phyi'i me dang nang gi me rnam pa gnyis bshad de /
analyzed: 'dir ni sbyin sreg rnam pa gnyis bshad pa'i phyi'i me dang nang gi me rnam pa gnyis bshad de /
translated: Here, the two kinds of fire sacrifice are explained. The external fire and the internal fire are explained as two kinds.

original: de yang mnyes par bya ba dang bcas par bya ba dang zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mnyes par bya ba dang bcas par bya ba dang zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And also with satisfaction.

original: de la nang gi sems kyis mnyes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la nang gi sems kyis mnyes par bya ba ni /
translated: Therein, the satisfaction of the internal mind

original: rang gi sa bon las slar lha'i gzugs su bsgyur bar sngar bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las slar lha'i gzugs su bsgyur bar sngar bshad do //
translated: is the transformation of one's seed into the form of a deity, as previously explained.

original: phyi rol gyis mnyes par bya ba'i bsreg pa'i rdzas gnyis kyis mnyes bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyis mnyes par bya ba'i bsreg pa'i rdzas gnyis kyis mnyes bar bya'o //
translated: One should be satisfied with the two kinds of burnt offerings that satisfy externally.

original: lha rnams kyi so so'i zhes pa nas /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi so so'i zhes pa nas /
translated: From The individual deities...

original: yang dag sangs rgyas rdzogs par gsungs //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas rdzogs par gsungs //
translated: up to ...the perfect Buddha has taught.

original: zhes pa'i bar du lha rnams kyi rang bzhin dang grub pa'i tshad rnams bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du lha rnams kyi rang bzhin dang grub pa'i tshad rnams bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the nature and measure of accomplishment of the deities.

original: lha rnams kyi /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi /
translated: Of the deities,

original: so so'i ngo bo nyid kyang shes nas su //
analyzed: so so'i ngo bo nyid kyang shes nas su //
translated: Having known their individual natures,

original: zhes pa ni lha rnams kyi rang bzhin shes bar byas nas de dag gi grub pa'i 'bras bu yang shes par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha rnams kyi rang bzhin shes bar byas nas de dag gi grub pa'i 'bras bu yang shes par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: Having known the nature of the gods, one will also know the extent of the results of their accomplishments.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha rnams kyi rang bzhin ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha rnams kyi rang bzhin ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Among them, the nature of the supramundane gods has already been explained.

original: 'dir ni 'jig rten gyi lha rnams kyi rang bzhin bshad nas /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jig rten gyi lha rnams kyi rang bzhin bshad nas /
translated: Here, having explained the nature of the mundane gods,

original: de'i rang bzhin ni mthu las 'bras bu'i tshad shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni mthu las 'bras bu'i tshad shes pa ste /
translated: their nature is known through the extent of the results of their power.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'jig rten gyi sngags kyi tshad ni kun du gsungs pa yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi sngags kyi tshad ni kun du gsungs pa yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The extent of mundane mantras is also universally proclaimed.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i lha mthu chen po de dag gis smras pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya rnams ni 'bras bu 'phral du ster ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i lha mthu chen po de dag gis smras pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya rnams ni 'bras bu 'phral du ster ba ste /
translated: The mantras and mudras spoken by those powerful gods such as Indra immediately bestow results.

original: de dag gi tshad du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi tshad du gsungs pa ste /
translated: Their extent is proclaimed.

original: tshad ces pa ni de dag gi mthu la bya'o //
analyzed: tshad ces pa ni de dag gi mthu la bya'o //
translated: Extent refers to their power.

original: de rnams la rtag pa med de /
analyzed: de rnams la rtag pa med de /
translated: They do not have permanence.

original: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can no //
translated: They are subject to arising and destruction.

original: zhes pa ni de dag gi khyad par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de dag gi khyad par gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is a statement of their distinctions.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams 'bras bu tshe 'di la 'phral du ster mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams 'bras bu tshe 'di la 'phral du ster mod kyi /
translated: The worldly gods immediately bestow their results in this life.

original: de rnams skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can pas mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can pas mi rtag pa'o //
translated: However, since they are subject to arising and destruction, they are impermanent.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags rnams ni zhes pa nas /🔽bye brag kun kyang bshad pa yin @207b zhes pa'i bar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas gsungs pa'i sngags rnams thog ma'i byed pa med cing las dang tshe dang 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags rnams ni zhes pa nas / bye brag kun kyang bshad pa yin @207b zhes pa'i bar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas gsungs pa'i sngags rnams thog ma'i byed pa med cing las dang tshe dang 'chad pa ste /
translated: The supramundane mantras, from the bodhisattvas, śrāvakas,🔽and pratyekabuddhas, are free from the three faults of desire,🔽anger, and ignorance.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nyes pa gsum dang bral bas skye zhing 'jig pa la sogs pa med pas sngar tshad rnams bshad zin to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nyes pa gsum dang bral bas skye zhing 'jig pa la sogs pa med pas sngar tshad rnams bshad zin to zhes pa'o //
translated: Since they are free from the three faults of desire, anger, and ignorance, they are free from arising and destruction, and so on.

original: dus gsum las ni shin tu 'das //
analyzed: dus gsum las ni shin tu 'das //
translated: They are beyond the three times.

original: rkyen las skyes par byung ba ste //
analyzed: rkyen las skyes par byung ba ste //
translated: Arisen from conditions.

original: 'bras bu mthong dang mi mthong la //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong dang mi mthong la //
translated: The result is seen and unseen.

original: ngag yid gsum las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ngag yid gsum las byung ba'o //
translated: Arisen from speech and mind.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags rnams 'jig rten pa ltar mthong ba'i chos 'ba' zhig la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags rnams 'jig rten pa ltar mthong ba'i chos 'ba' zhig la /
translated: Thus, the supramundane mantras, unlike the mundane ones, do not only bestow their result immediately in this very life.

original: 'bras bu 'phral du ster ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi mthong ba'i chos dang mi mthong ba gnyis ka la 'bras bu ster zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phral du ster ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi mthong ba'i chos dang mi mthong ba gnyis ka la 'bras bu ster zhes pa ste /
translated: They bestow their result in both this life and the next.

original: mthong ba'i lha dang mi la sogs pa 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lha dang mi la sogs pa 'grub pa'o //
translated: The seen result is the accomplishment of gods, humans, and so forth.

original: mi mthong ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthong ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The unseen result is nirvana.

original: 'bras bu'i tshad ni bskal pa gcig 'jig rten gyi zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i tshad ni bskal pa gcig 'jig rten gyi zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The measure of the result is one eon.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi grub pa'i 'bras bu ji srid thub pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi grub pa'i 'bras bu ji srid thub pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: The result of the mundane deities lasts for one eon.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'bras bu ni bskal pa gcig gi bar du thub ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'bras bu ni bskal pa gcig gi bar du thub ces pa'o //
translated: The mundane result lasts for one eon.

original: bskal pa gcig las sngags 'bras bu //
analyzed: bskal pa gcig las sngags 'bras bu //
translated: The mantra result lasts more than one eon.

original: yang dag sangs rgyas rdzogs bas gsungs //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas rdzogs bas gsungs //
translated: The perfect Buddhas have taught that

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags rnams kyi 'bras bu bskal pa las 'das par thub ces pa'o //🔽ting 'dzin rgyal ba'i sras rnams dang // drang srong chen po sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags rnams kyi 'bras bu bskal pa las 'das par thub ces pa'o // ting 'dzin rgyal ba'i sras rnams dang // drang srong chen po sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: the results of supramundane mantras are beyond the eons.🔽The sons of the Victorious Ones and the great sages,

original: mtshan dang bral te dag pa yin //
analyzed: mtshan dang bral te dag pa yin //
translated: free from the characteristics of the Buddha, are pure.🔽The mantras of the worldly ones are said to have characteristics.

original: 'jig rten mtshan mar bcas zhes pa ni sngags pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten mtshan mar bcas zhes pa ni sngags pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the samādhi of the mantra practitioners.

original: de la spyir ting nge 'dzin la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la spyir ting nge 'dzin la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In general, there are two types of samādhi:

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi'o //
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi'o //
translated: ultimate and relative.

original: de la don dam pa ni yi ge aa la sogs pa 'bru re'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la don dam pa ni yi ge aa la sogs pa 'bru re'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is taught through each syllable such as “a.”

original: kun rdzob kyi ni sngags kyi phreng ba'i tshig las stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi ni sngags kyi phreng ba'i tshig las stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams te /
translated: The relative is the qualities such as strength and fearlessness that arise from the words of the mantra garland.

original: de dag gi tshig tu gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yi ge rnams ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag gi tshig tu gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yi ge rnams ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The syllables of the samādhi that are their words have been explained above.

original: 'dir ni ting nge 'dzin gyi don rnams bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni ting nge 'dzin gyi don rnams bshad pa ste /
translated: Here, the meanings of meditative concentration are explained.

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //🔽drang srong chen po sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'o // drang srong chen po sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: The phrase “the victors’ spiritual heirs” refers to bodhisattvas and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid @208a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid @208a * //
translated: The phrase “great sages, the buddhas” refers to the body, speech, and mind.

original: gsum thub pa'i mtshan nyid drang srong ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa kun du sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gsum thub pa'i mtshan nyid drang srong ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa kun du sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: The term “sage” refers to the one who is characterized by the three disciplines, and “fully enlightened” refers to the transcendence of suffering that is not a static state.

original: de dag gi ting nge 'dzin gyi don chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid pas mtshan ma dang bral ba ste dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi ting nge 'dzin gyi don chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid pas mtshan ma dang bral ba ste dga' ba'o //
translated: The meaning of their meditative concentration is that all phenomena are primordially unborn and are free of characteristics, being characterized by the absence of discursive thoughts.

original: 'jig rten gyi mtshan mar bcas pa zhes pa ni nam byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mtshan mar bcas pa zhes pa ni nam byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs pa ni /
translated: The phrase “the characteristics of the world” refers to the fact that when a bodhisattva rises from meditative concentration,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par brgyan pa la sogs pa ji bzhin pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang 'jug pa dang sangs rgyas dang mngon par byang chub nas sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sku mi zad pa'i 'khor lo la sogs pa 'byung ba yang sbyin pa
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par brgyan pa la sogs pa ji bzhin pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang 'jug pa dang sangs rgyas dang mngon par byang chub nas sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sku mi zad pa'i 'khor lo la sogs pa 'byung ba yang sbyin pa
translated: The conduct and engagement of the Buddha's adornment and so forth, along with the suchness, and the arising of the wheel of the inexhaustible body and so forth through the power of previous aspirations after attaining manifest enlightenment, are also generosity.

original: dang bcas pa'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: dang bcas pa'i spyod pa ste /
translated: That is the conduct.

original: de dag la yang 'jig rten gyi mtshan ma dang bcas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang 'jig rten gyi mtshan ma dang bcas zhes pa'o //
translated: And also, along with the signs of the world.

original: gnyis su na mu stegs 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin dngos po yod par blta bas na mtshan ma dang bcas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su na mu stegs 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin dngos po yod par blta bas na mtshan ma dang bcas zhes bya'o //
translated: In another way, the samadhis of the tirthikas and worldly gods are said to be with signs because they view things as existent.

original: rnam par smin pa'ang rnam smin 'dir //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'ang rnam smin 'dir //
translated: Even the ripened is ripened here.

original: las kyi 'bras bu rnyed 'gyur ba //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu rnyed 'gyur ba //
translated: The result of karma will be found.

original: nam zhig grub pa rnyed na ni //
analyzed: nam zhig grub pa rnyed na ni //
translated: When accomplishment is attained,

original: de la las kyang ldog par shes //
analyzed: de la las kyang ldog par shes //
translated: one should know that karma is reversed.

original: zhes pa ni sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa lha'i rnam par smin pa'i gzugs phung po lnga 'di las las kyi 'bras bu smin par gyur pa ste nam bdag gis ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa thob na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa lha'i rnam par smin pa'i gzugs phung po lnga 'di las las kyi 'bras bu smin par gyur pa ste nam bdag gis ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa thob na /
translated: When I attain the accomplishments of meditative concentration and so forth,

original: de na las kyi rnam par smin pa de grub pa des zil gyis non nas 'bras bu mi smin par de ldog par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de na las kyi rnam par smin pa de grub pa des zil gyis non nas 'bras bu mi smin par de ldog par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: that ripening of karma is overcome by that accomplishment and ceases to ripen.

original: sems ni ngo bo nyid med pas //
analyzed: sems ni ngo bo nyid med pas //
translated: Since the mind is essenceless,

original: 'bras bu rgyu yang rnam spangs la //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu yang rnam spangs la //
translated: it is free from cause and effect.

original: las dang tshe las rnam grol ba //
analyzed: las dang tshe las rnam grol ba //
translated: Liberated from karma and life,

original: nam mkha' 'dra bar skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'dra bar skye bar 'gyur //
translated: it is born like space.

original: zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the tenet that one becomes a buddha.

original: sgrub pos byang chub kyi sems dag par bsgoms pas sems kyi rang bzhin med par chud de //
analyzed: sgrub pos byang chub kyi sems dag par bsgoms pas sems kyi rang bzhin med par chud de //
translated: The practitioner meditates on pure bodhicitta and understands the nature of the mind to be nonexistent.

original: chos kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dmigs su med pas las kyi rgyu tshe ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dmigs su med pas las kyi rgyu tshe ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: Since the cause and effect of phenomena are not observed, the cause of karma and life is the effect of karma and life.

original: las dang tshe las kyang rnam par gral bar gyur te /
analyzed: las dang tshe las kyang rnam par gral bar gyur te /
translated: And they are also liberated from karma and life.

original: de ltar las dang tshe rnam par grol na nam mkha' 'dra bar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar las dang tshe rnam par grol na nam mkha' 'dra bar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: If they are liberated in this way from karma and life, they will be like space, free from the apprehended and apprehender, and will have the characteristic of purity.🔽Thus, O Lord of Secrets, listen to the way of drawing the mandala, which is the source of countless worldly and transcendent mandalas.

original: de ltar gsang ba'i bdag po zhes pa nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor grangs med par 'byung ba de bri ba'i tshul @208b nyon cig ces pa'i bar du gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor rang bzhin dang yon tan smos nas nyon cig ces pa ste
analyzed: de ltar gsang ba'i bdag po zhes pa nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor grangs med par 'byung ba de bri ba'i tshul @208b nyon cig ces pa'i bar du gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor rang bzhin dang yon tan smos nas nyon cig ces pa ste
translated: Having mentioned the nature and qualities of the secret mandala, it says, listen.

original: / de la phyag rgya'i gzugs su dgod pa'i le'u zhes pa ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor dang yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor du lung bstan pa dang / tshig gis gzugs su bkod kyi 'dir ni sems rang bzhin dngos su gzhug tu mi rung ba'i phyag rgya'i gzugs su bkod pa ste /
analyzed: / de la phyag rgya'i gzugs su dgod pa'i le'u zhes pa ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor dang yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor du lung bstan pa dang / tshig gis gzugs su bkod kyi 'dir ni sems rang bzhin dngos su gzhug tu mi rung ba'i phyag rgya'i gzugs su bkod pa ste /
translated: The chapter called The Array of the Forms of the Seals is the prediction in the mandala of the origin of great compassion and in the mandala of the wheel of letters, and the arrangement in the form of words. But here, the mind is not suitable to be directly introduced into the nature, so it is arranged in the form of the seals.

original: de ni le'u phyag rgya'i gzugs su bkod pa'i dkyil 'khor la bya'o //
analyzed: de ni le'u phyag rgya'i gzugs su bkod pa'i dkyil 'khor la bya'o //
translated: That is the mandala of the chapter called The Array of the Forms of the Seals.

original: lha rnams gnas su byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor der phyag rgya'i gzugs su lha rnams dgod par byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams gnas su byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor der phyag rgya'i gzugs su lha rnams dgod par byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The consecration of the deities in their places means that the deities are consecrated to be arranged in the form of the seals in that mandala.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyud lnga zhes pa ni dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga po de dag nyid ye shes kyi bye brag las byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyud lnga zhes pa ni dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga po de dag nyid ye shes kyi bye brag las byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The five tantras of meditative concentration means that those five mandalas, such as the great empowerment, and so on, are consecrated by the distinctions of pristine consciousness.

original: dkyil 'khor de lnga las ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par la chud par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de lnga las ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par la chud par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: From among those five maṇḍalas, one will enter the distinctive samādhi of timeless awareness.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon par sangs rgyas pa zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad bya ba gcig tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon par sangs rgyas pa zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad bya ba gcig tu bstan pa ste /
translated: “The manifest enlightenment of the buddhas of the past” indicates that all buddhas teach in one voice.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis kyang mkhyen nas bshad kyis de nyon cig ces pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis kyang mkhyen nas bshad kyis de nyon cig ces pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: “The buddhas of the past have known and explained this, so listen to it!”

original: chos kyi dbyings nam mkha'i spyod yul zhes pa nas phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes pa'i bar du dkyil 'khor de bshad pa yang phyag na rdo rjes mi mkhyen pa'i phyir bshad pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nam mkha'i spyod yul zhes pa nas phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes pa'i bar du dkyil 'khor de bshad pa yang phyag na rdo rjes mi mkhyen pa'i phyir bshad pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: From “the realm of phenomena, the domain of space” up to “for the sake of benefit and happiness,” the explanation of that maṇḍala is not because Vajrapāṇi does not know it.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir bshad do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir bshad do zhes pa ste /
translated: It is explained for the sake of benefit and happiness for those who abide on the level of devoted conduct, who practice the conduct of bodhisattvas through the gateway of mantra.

original: chos kyi dbyings nam mkha'i spyod yul zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nam mkha'i spyod yul zhes pa ni /
translated: “The realm of phenomena, the domain of space”

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ste /
translated: They are on the stage of action in faith.

original: de rnams kyi shes rab kyi yon tan bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi shes rab kyi yon tan bshad pa ste /
translated: These are the qualities of their wisdom.

original: de dag gi shes rab kyi dbyings nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi shes rab kyi dbyings nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Their wisdom is the sphere of activity that focuses on the space-like realm of reality.

original: de dag chos kyi dbyings nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i spyod yul du gyur na sngags kyi tshul bshad ci dgos she na /
analyzed: de dag chos kyi dbyings nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i spyod yul du gyur na sngags kyi tshul bshad ci dgos she na /
translated: If they have the space-like realm of reality as their sphere of activity, why is the method of mantra taught?

original: de dag de ltar stong pa nyid kyi spyod yul du gyur kyang thabs kyis sems can sgrol bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag de ltar stong pa nyid kyi spyod yul du gyur kyang thabs kyis sems can sgrol bar byed do //
translated: Even though they have the sphere of activity of emptiness in that way, they liberate sentient beings by means of method.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral bar yid mches pa zhes pa ste /🔽de ltar thabs dang shes rab tu 'brel pa'i sngags kyi sgor byang chub @209a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral bar yid mches pa zhes pa ste / de ltar thabs dang shes rab tu 'brel pa'i sngags kyi sgor byang chub @209a * //
translated: “Those who are confident in liberating the entire realm of sentient beings”

original: sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor de nyon cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor de nyon cig ces pa'o //
translated: In that way, the bodhisattvas who practice the conduct of bodhisattvas through the connection of method and wisdom should listen to the maṇḍala for the sake of benefit and happiness.

original: de la don gyi phyir zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don mya ngan las 'das pa'am ma lus pa'i bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la don gyi phyir zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don mya ngan las 'das pa'am ma lus pa'i bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of the goal means for the sake of the bodhisattvas' goal, nirvana, or for the sake of complete happiness.

original: phan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyis la phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyis la phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of benefit means for the sake of benefit in both this life and the next.

original: bde ba'i phyir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir zhes pa ni /
translated: For the sake of happiness means

original: tshe 'di la bde ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //🔽gsang ba'i bdag po thog mar yang dag par kun du sangs rgyas pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor snga ma dag dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'o // gsang ba'i bdag po thog mar yang dag par kun du sangs rgyas pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor snga ma dag dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: for the sake of happiness in this life.

original: dang po snying po'i dkyil 'khor du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bri ba'i zhes pa ste bri tshul nyon cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: dang po snying po'i dkyil 'khor du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bri ba'i zhes pa ste bri tshul nyon cig ces pa'o //
translated: Lord of Secrets, first, draw the maṇḍala of the perfect, complete Buddha means as before with the maṇḍala, listen to the way of drawing the first maṇḍala of the essence, the Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //🔽gsang ba'i yang gsang ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro // gsang ba'i yang gsang ba zhes pa ni /
translated: It is connected with what follows below.🔽The secret of secrets means

original: gsang ba ni sems can gyi rang bzhin phra zhing dmigs su med pas na gsang ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni sems can gyi rang bzhin phra zhing dmigs su med pas na gsang ba'o //
translated: the secret is the nature of sentient beings, subtle and not observable, so it is secret.

original: de'i yang gsang ba ni dam tshig med pa'i sems can rnams la mi bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yang gsang ba ni dam tshig med pa'i sems can rnams la mi bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And its innermost secret is that it should not be taught to sentient beings who do not have the commitments.

original: snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The arising of the essence of great compassion is as before.

original: gang las 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor grangs med pa 'byung ba zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi dkyil 'khor ni gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor tshon gyis bri ba rnams so //
analyzed: gang las 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor grangs med pa 'byung ba zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi dkyil 'khor ni gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor tshon gyis bri ba rnams so //
translated: The source of the countless maṇḍalas of the mundane and supramundane refers to the mundane maṇḍalas, which are the maṇḍalas of images, the painted ones.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor te gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor rnams kyang 'di las 'phro ba dang / rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor kyang 'di mthong ba las shes par gyur pas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor te gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor rnams kyang 'di las 'phro ba dang / rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor kyang 'di mthong ba las shes par gyur pas na /
translated: The supramundane is the natural maṇḍala. Since the maṇḍalas of images also emanate from this, and the natural maṇḍala is known from seeing this,

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the source of the maṇḍalas of the mundane and supramundane.

original: yang na 'jig rten gyi lha rnams kyi dkyil 'khor dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha rnams kyi dkyil 'khor grangs med pa rnams kyang 'di las 'byung ba zhes pa ste de bri ba'i tshul nyon cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyi lha rnams kyi dkyil 'khor dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha rnams kyi dkyil 'khor grangs med pa rnams kyang 'di las 'byung ba zhes pa ste de bri ba'i tshul nyon cig ces pa'o //
translated: Or else, the mandalas of the worldly gods and the mandalas of the supramundane gods, which are innumerable, also arise from this. Listen to the way of drawing it.

original: kun du gru bzhi lham par te //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: kun du gru bzhi lham par te // zhes pa nas /
translated: It is completely square,

original: bri ba yang ni dpa' bos so //
analyzed: bri ba yang ni dpa' bos so //
translated: and the hero draws it.

original: zhes pa'i bar du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs pa'i snying po'i dkyil 'khor bri ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs pa'i snying po'i dkyil 'khor bri ba ste /
translated: This is the drawing of the mandala of the essence in which the Bhagavat Vairocana resides.

original: dkyil 'khor gyis bcad pa dang snam bu'i rim pa dang tshon dgye ba la sogs pa'i cho ga rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gong ma rnams su ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyis bcad pa dang snam bu'i rim pa dang tshon dgye ba la sogs pa'i cho ga rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gong ma rnams su ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: The rites of the divisions of the mandala, the stages of the platforms, the application of colors, and so forth are just as they are taught in the previous mandalas.

original: @209b kun du gru bzhi lham pa zhes pa ni tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan par ston pa'o //
analyzed: @209b kun du gru bzhi lham pa zhes pa ni tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan par ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is completely square teaches the possession of the four immeasurables.

original: sgo gcig ces pa ni sgo mang po nas chos kyi dbyings kyi sgo gcig tu 'du bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgo gcig ces pa ni sgo mang po nas chos kyi dbyings kyi sgo gcig tu 'du bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase one gate teaches that the many gates of the Dharma are included in the one gate of the dharmadhatu.

original: stegs bur bcas pa zhes pa ni mtha' tshon gyis bri ba'i dbus tshon ser pos bkang ste /
analyzed: stegs bur bcas pa zhes pa ni mtha' tshon gyis bri ba'i dbus tshon ser pos bkang ste /
translated: The platform is the center of the mandala, which is filled with yellow pigment after the rest of the mandala has been drawn with colored powders.

original: bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i gzhir bcas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i gzhir bcas zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the platform for the Bhagavat to stand on.

original: rdo rje'i mtshan mas btab pa zhes pa ni de'i nang du nub phyogs kyi logs su rdo rje rtse lnga pa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i mtshan mas btab pa zhes pa ni de'i nang du nub phyogs kyi logs su rdo rje rtse lnga pa gcig pa'o //
translated: The seal of the vajra is a single five-pronged vajra on the western side of the mandala.

original: dbus su rdo rje rtse brgya pa //
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje rtse brgya pa //
translated: In the center, a hundred-spoked vajra.

original: zhes pa ni rgyu'i tshe rnam par grol ba'i gzungs zhes brgya pa dang bcas pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rgyu'i tshe rnam par grol ba'i gzungs zhes brgya pa dang bcas pa bstan pa ste /
translated: At the time of the cause, the dhāraṇī of liberation is taught with a hundred verses.

original: rnam par grol ba'i sgor ye shes brgyar yang yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i le'u las yi ge aas mgo btsugs na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i sgor ye shes brgyar yang yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i le'u las yi ge aas mgo btsugs na /
translated: In the chapter The Wheel of Letters in the Gate of Liberation, the letter a is used as the beginning.

original: ka'i ris nas ya dang ra dang ba dang la yan chad kyi bar du yi ge nyi shu rtsa bzhi smos pa dang / dang po aa dang nyi shu lnga ste /
analyzed: ka'i ris nas ya dang ra dang ba dang la yan chad kyi bar du yi ge nyi shu rtsa bzhi smos pa dang / dang po aa dang nyi shu lnga ste /
translated: From the ka group up to ya, ra, va, la, the twenty-four letters are mentioned, and together with the first a, there are twenty-five.

original: de ltar aa dang bcas pa de yang nyi shu lnga /
analyzed: de ltar aa dang bcas pa de yang nyi shu lnga /
translated: Thus, together with a, there are twenty-five,

original: aa dang bcas pa nyi shu lnga /
analyzed: aa dang bcas pa nyi shu lnga /
translated: and together with a, there are twenty-five.

original: aa dang bcas pa nyi shu lnga ste /
analyzed: aa dang bcas pa nyi shu lnga ste /
translated: together with the syllable A, twenty-five.

original: de ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgya las ye shes brgyar sbyar ba'i rang bzhin rdo rje rtse brgya pa de'i dbus su bri'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgya las ye shes brgyar sbyar ba'i rang bzhin rdo rje rtse brgya pa de'i dbus su bri'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the center of that vajra with a hundred points, which has the nature of a hundred wisdoms applied to a hundred doors of liberation, one should draw the mandala.

original: sha dang sha ta ra sa dang / ha rnams ni cha gnyis pa'i nang du 'dus par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sha dang sha ta ra sa dang / ha rnams ni cha gnyis pa'i nang du 'dus par shes pa'o //
translated: The syllables Sha, Sha, Ta, Ra, Sa, and Ha are to be understood as included within the two parts.

original: de'i steng du padmo bri bar bya ba ni sa bon dang bcas pa rgyas par te zhes pa ni rdo rje de'i steng du padmo 'dab ma bzhi pa rang gi sa bon dang bcas pa bri ba'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du padmo bri bar bya ba ni sa bon dang bcas pa rgyas par te zhes pa ni rdo rje de'i steng du padmo 'dab ma bzhi pa rang gi sa bon dang bcas pa bri ba'o //
translated: On top of that, one should draw a lotus with its seed, extensively, means that on top of that vajra, one should draw a four-petaled lotus with its own seed.

original: de steng du yang padmo chen //
analyzed: de steng du yang padmo chen //
translated: On top of that, also a great lotus,

original: phyag rgya klad kyi 'khor gyis brgyan //
analyzed: phyag rgya klad kyi 'khor gyis brgyan //
translated: adorned with the head-ornament mudra,

original: 'dab ma brgyad kyang rdzogs par te //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad kyang rdzogs par te //
translated: with eight complete petals,

original: ge sar bcas pa shin tu bzang //
analyzed: ge sar bcas pa shin tu bzang //
translated: together with a stamen, very beautiful.

original: zhes pa ni padmo'i steng du yang padmo chen po 'dab ma brgyad pa bris pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni padmo'i steng du yang padmo chen po 'dab ma brgyad pa bris pa ste /
translated: Means that on top of the lotus, one should draw a great lotus with eight petals.

original: phyag rgya klad kor gyis brgyan zhes pa ni klad kor ni stong pa nyid du ston pa'i tshig yin pas yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rig pa'i rgyal po la bya ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya klad kor gyis brgyan zhes pa ni klad kor ni stong pa nyid du ston pa'i tshig yin pas yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rig pa'i rgyal po la bya ste /
translated: The seal is adorned with a zero, which is a word indicating emptiness, so it refers to the king of knowledge of the twelve branches.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis tshig bri bar //🔽zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis tshig bri bar // zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The twelve branches are to be written in words.🔽This is to be connected with the eight in the mandala.

original: phyag rgya ni gsang ba'i phyag rgya brgyad pa ste brgyad pa dkyil 'khor gyi zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya ni gsang ba'i phyag rgya brgyad pa ste brgyad pa dkyil 'khor gyi zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The seal is the eight secret seals. The eight are to be connected with in the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor 'og ma 'dir lha so so'i dkyil 'khor ji skad du bshad pa las de rnams kyi kha dog kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'og ma 'dir lha so so'i dkyil 'khor ji skad du bshad pa las de rnams kyi kha dog kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: are also to be understood as the colors of the individual deities in this lower maṇḍala, just as they are explained in their respective maṇḍalas.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i cho ga gsungs pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i cho ga gsungs pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, the Bhagavān spoke the ritual for entering the secret maṇḍala.

original: dam tshig ces su gzhan mi bya //
analyzed: dam tshig ces su gzhan mi bya //
translated: “Do not do anything else called ‘samaya.’🔽”

original: zhes pa'i bar du gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du bcug nas dbang bskur ba'i cho ga bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du bcug nas dbang bskur ba'i cho ga bshad pa ste /
translated: Up to this point, having entered the secret maṇḍala, the ritual of conferring empowerment is explained.

original: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i rim pa lnga ste nub mo lhag par gnas shing sdom pa gzung ba la sogs pa dang / dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe bsrung zhing chus gdab pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor snga mar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i rim pa lnga ste nub mo lhag par gnas shing sdom pa gzung ba la sogs pa dang / dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe bsrung zhing chus gdab pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor snga mar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: There are five stages of entering the maṇḍala: the evening of the preparatory rite, taking the vows, and so on; when entering the maṇḍala, protecting and sprinkling with water; generating the mind of awakening, and so on, are the same as explained in the previous maṇḍala.

original: khyad par du ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgo khyud kyi nad du slob ma snga ma bzhin du bzhag ste /
analyzed: khyad par du ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgo khyud kyi nad du slob ma snga ma bzhin du bzhag ste /
translated: In particular, the disciples are placed in the maṇḍala as before.

original: slob dpon yang snga ma bzhin du rang rang gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas /
analyzed: slob dpon yang snga ma bzhin du rang rang gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas /
translated: The master also, as before, abiding in his or her samādhi,

original: slob ma'i snying gar yi ge ra bsams te /
analyzed: slob ma'i snying gar yi ge ra bsams te /
translated: visualizes the syllable raṃ in the disciple’s heart.

original: yi ge sgra de kho na nyid chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba la dmigs nas /
analyzed: yi ge sgra de kho na nyid chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba la dmigs nas /
translated: Having focused on the reality of the sound of the syllable ra, all phenomena are free from dust.

original: slob ma de'i lus rdul phran la sogs par gshegs te rdul phran de dag kyang mi dmigs par bya ste /
analyzed: slob ma de'i lus rdul phran la sogs par gshegs te rdul phran de dag kyang mi dmigs par bya ste /
translated: The body of that disciple is reduced to atoms, and those atoms are also made imperceptible.

original: yi ge ra'i sgra las don dam par slob ma'i lus stong par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge ra'i sgra las don dam par slob ma'i lus stong par bya'o //
translated: From the sound of the syllable ra, the disciple's body is ultimately made empty.

original: de ltar bsams nas yi ge ra'i me des slob ma'i lus bsregs te thal bar gyur par bsams te /
analyzed: de ltar bsams nas yi ge ra'i me des slob ma'i lus bsregs te thal bar gyur par bsams te /
translated: Having contemplated in that way, the syllable ra burns the disciple's body with fire and imagines that it becomes ash.

original: de ltar stong par gyur pa dang de'i gnas @215a * //
analyzed: de ltar stong par gyur pa dang de'i gnas @215a * //
translated: Having become empty in that way, in that place

original: su yang yi ge aa bsams te /
analyzed: su yang yi ge aa bsams te /
translated: one should imagine the syllable a.

original: aa las bcom ldan 'das kyi skur gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: aa las bcom ldan 'das kyi skur gyur par bsam mo //
translated: From the a, one should imagine that the Bhagavān's form arises.🔽That is the concise meaning.🔽The meaning of the branches is stated: The reciter refers to the master.

original: de ni bsdus don te yan lag gi don du gsungs pa sngags pa kun du bzlas te zhes pa ni slob dpon snying rje chen po dang 'byung ba'i yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor bri ba dang / dbang bskur ba dang /
analyzed: de ni bsdus don te yan lag gi don du gsungs pa sngags pa kun du bzlas te zhes pa ni slob dpon snying rje chen po dang 'byung ba'i yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor bri ba dang / dbang bskur ba dang /
translated: Reciting refers to drawing the maṇḍala of the two maṇḍalas of great compassion and the wheel of the syllables and conferring empowerment.

original: bzlas pa dang sgrub pa la sogs pa'i cho ga bzlas te lobs par gyur cing mkhas pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa dang sgrub pa la sogs pa'i cho ga bzlas te lobs par gyur cing mkhas pa zhes pa'o //
translated: One who is skilled is one who has repeated the rites of recitation, attainment, and so forth, and has become learned.

original: dkyil 'khor mkhas pas zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gong ma gnyis la mkhas pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mkhas pas zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gong ma gnyis la mkhas pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: One who is skilled in the maṇḍala is not only skilled in the two higher maṇḍalas,

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor la yang bri ba dang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho ga rnams mkhas pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor la yang bri ba dang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho ga rnams mkhas pa zhes pa ste /
translated: but is also skilled in the rites of drawing and conferring empowerment in the secret maṇḍala.

original: mdor na dkyil 'khor gong ma gnyis su yang dbang bskur ba'i slob dpon gyi las 'di rnams bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na dkyil 'khor gong ma gnyis su yang dbang bskur ba'i slob dpon gyi las 'di rnams bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: In brief, in the two higher maṇḍalas, these activities of the empowerment master should be performed.

original: sdig pa ma lus kun bsregs pa //🔽cho ga de slob ma'i zhes pa ni dang po gleng ba'i tshig ste sdig pa rnams zhes pa ni sems kyi rgyud la mi dge ba'i bag chags bsags pa mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa lta bar byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sdig pa ma lus kun bsregs pa // cho ga de slob ma'i zhes pa ni dang po gleng ba'i tshig ste sdig pa rnams zhes pa ni sems kyi rgyud la mi dge ba'i bag chags bsags pa mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa lta bar byed pa la bya ste /
translated: Having burned all misdeeds without remainder,🔽The rite is for the disciple. The words misdeeds refer to the accumulation of non-virtuous latent tendencies in the continuum of the mind, which cause undesirable fruitions.

original: slob ma'i sdig pa de 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho gas bsreg ces pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma'i sdig pa de 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho gas bsreg ces pa'o //
translated: The misdeeds of the disciple are to be burned by the rite that will be explained below.

original: de'i 'tsho ba bsreg pa ni phyin chad slar mi 'khrungs par de shin tu tshig nas thal bar gyur zhes pa ni gong du sdig pa bsreg ces smos pa de ji ltar bsreg par gsal bar gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'tsho ba bsreg pa ni phyin chad slar mi 'khrungs par de shin tu tshig nas thal bar gyur zhes pa ni gong du sdig pa bsreg ces smos pa de ji ltar bsreg par gsal bar gsungs pa ste /
translated: The burning of its life is the non-rebirth of it in the future. It is said that it is burned up and becomes ashes. This is a clear statement of how the previously mentioned burning of the sin is done.

original: de'i 'tsho ba zhes pa de ni slob ma de'i lnga phung la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'tsho ba zhes pa de ni slob ma de'i lnga phung la bya'o //
translated: The “its life” refers to the five aggregates of the disciple.

original: phyin chad slar mi 'khrungs pa de zhes pa ni lnga phung de ltar bsregs te /
analyzed: phyin chad slar mi 'khrungs pa de zhes pa ni lnga phung de ltar bsregs te /
translated: “The non-rebirth of it in the future” means that the five aggregates are burned up in that way.

original: stong par byas nas de nyid kyi tshe na /
analyzed: stong par byas nas de nyid kyi tshe na /
translated: When they are made empty,

original: slob ma de'i lnga phung yod par 'du shes mi skye bar bya zhes pa'o //🔽shin tu tshig nas thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: slob ma de'i lnga phung yod par 'du shes mi skye bar bya zhes pa'o // shin tu tshig nas thal bar 'gyur //
translated: one should not generate the idea that the five aggregates of the disciple exist.

original: zhes pa ni bsreg pa yang lhag ma yod pa ma yin par shin tu tshig nas stong pa nyid du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes pa'o //🔽slad du yang ni de gso'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsreg pa yang lhag ma yod pa ma yin par shin tu tshig nas stong pa nyid du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes pa'o // slad du yang ni de gso'o //
translated: “It is burned up and becomes ashes” means that the burning is not done with any remainder. It is burned up and becomes emptiness.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid du brtan par gyur nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid du brtan par gyur nas /
translated: “It is revived again” means that when it has become firm in that way as emptiness,

original: slob ma de slar rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs su 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig gis sbyar ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma de slar rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs su 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig gis sbyar ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The disciple is again united with the form of Vairocana by the words that will come later.

original: de ltar slob ma de de'i tshe tsho ba bsreg go zhes smos pa tsam du zad kyi cis bsreg / ji ltar bsreg ces gsungs pa yi ge su ni yi ge bsres ces pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar slob ma de de'i tshe tsho ba bsreg go zhes smos pa tsam du zad kyi cis bsreg / ji ltar bsreg ces gsungs pa yi ge su ni yi ge bsres ces pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is said that the disciple is burned at that time, but it is not said by what he is burned, nor how he is burned. The word su is the mixing of the syllables.

original: yi ge su ni zhes pa ni yi ger der sngar smos @215b pa'i tshul du slob ma'i lnga phung de bsreg ces pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge su ni zhes pa ni yi ger der sngar smos @215b pa'i tshul du slob ma'i lnga phung de bsreg ces pa'o //
translated: The word su is the burning of the five aggregates of the disciple in the way previously mentioned in the syllables.

original: yi ge zhes pa'i tshig gnyis pa de ni mi 'gyur ba zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge zhes pa'i tshig gnyis pa de ni mi 'gyur ba zhes pa ste /
translated: The second word su is unchanging.

original: de ltar bsregs te stong par gyur nas kyang slar lnga phung mi skye bar stong par 'gyur ba las gzhan du mi 'gyur bar ting nge 'dzin gyis brtan par bya'o zhes pa'o //🔽'tsho ba yang ni phyir gso ba //
analyzed: de ltar bsregs te stong par gyur nas kyang slar lnga phung mi skye bar stong par 'gyur ba las gzhan du mi 'gyur bar ting nge 'dzin gyis brtan par bya'o zhes pa'o // 'tsho ba yang ni phyir gso ba //
translated: Thus, having been burned and become empty, the five aggregates should be stabilized by concentration so that they do not arise again, becoming empty, not becoming anything else.🔽And life is restored again.

original: 'tsho ba yis ni 'tsho ba ste //
analyzed: 'tsho ba yis ni 'tsho ba ste //
translated: Life is the living.

original: zhes pa ni slad du yang ni gso'o zhes pa'i tshig snga ma de'i 'grel pa ste slob ma'i 'tsho ba lnga phung ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni slad du yang ni gso'o zhes pa'i tshig snga ma de'i 'grel pa ste slob ma'i 'tsho ba lnga phung ste /
translated: This is the commentary on the earlier words, “and again and again” .

original: stong par gyur pa las yi ge aa 'tsho bar gyur pa des slar sangs rgyas kyi skur gong du smos pa'i tshul du bsgyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong par gyur pa las yi ge aa 'tsho bar gyur pa des slar sangs rgyas kyi skur gong du smos pa'i tshul du bsgyur zhes pa'o //
translated: From the emptiness arises the letter A, which becomes the life-force. By that, one should again transform into the Buddha-body, as previously described.

original: kun du dag pa zhes pa ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: kun du dag pa zhes pa ni dkar po'o //
translated: “Pure” means “white”.

original: dri ma med pa zhes pa ni gsal ba zhes pa ste sangs rgyas kyi skur bsgyur ba dkar zhig gsal bar bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa zhes pa ni gsal ba zhes pa ste sangs rgyas kyi skur bsgyur ba dkar zhig gsal bar bya zhes pa'o //
translated: “Stainless” means “clear”. One should transform into the Buddha-body, which is white and clear.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis tshig gis btab //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis tshig gis btab //
translated: The twelve-branched one is written.

original: de yi snod du gyur par bya //
analyzed: de yi snod du gyur par bya //
translated: One should make it into a vessel for that.

original: zhes pa ni de'i gdan padmo la yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshig rnams dgod par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i gdan padmo la yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshig rnams dgod par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that one should write the words of the twelve branches on the lotus seat of that .

original: sa ma ya 'dis sangs rgyas kun //
analyzed: sa ma ya 'dis sangs rgyas kun //
translated: By this samaya, all the Buddhas

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /

original: 'jig rten rnams kyang thar par ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyang thar par ro //
translated: . . . and the worlds are liberated.

original: zhes pa'i bar du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten pa rnams kyang dam tshig 'di la mos shing 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten pa rnams kyang dam tshig 'di la mos shing 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: Up to this point, the buddhas, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and worldly beings all aspire to and agree with this pledge.

original: dam tshig 'di ni sus rig pa //
analyzed: dam tshig 'di ni sus rig pa //
translated: Whoever knows this pledge

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus su ste //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus su ste //
translated: in the center of the secret maṇḍala

original: rgyud kun du yang bzhugs pa yin //
analyzed: rgyud kun du yang bzhugs pa yin //
translated: is present in all tantras

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad la yang dbang //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad la yang dbang //
translated: and has power over all maṇḍalas.

original: zhes pa ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul bstan pa ni /
translated: This teaches that the way of meditative concentration like this in the center of the secret maṇḍala

original: rgyud thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: is like entering the maṇḍala of all tantras.

original: thams cad kyi dam tshig can du gyur pa dang / dkyil 'khor thams cad kyang 'dir dbang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi dam tshig can du gyur pa dang / dkyil 'khor thams cad kyang 'dir dbang zhes pa'o //
translated: It is to become one who has the pledge of all, and all maṇḍalas are empowered here.

original: sngags pa de ni nga dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sngags pa de ni nga dang 'dra'o //
translated: That mantrin is like me.

original: zhes pa ni gong du slar gsos nas dkar zhing gsal bar bya zhes pa ni spyir smos pa tsam du zad kyi tshig 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs nyid du bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du slar gsos nas dkar zhing gsal bar bya zhes pa ni spyir smos pa tsam du zad kyi tshig 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs nyid du bya zhes pa'o //
translated: The line having revived it, make it white and clear is a general statement, but this line means make it into the very form of the Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: dam tshig ces su gzhan mi bya //
analyzed: dam tshig ces su gzhan mi bya //
translated: One should not do it otherwise,🔽as a pledge.

original: zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin de lta bur ma byas te log par gzhan du byas na dam tshig tu mi bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin de lta bur ma byas te log par gzhan du byas na dam tshig tu mi bya zhes pa'o //
translated: If one does not do it as a meditative stabilization, but does it otherwise, one should not do it as a pledge.

original: dam tshig ces pa ni skabs 'dir stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin pas chud pa la bya'o //🔽ting @216a * //
analyzed: dam tshig ces pa ni skabs 'dir stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin pas chud pa la bya'o // ting @216a * //
translated: In this context, pledge means the meditative stabilization of emptiness.

original: de 'dzin de yang dang po sreg pa ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de 'dzin de yang dang po sreg pa ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: That meditative stabilization is as follows: First, having burned is the entering mind.

original: bsregs nas stong pa'i rang bzhin du gnas te mi 'gyur ba ni gnas pa'i sems so //
analyzed: bsregs nas stong pa'i rang bzhin du gnas te mi 'gyur ba ni gnas pa'i sems so //
translated: Having burned, it abides in the nature of emptiness, unchanging, which is the abiding mind.

original: de nas slar gsos te bcom ldan 'das kyi skur bsgyur ba ni ldang ba'i sems su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slar gsos te bcom ldan 'das kyi skur bsgyur ba ni ldang ba'i sems su shes par bya'o //
