translated: Then, having revived it, one should understand that transforming it into the body of the Bhagavat is the rising mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi skur bsgyur pa'i tshe yang gsang ba'i phyag rgya 'og nas 'byung ba rnams kyi gdan dang / yan lag 'od la sogs pa 'og nas ji skad du byung ba'i rim bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi skur bsgyur pa'i tshe yang gsang ba'i phyag rgya 'og nas 'byung ba rnams kyi gdan dang / yan lag 'od la sogs pa 'og nas ji skad du byung ba'i rim bzhin du bya'o //
translated: When transforming into the body of the Bhagavān, the seats and limbs, light, and so on, of the secret mudras that will be explained below should be done in the sequence as they occur below.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa gzhan gyi gzugs su bsgyur na phyag rgya de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs na brtan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa gzhan gyi gzugs su bsgyur na phyag rgya de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs na brtan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one transforms into the form of another, such as a bodhisattva, and so on, if they are empowered with those mudras, they will be stable.

original: da ni nang gi yid kyi dkyil 'khor bri ba'i skabs 'chad de /
analyzed: da ni nang gi yid kyi dkyil 'khor bri ba'i skabs 'chad de /
translated: Now the section on drawing the inner mental maṇḍala is explained.

original: yid kyi dkyil 'khor bri ba yang spyir dkyil 'khor gnyis te /
analyzed: yid kyi dkyil 'khor bri ba yang spyir dkyil 'khor gnyis te /
translated: Drawing the mental maṇḍala is, in general, two maṇḍalas:

original: rang gi gzugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: the maṇḍala of one’s form and the maṇḍala of the reflected image.

original: de la rang gi gzugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni rgya che zhing bsam gyis mi khyab ste mdor bsdus pa bstan pa ni yid kyi dkyil 'khor du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi gzugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni rgya che zhing bsam gyis mi khyab ste mdor bsdus pa bstan pa ni yid kyi dkyil 'khor du shes par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the maṇḍala of one’s form is vast and inconceivable. The maṇḍala that is taught in brief should be understood as the mental maṇḍala.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor kyang ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin du rdzogs par dka' ste /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor kyang ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin du rdzogs par dka' ste /
translated: It is difficult to complete the mandala of images just as it is taught.

original: de ni mdor bsdus pa ni phyi ma'i rgyud las dkyil 'khor bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdus pa ni phyi ma'i rgyud las dkyil 'khor bshad pa'o //
translated: That is the brief explanation of the mandala in the Continuation Tantra.

original: de bas na yid kyi dkyil 'khor 'di'i sgo nas sems kyi rang bzhin gyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor ji 'dra ba'i tshul shes par 'gyur te 'di ni 'jug pa lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: de bas na yid kyi dkyil 'khor 'di'i sgo nas sems kyi rang bzhin gyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor ji 'dra ba'i tshul shes par 'gyur te 'di ni 'jug pa lta bur blta'o //
translated: Therefore, through this mental mandala, one will understand the mode of the secret mandala of the nature of mind, which is like the entrance.

original: yid kyi dkyil 'khor de bri ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin du zhugs nas /
analyzed: yid kyi dkyil 'khor de bri ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin du zhugs nas /
translated: In order to explain the method of drawing that mental mandala, the Bhagavān entered into samādhi.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de thams cad lag mthil dang mnyam par gyur pa dang rin po che sna lnga'i rta babs dang sgo khyud la sogs pa rnam pa mang pos brgyan par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de thams cad lag mthil dang mnyam par gyur pa dang rin po che sna lnga'i rta babs dang sgo khyud la sogs pa rnam pa mang pos brgyan par bstan pa ste /
translated: The entire buddha field became like the palm of the hand, and it was shown to be adorned with many features, such as gateways and porticos made of the five precious substances.

original: de dag thams cad kyang dngos po yod pa ma yin pa las /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang dngos po yod pa ma yin pa las /
translated: All of those are not existent things.

original: sems kyi dbang tsam las ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du 'byung bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang tsam las ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du 'byung bar bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that everything arises just as one thinks, by the power of the mind alone.

original: de bas na yid kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i yid kyis bskyed pa thams cad sbyor bas thog mar sems mnyam par gzhag pa la dgod pa'i mgon ji ltar gyur cig ces bsams shing /
analyzed: de bas na yid kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i yid kyis bskyed pa thams cad sbyor bas thog mar sems mnyam par gzhag pa la dgod pa'i mgon ji ltar gyur cig ces bsams shing /
translated: Therefore, one should think, “How can I be a protector who first establishes all that is created by the mind, such as the maṇḍala of the mind, in equipoise?”

original: smon lam btab la ting nge 'dzin la zhugs na ji ltar smon pa de ltar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: smon lam btab la ting nge 'dzin la zhugs na ji ltar smon pa de ltar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Having made this aspiration, one should understand that it will be just as aspired if one enters into samādhi.

original: de ltar yid kyi dkyil 'khor bri ba'i thabs bstan @216b pa yang /
analyzed: de ltar yid kyi dkyil 'khor bri ba'i thabs bstan @216b pa yang /
translated: Thus, the method of drawing the maṇḍala of the mind is taught.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba la gzigs nas kun rjes su chud pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba la gzigs nas kun rjes su chud pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, Bhagavān Mahāvairocana, looking at the future migrating beings, entered into the samādhi called “Comprehending All.”

original: bcom ldan 'das sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sems can gyi don bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sems can gyi don bya ba la /
translated: The Bhagavān, by the power of his previous aspirations, acts for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: sogs pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung bas ting nge 'dzin du 'jug mi dgos mod kyi /
analyzed: sogs pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung bas ting nge 'dzin du 'jug mi dgos mod kyi /
translated: Since the rest are spontaneously accomplished, there is no need to enter into concentration.

original: 'on kyang dngos po gang bstan par bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs nas byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa 'dul ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa dang zhugs nas ji ltar ston par 'gyur🔽ba la sogs pa shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po gang bstan par bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs nas byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa 'dul ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa dang zhugs nas ji ltar ston par 'gyur ba la sogs pa shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Nevertheless, having entered into the concentration which is to be taught, the Bodhisattvas, Samantabhadra and so forth, will know why the Lord has entered into concentration, how he will teach, and so forth.

original: de ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin du 'jug go //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin du 'jug go //
translated: Why does the Lord enter into concentration?

original: kun du rjes su chud pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: kun du rjes su chud pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase he is completely absorbed means that

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la zhugs nas don dam par chos kyi dbyings kun du khyab par chud pa dang / kun rdzob tu yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad lag mthil bzhin du mnyam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la zhugs nas don dam par chos kyi dbyings kun du khyab par chud pa dang / kun rdzob tu yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad lag mthil bzhin du mnyam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: having entered into concentration, the Lord is completely absorbed in the ultimate expanse which pervades everywhere, and also that, in the relative, all buddha-fields become as level as the palm of the hand and so forth.

original: gnas brtan pa rnams kyis khyad par du chud pa ste bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la zhugs na don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu chud pa de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de'i ming kun du chud pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan pa rnams kyis khyad par du chud pa ste bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la zhugs na don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu chud pa de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de'i ming kun du chud pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The Sthaviras understand it as the ultimate and the conventional, because when the Bhagavat enters into samadhi, those two, the ultimate and the conventional, are understood.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba la gzigs nas zhes pa ni kun du bzang po dang phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' yongs su dag pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba la gzigs nas zhes pa ni kun du bzang po dang phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' yongs su dag pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: The phrase looking at the future world means that the completely pure bodhisattvas, such as Samantabhadra and Vajrapani,

original: de dag ji lta ba nyid du mkhyen gyi ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du dngos po yod pa ma yin pa las /
analyzed: de dag ji lta ba nyid du mkhyen gyi ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du dngos po yod pa ma yin pa las /
translated: know it just as it is, but for the sake of the future world, from the non-existence of things,

original: sems kyi dbang tsam gyis rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba bstan pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang tsam gyis rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba bstan pa zhes pa'o //
translated: the arising of various aspects through the power of mind alone is taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu /
translated: Immediately after the Bhagavat entered into samadhi,

original: de nas de'i tshe nyid na sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di lag mthil bzhin du mnyam par 'dug par gyur te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe nyid na sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di lag mthil bzhin du mnyam par 'dug par gyur te zhes pa ni /
translated: the phrase then at that very time, this buddha realm became level like the palm of the hand means🔽that🔽the buddha realm became level like the palm of the hand.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba na sngar sa mthon dman la sogs pa bsnyams shing sbyang dgos te /🔽de'i thabs bstan pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di zhes pa ni mi mjed kyi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i khams so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba na sngar sa mthon dman la sogs pa bsnyams shing sbyang dgos te / de'i thabs bstan pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di zhes pa ni mi mjed kyi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i khams so //
translated: When drawing the mandala, one should first level the ground, removing high and low spots, and so on.🔽The method for doing that is taught by the passage beginning with “This buddha-field” and ending with “like the palm of my hand.”

original: lag mthil bzhin du mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: lag mthil bzhin du mnyam par 'gyur //
translated: “This buddha-field” refers to the trichiliocosm of the Sahā world system.

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ri dang gcong rong la sogs pa med par mnyam par gyur @217a * //🔽ces pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ri dang gcong rong la sogs pa med par mnyam par gyur @217a * // ces pa ste /
translated: “Will become as level as the palm of my hand” means that that buddha-field will become level, without mountains, ravines, and so on.

original: tshig des ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi 'gro ba rnams nam dkyil 'khor brin dkyil 'khor gyis de ltar lag mthil bzhin du mnyam par sbyang bar bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig des ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi 'gro ba rnams nam dkyil 'khor brin dkyil 'khor gyis de ltar lag mthil bzhin du mnyam par sbyang bar bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with “This buddha-field” and ending with “like the palm of my hand” teaches that in the future, when drawing the mandala, one should level the ground like the palm of one’s hand.

original: sgo khyud dang rta babs rin po che sna lngas so sor brgyan pa zhes pa nas sil snyan du ma'i sgra 'jam po yid du 'ong ba ni rab tu grag pa'o zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing de mnyam par gyur nas kyang rgyan de dag gis brgyan🔽pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sgo khyud dang rta babs rin po che sna lngas so sor brgyan pa zhes pa nas sil snyan du ma'i sgra 'jam po yid du 'ong ba ni rab tu grag pa'o zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing de mnyam par gyur nas kyang rgyan de dag gis brgyan pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the gateways and archways are individually adorned with the five precious substances” indicates that the buddha field is even and adorned with those ornaments.

original: des ni dkyil 'khor gyi sa de dag brtan nas rta babs dang sgo khyud dang gdugs dang ba dan la sogs pas brgyan pa dang / ri mo rnams kyis brgyan par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des ni dkyil 'khor gyi sa de dag brtan nas rta babs dang sgo khyud dang gdugs dang ba dan la sogs pas brgyan pa dang / ri mo rnams kyis brgyan par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa'o //
translated: This passage teaches the method of adorning the mandala base with archways, gateways, parasols, banners, and so on, and with paintings.

original: dri zhim po yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdzing bu smos pa ni rdzing bu la sogs pa chu dang nye gnas su dkyil 'khor bri ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dri zhim po yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdzing bu smos pa ni rdzing bu la sogs pa chu dang nye gnas su dkyil 'khor bri ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The mention of ponds that have the eight qualities and that are fragrant teaches the method of drawing the mandala in a pond or other body of water.

original: yan lag brgyad kyi rdzing bu de ni chu bsil ba dang / dang ba dang mngar ba la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi ji ltar bsags pa'i yid kyis bsten pa dang / khang pa dang gzhal med khang du ma dang ldan zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so'i bsod nams ji tsam las so so nas stan dang khang pa dang lding khang la sogs pa🔽dang ldan pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad kyi rdzing bu de ni chu bsil ba dang / dang ba dang mngar ba la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi ji ltar bsags pa'i yid kyis bsten pa dang / khang pa dang gzhal med khang du ma dang ldan zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so'i bsod nams ji tsam las so so nas stan dang khang pa dang lding khang la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes pa ste /
translated: It has many houses and palaces, which means that the bodhisattvas who arise from the perfection of the buddha-field have their own individual houses, palaces, and so forth, in accordance with their individual merit.

original: des kyang dkyil 'khor gyis der byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa lha rnams so so'i gnas dang bcas par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang dkyil 'khor gyis der byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa lha rnams so so'i gnas dang bcas par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This also indicates that the bodhisattvas and so forth should be placed in their individual places in the mandala.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa las byung ba zhes pa nas bsod nams rnam par bskyed pa'i sku rnams 'byung zhes pa'i bar du sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i dbus na padmo'i rgyal po la de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa las byung ba zhes pa nas bsod nams rnam par bskyed pa'i sku rnams 'byung zhes pa'i bar du sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i dbus na padmo'i rgyal po la de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs te /
translated: The passage from “the tathāgata’s arisen from interest” up to “the bodies that generate merit” indicates that in the center of that buddha field, the tathāgata sits on a king of lotuses.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ye shes kyis sems can chos kyi tshig ston pa sha stag 'byung ngo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ye shes kyis sems can chos kyi tshig ston pa sha stag 'byung ngo zhes pa ste /
translated: The passage from “the tathāgata’s body” up to “the words of the Dharma” indicates that the tathāgata’s body is the source of the wisdom that teaches sentient beings the words of the Dharma.

original: de yang dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku las gyur pa'i lha rnams kyis bskor zhing bzhugs par bya ba bstan pa'o //🔽des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa las byung ba chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i mtshan mas btab ces pa ni /
analyzed: de yang dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku las gyur pa'i lha rnams kyis bskor zhing bzhugs par bya ba bstan pa'o // des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa las byung ba chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i mtshan mas btab ces pa ni /
translated: This passage teaches that in the center of the maṇḍala, the Bhagavān Vairocana sits surrounded by the deities that are emanations of the tathāgata’s body.

original: padmo'i rgyal po de'i bye brag ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa las 'byung ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: padmo'i rgyal po de'i bye brag ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa las 'byung ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, the passage from “the tathāgata’s arisen from interest” up to “the seal of the realization of the dharmadhātu” indicates a particular king of lotuses. The tathāgata’s arisen from interest is as explained above.

original: chos kyi dbyings @217b rtogs pa zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes dag pa la bya ste de'i mtshan mas btab pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings @217b rtogs pa zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes dag pa la bya ste de'i mtshan mas btab pa ni /
translated: The phrase “realization of the realm of phenomena” refers to the purity of the gnosis of suchness. The phrase “sealed with its seal” means

original: ye shes dag pa de'i mtshan mas dkar bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes dag pa de'i mtshan mas dkar bar shes par bya ste /
translated: that it should be known as white, the color of that pure gnosis.

original: mdor na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ye shes dag pa de padmo chen po'i rgyal po rgyal por snang bar byin gyis brlab ces pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ye shes dag pa de padmo chen po'i rgyal po rgyal por snang bar byin gyis brlab ces pa'o //
translated: In brief, the Tathāgata himself, that pure gnosis, is blessed to appear as the king of great lotuses.

original: de'i dbus na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhugs pa zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid de las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku 'byung bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhugs pa zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid de las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku 'byung bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “in the middle of that, the Tathāgata’s body resides” means that the body of the Blessed One Vairocana arises from the gnosis of suchness, which has the characteristic of the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings la ston pa zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ston pa zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the realm of phenomena is the teacher” means that it has the nature of emptiness.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur kyang phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das bzhin pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur kyang phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das bzhin pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, although the Lord has become the nature of emptiness, he is not like the nirvana in which the aggregates are left behind.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis rnam par mi rtog bzhin du kun rdzob kyi bya ba thams cad 'byung bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis rnam par mi rtog bzhin du kun rdzob kyi bya ba thams cad 'byung bar bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that, by the power of his previous aspirations, all the activities of the relative level occur without his having to think about them.

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du mgu bar byed pa zhes pa'o //🔽mi tshugs pa'i stobs dang stobs bcu'i mos pa las 'byung zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku las 'byung ba'i sku de rnams kyi mthus cis kyang mi tshugs pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du mgu bar byed pa zhes pa'o // mi tshugs pa'i stobs dang stobs bcu'i mos pa las 'byung zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku las 'byung ba'i sku de rnams kyi mthus cis kyang mi tshugs pa sha stag ste /
translated: It is the satisfaction of beings according to their wishes and their faith.🔽It is the arising of the ten powers of interest in the invincible strength.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rgyu de'i tshe kun du sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid stobs bcu la mos pa bskyed pa de ni 'bras bu stobs bcu rdzogs par 'gyur ba las byung ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rgyu de'i tshe kun du sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid stobs bcu la mos pa bskyed pa de ni 'bras bu stobs bcu rdzogs par 'gyur ba las byung ba zhes pa'o //
translated: The bodies that arise from the body of the Lord are invincible by nature, and that is due to the fact that the Lord himself, at the time of his complete enlightenment, developed interest in the ten powers, the characteristic of complete enlightenment.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs su sna tshogs du mar ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo zhes pa ni sku mang po 'byung ba dag gi khyad par te /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs su sna tshogs du mar ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo zhes pa ni sku mang po 'byung ba dag gi khyad par te /
translated: The phrase “the essence that has the nature of many colors and shapes” is a particular of the many bodies that arise.

original: de dag gi kha dog dang gzugs sna tshogs su bcas pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi kha dog dang gzugs sna tshogs su bcas pa zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the “possession of many colors and forms.”

original: sku mang po de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das nyid byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod tshe bskal pa grangs med par sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba bstan pa bskal pa bye
analyzed: sku mang po de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das nyid byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod tshe bskal pa grangs med par sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba bstan pa bskal pa bye
translated: Those many bodies are also taught to have arisen from the cause of the Blessed One’s accumulation of the collection of merit through the perfections of generosity and so on when he was practicing the bodhisattva deeds for countless eons.

original: ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “for many hundreds of thousands of eons” and so on.

original: de byung nas 'jig rten pa'i khams thams cad du gleng ba'i tshig 'di skad du dbyangs gcig gis kun du bsgo'o zhes pa de ltar gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing lag mthil lta bu mnyam pa la sogs pa dngos su snang bar chud pa'i🔽chos rnams bstan pa de nyid gzhung gi chos su @218a * //
analyzed: de byung nas 'jig rten pa'i khams thams cad du gleng ba'i tshig 'di skad du dbyangs gcig gis kun du bsgo'o zhes pa de ltar gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing lag mthil lta bu mnyam pa la sogs pa dngos su snang bar chud pa'i chos rnams bstan pa de nyid gzhung gi chos su @218a * //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat, having actually appeared in the Buddha-field which is like the palm of the hand, etc.,🔽taught the Dharma. That very Dharma is taught by the words of the verses which follow in the text.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyi tshig gis bstan pa ste de yang /
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyi tshig gis bstan pa ste de yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: ae ma'o sangs rgyas kun gyi ni //🔽zhes pa nas /🔽mgon po kun gyis gang rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o sangs rgyas kun gyi ni // zhes pa nas / mgon po kun gyis gang rnyed pa'o //
translated: Amazing! All the Buddhas'

original: zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: is up to the Protector of all, who has attained it.

original: de la ae ma'o zhes pa ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la ae ma'o zhes pa ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
translated: There, amazing! is the wonder.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi ni shes rab dang thabs rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes pa dang sbyar te shes rab ni chos thams cad bdag med par chud pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi ni shes rab dang thabs rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes pa dang sbyar te shes rab ni chos thams cad bdag med par chud pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: All the Buddhas' is the inconceivable wisdom and means. Wisdom is the nature of the penetration of all dharmas as selfless.

original: thabs de ni de ltar chos thams cad stong par chud kyang sems can gyi don du dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs yod par ston te /
analyzed: thabs de ni de ltar chos thams cad stong par chud kyang sems can gyi don du dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs yod par ston te /
translated: That method is as follows: although one understands all phenomena to be empty, one teaches the existence of various kinds of things for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de dag ngo mtshar che ste bsam gyis mi khyab ces pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ngo mtshar che ste bsam gyis mi khyab ces pa'o //
translated: Those are amazing, inconceivable.

original: tshig de dag grol bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: tshig de dag grol bar gsungs pa /
translated: Those words are said to be liberating.

original: gnas med pa ru shes nas su //
analyzed: gnas med pa ru shes nas su //
translated: Having understood that there is no basis,

original: gnas dang bcas pa'i chos rnams 'chad //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas pa'i chos rnams 'chad //
translated: one teaches the phenomena that have a basis.

original: ces pa ste gnas med par ni shes nas zhes pa ni shes rab kyis chos thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i gnas med de stong pa nyid du shes zhes pa'o //🔽gnas dang bcas pa'i chos rnams 'chad //
analyzed: ces pa ste gnas med par ni shes nas zhes pa ni shes rab kyis chos thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i gnas med de stong pa nyid du shes zhes pa'o // gnas dang bcas pa'i chos rnams 'chad //
translated: Having understood that there is no basis means that through wisdom one understands that all phenomena are empty, without the basis of an apprehended object and an apprehending subject.

original: ces pa ni de ltar shes rab kyis chos thams cad dngos po med par chud kyang thabs kyis sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i gnas la sogs pa'i chos rnams dngos po yod par snang ba dngos su ston zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni de ltar shes rab kyis chos thams cad dngos po med par chud kyang thabs kyis sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i gnas la sogs pa'i chos rnams dngos po yod par snang ba dngos su ston zhes pa'o //
translated: One teaches the phenomena that have a basis means that although one understands all phenomena to be unreal through wisdom, through method one directly teaches the phenomena that have a basis, such as apprehended objects and apprehending subjects, and so on, as if they were real things, in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: mi shes pa ni gang shes pa //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni gang shes pa //
translated: The ignorant one is the one who knows.

original: chos rnams chos kyi mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: chos rnams chos kyi mtshan nyid de //
translated: The characteristics of phenomena are phenomena.

original: zhes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid gang gis mi dmigs par shes zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid gang gis mi dmigs par shes zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that by what characteristic of phenomena such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are they known to be non-apprehensible?

original: des ni rnyed pa 'thob 'gyur ba //
analyzed: des ni rnyed pa 'thob 'gyur ba //
translated: By that, one attains the attainment.

original: mgon po kun gyis gang rnyed pa //
analyzed: mgon po kun gyis gang rnyed pa //
translated: What is attained by all the protectors

original: zhes pa'o // de ltar chos rnams dmigs su med par gang gis chud pa de mgon po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'thob pa sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ltar chos rnams dmigs su med par gang gis chud pa de mgon po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'thob pa sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that one who understands that phenomena are non-apprehensible attains the attainment, the fruition of Buddhahood, which is attained by the protector, the Blessed Buddha.

original: mdor na chos rnams stong pa nyid du chud pa de sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na chos rnams stong pa nyid du chud pa de sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In brief, it teaches that one who understands phenomena as emptiness becomes a Buddha.

original: gleng ba'i tshig de skad ces smras nas /
analyzed: gleng ba'i tshig de skad ces smras nas /
translated: Having spoken those words of introduction,

original: sku de dag slar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa la bzhugs so zhes pa ni de dag chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te mi snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sku de dag slar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa la bzhugs so zhes pa ni de dag chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te mi snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those bodies again enter into the inconceivable Dharma Body of the Tathagata. This means that they become the nature of the emptiness of the Dharma Sphere and disappear.

original: de ltar gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i thabs bcom ldan 'das kyis @218b sngar bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i thabs bcom ldan 'das kyis @218b sngar bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the method of drawing the secret mandala has been taught by the Bhagavat.

original: da ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid bri ba'i thabs bshad de /
analyzed: da ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid bri ba'i thabs bshad de /
translated: Now, the method of drawing the secret mandala itself is explained.

original: de yang de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de yang de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Thereupon, the Bhagavat said to the Bodhisattva Vajrapani:

original: rigs kyi bu nang gi dkyil 'khor de nyon cig ces pa la sogs te 'dir yang slob ma lhag par gnas pa de nyid kyi nub mo bya ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu nang gi dkyil 'khor de nyon cig ces pa la sogs te 'dir yang slob ma lhag par gnas pa de nyid kyi nub mo bya ba shes par bya'o //
translated: Son of good family, listen to the inner mandala. And so forth. Here, one should understand that the consecration of the disciples is done on the very same evening.

original: de'i rim pa yang de la thog mar slob dpon gyis mchod pa'i yo byad 'di dag la sogs pa nyid gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin du sta gon byas nas slob ma rnams kyang bsogs te /
analyzed: de'i rim pa yang de la thog mar slob dpon gyis mchod pa'i yo byad 'di dag la sogs pa nyid gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin du sta gon byas nas slob ma rnams kyang bsogs te /
translated: The stages of that are as follows: First, the master should set up the offerings, articles, and so on, as they occur in the treatise, and then gather the disciples.

original: phyi rol du bkod la de nas slob dpon de dkyil 'khor gyi gnas su zhugs te /
analyzed: phyi rol du bkod la de nas slob dpon de dkyil 'khor gyi gnas su zhugs te /
translated: Having arranged them outside, the master should enter the maṇḍala site.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Having made prostrations to all buddhas and bodhisattvas, the master should bind the samaya mudra

original: mdun du rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor snying rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor du bstan pa rang bzhin du so so'i sngags 'bru re'am spyi'i snying po der bsams te /
analyzed: mdun du rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor snying rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor du bstan pa rang bzhin du so so'i sngags 'bru re'am spyi'i snying po der bsams te /
translated: and visualize the intrinsic maṇḍala in front, the maṇḍala of great compassion, with the individual seed syllables of the intrinsic maṇḍala or the general essence.

original: de nas bdag nyid chos dbyings kyi phyag rgya dang sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sngags dang phyag rgyas rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab pa dang / rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgya dang sngags kyis bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid chos dbyings kyi phyag rgya dang sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sngags dang phyag rgyas rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab pa dang / rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgya dang sngags kyis bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: Then, one should protect oneself with the seal and mantra of the vajra armor.

original: de nas las kyi rdo rjer bsgyur te de rnams la dam tshig gi phyag rgya bstan to //
analyzed: de nas las kyi rdo rjer bsgyur te de rnams la dam tshig gi phyag rgya bstan to //
translated: Then, having transformed oneself into the karma vajra, one should display the pledge seal to them.

original: yon chab dbul ba dang dri dang me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams so so'i sngags kyis btab ste dbul ba dang yid kyi mchod pa yang bya'o //
analyzed: yon chab dbul ba dang dri dang me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams so so'i sngags kyis btab ste dbul ba dang yid kyi mchod pa yang bya'o //
translated: One should offer the water for welcoming and so forth, and the offerings of fragrance, flowers, and so forth, empowered by their individual mantras, and one should also make mental offerings.

original: de ltar phyi nang gi mchod pa la sogs pa byas nas slob dpon de'i phyir byung la slob ma rnams la dri dang me tog byin te /
analyzed: de ltar phyi nang gi mchod pa la sogs pa byas nas slob dpon de'i phyir byung la slob ma rnams la dri dang me tog byin te /
translated: Having made the outer and inner offerings in that way, the master should come out and give fragrance and flowers to the disciples.

original: las thams cad pa'i sngags kyis bsrung bar bya ba dang las thams cad pa'i sngags kyis btab pa'i skud pa dpung par bcing ba dang so shing sbyin pa rnams byas te /
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i sngags kyis bsrung bar bya ba dang las thams cad pa'i sngags kyis btab pa'i skud pa dpung par bcing ba dang so shing sbyin pa rnams byas te /
translated: One should protect with the mantra of all activities, tie the thread empowered with the mantra of all activities around the upper arm, and give the tooth stick.🔽

original: de nas sdig pa bshags pa dang / lus dbul ba dang / sdom pa 'dzin du gzhug ste /
analyzed: de nas sdig pa bshags pa dang / lus dbul ba dang / sdom pa 'dzin du gzhug ste /
translated: Then, having made them recite the confession of sins, the offering of the body, and the taking of vows,

original: de dag ni lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de dag ni lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: this is the rite of the preparatory consecration.

original: dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'i cho ga yang grogs po bsgrub pa'i phyi ma yod na yang des rim bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'i cho ga yang grogs po bsgrub pa'i phyi ma yod na yang des rim bzhin du bya ste /
translated: The rite of inducting into the maṇḍala, if one has the later rite of accomplishing the friend, should be done in stages by that.

original: med na slob dpon gyis de nyid du slob ma dam tshig gi phyag rgya 'ching du gzhug pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgya dang sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag @219a * //
analyzed: med na slob dpon gyis de nyid du slob ma dam tshig gi phyag rgya 'ching du gzhug pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgya dang sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag @219a * //
translated: If one does not have that, the master should have the disciple form the pledge seal and recite the mantra of the pledge seal, and then consecrate with the mantra and seal of the dhāraṇī-wheel.

original: rgya dang sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rim bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: rgya dang sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rim bzhin du bya ste /
translated: Then, having consecrated with the mantra and seal of the Dharma wheel, one should generate the mind of enlightenment, and so forth, in stages.

original: de nas slob dpon des slar mchod pa'i gnas su zhugs te /🔽sems mnyam par gzhag la snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon des slar mchod pa'i gnas su zhugs te / sems mnyam par gzhag la snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du /
translated: Then, the master again enters the place of worship.

original: yi ge ra kha dog dkar po yid tsam dmar ba bsams te /
analyzed: yi ge ra kha dog dkar po yid tsam dmar ba bsams te /
translated: Having settled the mind in equipoise, he visualizes at his heart a white syllable ra, slightly red, upon a moon mandala.

original: yi ge de'i sgra'i kha de kho na nyid chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: yi ge de'i sgra'i kha de kho na nyid chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba bsgom pa ni /
translated: He meditates on the reality of the sound of that syllable, the freedom from dust of all phenomena.

original: bdag gi lus nyid rdul la sogs pa'i tshul du bshigs te /
analyzed: bdag gi lus nyid rdul la sogs pa'i tshul du bshigs te /
translated: He dismantles his own body into the manner of dust and so on.

original: rdul phran de yang phyogs dang cha phral na dmigs su med /
analyzed: rdul phran de yang phyogs dang cha phral na dmigs su med /
translated: Even that atom, when separated into directions and parts, is not observed.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dngos po med par bsgoms te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dngos po med par bsgoms te /
translated: Likewise, he meditates on consciousness and so on as being unreal.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang yi ge ra yang stong par bsams te tha mar sgra'i de kho na nyid de yang dmigs su med par bsgoms te stong pa nyid du ji srid 'dod par gnas te /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang yi ge ra yang stong par bsams te tha mar sgra'i de kho na nyid de yang dmigs su med par bsgoms te stong pa nyid du ji srid 'dod par gnas te /
translated: He also thinks that the moon mandala and the syllable ra are empty. Finally, he meditates on the reality of the sound as being unobservable and abides in emptiness for as long as he wishes.

original: de'i 'og tu thog mar rlung gi dkyil 'khor de nas chu'i dkyil 'khor de nas gser gyi dkyil 'khor bsams te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thog mar rlung gi dkyil 'khor de nas chu'i dkyil 'khor de nas gser gyi dkyil 'khor bsams te /
translated: Then, after that, first imagine the wind mandala, then the water mandala, and then the golden mandala.

original: gser gyi dkyil 'khor de'i steng du bdag gi lus lte ba man chad kyang gser gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi par bsams te /
analyzed: gser gyi dkyil 'khor de'i steng du bdag gi lus lte ba man chad kyang gser gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi par bsams te /
translated: On top of that golden mandala, imagine your body, from the navel down, as a square golden mandala.

original: de'i steng du padmo rtsa ba dang bcas pa snying ga'i bar du phyin par bsams te /
analyzed: de'i steng du padmo rtsa ba dang bcas pa snying ga'i bar du phyin par bsams te /
translated: On top of that, imagine a lotus with a stem, reaching up to the heart.

original: de'i dbus na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs te ;🔽de'i shar phyogs kyi padmo'i 'dab ma la rin po che dpal de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: de'i dbus na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs te ; de'i shar phyogs kyi padmo'i 'dab ma la rin po che dpal de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: In the center of that, imagine Bhagavat Vairocana.🔽On the eastern petal of the lotus, imagine the tathagata Ratna Shri.

original: lho phyogs kyi 'dab ma la kun du rgyas pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa /🔽nub phyogs kyi 'dab ma la snang ba mtha' yas de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi 'dab ma la kun du rgyas pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa / nub phyogs kyi 'dab ma la snang ba mtha' yas de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: On the southern petal, imagine the tathagata Samantaprabha.🔽On the western petal, imagine the tathagata Amitabha.

original: byang phyogs kyi 'dab ma la rnga dbyangs de bzhin gshegs pa bsam mo //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi 'dab ma la rnga dbyangs de bzhin gshegs pa bsam mo //
translated: On the northern petal, imagine the tathagata Dundubhisvara.

original: shar lho'i 'dab ma la kun du bzang po byang chub sems dpa'/
analyzed: shar lho'i 'dab ma la kun du bzang po byang chub sems dpa'/
translated: On the petal in the southeast is the bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: byang shar gyi 'dab ma la spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po /
analyzed: byang shar gyi 'dab ma la spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po /
translated: On the petal in the northeast is Avalokiteśvara.

original: lho nub kyi 'dab ma la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa /
analyzed: lho nub kyi 'dab ma la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa /
translated: On the petal in the southwest is Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: nub byang gi 'dab ma la byams pa byang chub sems dpa' bsams te /
analyzed: nub byang gi 'dab ma la byams pa byang chub sems dpa' bsams te /
translated: On the petal in the northwest is the bodhisattva Maitreya.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang me tog dor ba la bde ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang me tog dor ba la bde ba'i phyir /
translated: Those bodhisattvas, such as Bhagavān Vairocana, are also imagined in order to be happy when the flowers are cast.

original: de rnams kun gyi sku bdag gi //
analyzed: de rnams kun gyi sku bdag gi //
translated: All of their bodies

original: klad pa'i bar du phyin par bsam //
analyzed: klad pa'i bar du phyin par bsam //
translated: are imagined to reach up to one’s head.

original: padmo'i ge sar kun la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yum rnams dang / sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa drug @219b dang ting nge 'dzin rnams lha mo'i gzugs su bsam mo //
analyzed: padmo'i ge sar kun la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yum rnams dang / sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa drug @219b dang ting nge 'dzin rnams lha mo'i gzugs su bsam mo //
translated: On the anthers of the lotuses are the mothers of the bodhisattvas, the ten grounds, the six perfections, and the meditative concentrations imagined in the form of goddesses.

original: padmo'i rtsa ba la phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' bsam mo //
analyzed: padmo'i rtsa ba la phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' bsam mo //
translated: On the roots of the lotuses is the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi.

original: de'i drung g-yas g-yon du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po 'khor rnams dang / phyag na rdo rje'i rig pa khro bo rnams dang / skyong ba dang khro gnyer la sogs pa rim bzhin du bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i drung g-yas g-yon du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po 'khor rnams dang / phyag na rdo rje'i rig pa khro bo rnams dang / skyong ba dang khro gnyer la sogs pa rim bzhin du bsam mo //
translated: To the right and left of him, one should imagine Avalokiteśvara with his retinue, and Vajrapāṇi with his retinue of wrathful knowledge beings, as well as the guardians, the wrathful ones, and so forth, in their respective places.

original: de'i phyi rim du lha dang klu la sogs pa mang po bsams te /
analyzed: de'i phyi rim du lha dang klu la sogs pa mang po bsams te /
translated: Surrounding them, one should imagine many gods, nāgas, and so forth.

original: de ltar brtan par byas nas yid kyis mchod pa tshul bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtan par byas nas yid kyis mchod pa tshul bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Having thus stabilized [the visualization], one should properly make mental offerings.

original: de nas de dag kun zin pa dang se gol brdab par bya ste /🔽slob ma rnams mgon po la me tog 'dor du gzhug go //
analyzed: de nas de dag kun zin pa dang se gol brdab par bya ste / slob ma rnams mgon po la me tog 'dor du gzhug go //
translated: Then, when all of that is finished, one should snap one's fingers.🔽One should cause the disciples to offer flowers to the Lord.

original: me tog de dag kyang yid la bsams pa'i lha gang gi steng du bab pa de slob ma de la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog de dag kyang yid la bsams pa'i lha gang gi steng du bab pa de slob ma de la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Those flowers should be given to the disciple on top of whichever deity they mentally focused on.

original: de dag ni bsdu ba'i don du tshig gi don la gsang ba'i bdag po de ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir lus kyis gang ba de chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sngags dang phyag rgya'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis rlobs shig ces
analyzed: de dag ni bsdu ba'i don du tshig gi don la gsang ba'i bdag po de ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir lus kyis gang ba de chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sngags dang phyag rgya'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis rlobs shig ces
translated: O Lord of Secrets, since that is pure by nature, bless it with the mantra and mudra of the essence of the dharmadhatu, which is filled with the body.

original: pa ni mchod pa la sogs pa sngar smos pa'i rim bzhin du byas nas /
analyzed: pa ni mchod pa la sogs pa sngar smos pa'i rim bzhin du byas nas /
translated: Having performed the previously mentioned offerings and so forth,

original: bdag gi lus la chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgya dang sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa stong pa nyid du byos shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus la chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgya dang sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa stong pa nyid du byos shig ces pa'o //
translated: bless my body with the mudra and mantra of the dharmadhatu, making it emptiness.

original: de nas bdag las kyi lha rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlabs la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bdag las kyi lha rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlabs la zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, having blessed oneself as the deity of action, Vajrasattva,

original: snga ma'i rim bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab pa dag byas nas las kyi rdo rje sems dpar bsgyur te /
analyzed: snga ma'i rim bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab pa dag byas nas las kyi rdo rje sems dpar bsgyur te /
translated: having performed the previously mentioned offerings and so forth, having blessed with the mudra of the dharma chakra, transform into the deity of action, Vajrasattva.

original: mchod pa dang slob ma'i cho ga bya ba la sogs pa thams cad gong du smos pa'i rim bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang slob ma'i cho ga bya ba la sogs pa thams cad gong du smos pa'i rim bzhin du bya'o //
translated: All the offerings, the rites for the disciples, and so forth, should be done in the sequence explained above.

original: rdul dang zhes pa ni de nas slar bdag nang du zhugs nas yi ger snying gar bsams te /
analyzed: rdul dang zhes pa ni de nas slar bdag nang du zhugs nas yi ger snying gar bsams te /
translated: As for free of dust, then after one has again entered inside, one should contemplate the syllable at the heart,

original: chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba'i bar bsgom pa'i rim pa snga ma bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba'i bar bsgom pa'i rim pa snga ma bzhin du bya'o //
translated: and meditate on the process of freedom from dust of all phenomena, as before.

original: bdag dang sems can dang srog dang 'gro ba dang shed las skyes dang shed can dang / byed pa po la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang / zug rdur bral zhes pa ni mu stegs gzhan rnams kyi bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po de rnams kyang dmigs su med par sgom zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dang srog dang 'gro ba dang shed las skyes dang shed can dang / byed pa po la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang / zug rdur bral zhes pa ni mu stegs gzhan rnams kyi bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po de rnams kyang dmigs su med par sgom zhes pa ste /
translated: As for free of the faults of self, sentient beings, life, living being, human, and agent, and so forth, one should meditate on the non-apprehension of those things such as self and so forth of other tīrthikas.

original: de dag ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyis sbyang ba rdo shing la sogs pa'i zug rdu dang nyes pa bsal ba bzhin du gang gis sbyang ba yang thabs ji ltar sbyang ngo zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyis sbyang ba rdo shing la sogs pa'i zug rdu dang nyes pa bsal ba bzhin du gang gis sbyang ba yang thabs ji ltar sbyang ngo zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: As for just as one removes the faults and the splinters of the outer maṇḍala, and so forth, it is explained that just as one removes the faults and splinters of the stone, wood, and so forth, by means of the outer maṇḍala, in the same way, one should purify by means of the method.

original: gru bzhi sgo bzhi las nub phyogs kyi sgo rtag @220a * //
analyzed: gru bzhi sgo bzhi las nub phyogs kyi sgo rtag @220a * //
translated: The four corners and four doors are as before, but the western door is always open, and the door frame and platform are well adorned.

original: par phye ba sgo khyud dang stegs bu rab tu brgyan pa zhes pa de ni de ltar stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin byas la /
analyzed: par phye ba sgo khyud dang stegs bu rab tu brgyan pa zhes pa de ni de ltar stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin byas la /
translated: Having thus cultivated the meditative stabilization of emptiness and so forth,

original: de nas rlung dang chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du bsams te /
analyzed: de nas rlung dang chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du bsams te /
translated: then one should imagine the wind and water mandalas and so forth as before.

original: de'i steng du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bdag gi rked pa man chad 'gyur bar bsams te /
analyzed: de'i steng du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bdag gi rked pa man chad 'gyur bar bsams te /
translated: Upon that, one should imagine that the upper part of the great maṇḍala of fire is transformed into a platform, and the lower part of oneself is transformed into a great maṇḍala of wind.

original: stegs bu zhes pa ni dbus kyi gzhi'i gdan de nyid la bya ste de yang gser gyi kha dog tu bsam mo //
analyzed: stegs bu zhes pa ni dbus kyi gzhi'i gdan de nyid la bya ste de yang gser gyi kha dog tu bsam mo //
translated: The platform is the seat in the center, and that should be imagined as the color of gold.🔽In the center, there is a great wish-fulfilling king of lotuses with a fully opened anther, well adorned, and mental.

original: dbus na yid bzhin gyi padmo'i rgyal po chen po dang / ge sar rgyas pa dang bcas shing shin tu rnam par brgyan pa yid kyis zhes pa ni yid las byung ba'i padmo zhes pa ste sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbus na yid bzhin gyi padmo'i rgyal po chen po dang / ge sar rgyas pa dang bcas shing shin tu rnam par brgyan pa yid kyis zhes pa ni yid las byung ba'i padmo zhes pa ste sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The mental lotus is explained above.

original: shin tu rnam par brgyan pa'i yid la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par brgyan pa'i yid la zhes pa ni /
translated: Well adorned mental means

original: 'dab ma brgyad la sangs rgyas bzhi dang byang chub sems dpa' bzhi rnams kyi kha dog ci 'dra ba dang mthun par kha dog sna tshogs su bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad la sangs rgyas bzhi dang byang chub sems dpa' bzhi rnams kyi kha dog ci 'dra ba dang mthun par kha dog sna tshogs su bya ba ste /
translated: On the eight petals, the four buddhas and the four bodhisattvas are of various colors, in accordance with their respective colors.

original: rin chen rgyal mtshan gyi kha dog dkar po /
analyzed: rin chen rgyal mtshan gyi kha dog dkar po /
translated: Ratnarāja is white.

original: kun du rgyas pa'i rgyal po'i kha dog ser po /
analyzed: kun du rgyas pa'i rgyal po'i kha dog ser po /
translated: Samanta­prabhāsa-rāja is yellow.

original: rnga dbyangs kyi kha dog smug nag / snang ba mtha' yas kyi kha dog dmar po /
analyzed: rnga dbyangs kyi kha dog smug nag / snang ba mtha' yas kyi kha dog dmar po /
translated: Duन्दुभisvara is dark brown. Amitābha is red.

original: de bzhin du kun du bzang po ni ser po /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun du bzang po ni ser po /
translated: Similarly, Samantabhadra is yellow.

original: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po ni dkar po /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po ni dkar po /
translated: Avalokiteśvara is white.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni ser po /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni ser po /
translated: Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta is yellow.

original: byams pa ni dmar po bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa ni dmar po bya'o //
translated: Maitreya is red.

original: yang na thams cad kyang kha dog thams cad do zhes pa dang sbyar te chad pa med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na thams cad kyang kha dog thams cad do zhes pa dang sbyar te chad pa med par shes par bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, all of them are of all colors.

original: de'i dbus su yang lus dang ngag yid 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dbus su yang lus dang ngag yid 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes pa ni /
translated: In the center of that, the body, speech, and mind of the transcendent conquerors who transcend all worlds,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku padmo'i dbus su bsam pa ste mchog tu bzang ba 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku padmo'i dbus su bsam pa ste mchog tu bzang ba 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat Vairocana is imagined in the center of the lotus, “supremely good,” transcending all worlds.

original: sems kyi sa las 'das zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha sems kyi yul spangs pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi sa las 'das zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha sems kyi yul spangs pa zhes pa'o //
translated: “ Transcending the stage of mind” means abandoning the object of mind, the aspect of subject and object.

original: sems kyis shin tu thob ces pa ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de so sor rang gis rig pa thob pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyis shin tu thob ces pa ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de so sor rang gis rig pa thob pa zhes pa ste /
translated: “ Attained by mind” means the attainment of the realization of the nature of emptiness.

original: des ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the perfection of one’s own aim.

original: 'bras bu dam pa yid du 'ong ba sbyin pa zhes pa ni pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa ste sems can rnams la mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu rnams sbyin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dam pa yid du 'ong ba sbyin pa zhes pa ni pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa ste sems can rnams la mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu rnams sbyin zhes pa'o //
translated: “ Bestowing the delightful supreme fruit” teaches the perfection of others’ aims, bestowing on sentient beings the fruits of high status and the ultimate goodness of nirvana.

original: de'i shar du zhes pa ni de'i drung du rig pa dang / khro bo rnams zhes pa'i bar du @220b sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams padmo'i 'dab ma dang ge sar dag la bsam pa sngar smos pa'i rim bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de'i shar du zhes pa ni de'i drung du rig pa dang / khro bo rnams zhes pa'i bar du @220b sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams padmo'i 'dab ma dang ge sar dag la bsam pa sngar smos pa'i rim bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The east of that is in front of it, up to the knowledge beings and wrathful ones, and one should imagine the buddhas and bodhisattvas on the petals and pistils of the lotuses, in the order previously mentioned.

original: gzhan ni mtsho chen por zhes pa'i bar du dkyil 'khor de'i 'og tu chu'i dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho bsam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni mtsho chen por zhes pa'i bar du dkyil 'khor de'i 'og tu chu'i dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho bsam zhes pa'o //
translated: The rest is up to the great lake, and one should imagine the water mandala of the ocean below that mandala.

original: mar me dang / dri dang / me tog dang ; bshos dang bdug pa yid du 'ong ba rnams sngags pas kun bsam zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mar me dang / dri dang / me tog dang ; bshos dang bdug pa yid du 'ong ba rnams sngags pas kun bsam zhes pa ni /
translated: The lamps, scents, flowers, food, and incense are all imagined by the mantrin.

original: yid kyis dri dang me tog la sogs pa de dag thams cad sngags pas bsam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis dri dang me tog la sogs pa de dag thams cad sngags pas bsam zhes pa'o //
translated: The mantrin is the mind, and one should imagine all those scents, flowers, and so on.

original: sems can kun gyi dam tshig phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi dam tshig phyir //
translated: For the sake of the commitments of all sentient beings,

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor de sems can rnams dam tshig la zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor de sems can rnams dam tshig la zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: one should imagine that mandala for the sake of sentient beings' entering into the commitments.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor rnams rdzogs pa rgyas par bri mi nus shing zab cing rgya che ba la mos pas dkyil 'khor 'di bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor rnams rdzogs pa rgyas par bri mi nus shing zab cing rgya che ba la mos pas dkyil 'khor 'di bya zhes pa'o //
translated: If one is unable to draw the complete extensive mandala of the images, and is devoted to the profound and vast, one should make this mandala.

original: drung gi sa gzhi kun du ni //
analyzed: drung gi sa gzhi kun du ni //
translated: On the ground in front,

original: lha rnams grangs med pa yang ni //
analyzed: lha rnams grangs med pa yang ni //
translated: one should draw countless gods

original: sngags mkhan gyis ni nan tan bri //
analyzed: sngags mkhan gyis ni nan tan bri //
translated: with effort, the mantrin.

original: dkyil 'khor mthu chen 'di ru ste //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mthu chen 'di ru ste //
translated: In this great mandala,

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das mthu chen po dkyil 'khor 'di'i dbus kyi stegs bu'i 'og phyi rim gyi sa gzhi thams cad du lha dang klu la sogs pa grangs med pa bri zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das mthu chen po dkyil 'khor 'di'i dbus kyi stegs bu'i 'og phyi rim gyi sa gzhi thams cad du lha dang klu la sogs pa grangs med pa bri zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that in the outer ground all around under the platform in the center of this great Bhagavat mandala, one should draw countless gods, nagas, and so forth.

original: rang lus rang gis bya ba ni //
analyzed: rang lus rang gis bya ba ni //
translated: One should do it oneself,

original: ras kyi rnam pa sbyangs nas su //
analyzed: ras kyi rnam pa sbyangs nas su //
translated: having cleaned the cloth form,

original: sngags pa sbyar stan der 'dug nas ;
analyzed: sngags pa sbyar stan der 'dug nas ;
translated: the mantrin sitting on that prepared seat,

original: / de bzhin gshegs rnams rjes mos pas //
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs rnams rjes mos pas //
translated: with devotion to the Tathagatas.

original: zhes pa ni sbyor ba de rnams bya ba yang bdag nyid yi ge ram snying po nyid du sbyang ba la sogs pa gong du smos pa'i tshul bzhin du byas nas gdod las ni 'di rnams bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sbyor ba de rnams bya ba yang bdag nyid yi ge ram snying po nyid du sbyang ba la sogs pa gong du smos pa'i tshul bzhin du byas nas gdod las ni 'di rnams bya zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that when one performs those rites, one should do so in accordance with the previously mentioned method of purifying oneself into the essence of the syllable raṃ, and so forth, and then perform the rites.

original: slob ma rnams kyi spyi bo ru //
analyzed: slob ma rnams kyi spyi bo ru //
translated: On the head of the disciples🔽the syllable a is placed together with its retinue.

original: aa ni 'khor dang bcas te gzhag / ces pa ni slob ma dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas nas de dag brtan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: aa ni 'khor dang bcas te gzhag / ces pa ni slob ma dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas nas de dag brtan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This means that when the disciples enter the maṇḍala, one should bless them into the realm of reality, and so forth, and then in order to stabilize them,

original: kun du sangs rgyas pa'i snying po aom spyi bor bsam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kun du sangs rgyas pa'i snying po aom spyi bor bsam zhes pa'o //
translated: one should imagine the essence of universal awakening, the syllable oṃ, on their heads.🔽Then one should cause them to cast the flower.

original: de nas me tog 'dor du gzhug / ces pa nas /
analyzed: de nas me tog 'dor du gzhug / ces pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: rig pa yang ni de la byin //
analyzed: rig pa yang ni de la byin //
translated: The awareness is also given to them.

original: zhes pa'i bar du slob ma rnams bdag gi lus la me tog bor nas gang la bab pa'i rig pa de sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du slob ma rnams bdag gi lus la me tog bor nas gang la bab pa'i rig pa de sbyin pa'o //
translated: This means that the disciples cast the flower on one’s own body, and the awareness on which it falls is given to them.

original: de la bsgom par zhes pa'i dkyil 'khor bar zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi tshul rnams slob ma la bstan pa'o //🔽'di ni dkyil 'khor dam pa ste //
analyzed: de la bsgom par zhes pa'i dkyil 'khor bar zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi tshul rnams slob ma la bstan pa'o // 'di ni dkyil 'khor dam pa ste //
translated: The mandala in meditate on that is the mandala ritual, which is the teaching of the mandala to the disciples.🔽This is the holy mandala,

original: zhes pa ni @221a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni @221a * //
translated: is the teaching of the mandala ritual.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa las byung ba'i pha rol gyi mtshan ma rnams la mi rtog pas dam pa zhes pa'o //🔽lus can rnams kyi dam tshig phyi ru gsungs //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa las byung ba'i pha rol gyi mtshan ma rnams la mi rtog pas dam pa zhes pa'o // lus can rnams kyi dam tshig phyi ru gsungs //
translated: The holy is because of the non-conceptuality of the signs of the other side that arise from the meditation on the samadhi of emptiness.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'di dam tshig can du bya ba'i phyir ro zhes pa sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'di dam tshig can du bya ba'i phyir ro zhes pa sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The holy pledge of embodied beings is taught externally is as explained above, that is, in order to make this mandala a holy pledge.

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i thabs zhes pa ni mgon na gong ma'i nang du bshad zin to /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i thabs zhes pa ni mgon na gong ma'i nang du bshad zin to /
translated: The method of entering the secret mandala is as explained above in the chapter on the protector.

original: // / da ni rig pa'i dka' thub kyi le'u 'chad de /
analyzed: // / da ni rig pa'i dka' thub kyi le'u 'chad de /
translated: Now, the chapter on the austerity of knowledge is explained.

original: rig pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid don ji lta ba bzhin ba nyid rig pas na de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes dang / de las byung ba'i sngags dang phyag rgya la yang bya ste /
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid don ji lta ba bzhin ba nyid rig pas na de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes dang / de las byung ba'i sngags dang phyag rgya la yang bya ste /
translated: The knowledge in knowledge means that it is knowledge of the way things really are, just as it is, and so it is the exalted wisdom of thatness.🔽 It is also called mantra and seal because they arise from that.

original: de'i dka' thub ni de dang rjes su mthun par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dka' thub ni de dang rjes su mthun par spyod pa ste /
translated: The austerity in austerity means the conduct that is consistent with that.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i spyod pa skra dang kha spu bregs pa dang chos gos bgo ba la sogs pa dge slong gi gzugs su spyod pa dang / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi yang lha chen po la dad pa la sogs pa nyid kyi spyod pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i spyod pa skra dang kha spu bregs pa dang chos gos bgo ba la sogs pa dge slong gi gzugs su spyod pa dang / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi yang lha chen po la dad pa la sogs pa nyid kyi spyod pa dang /
translated: For example, the conduct that is consistent with the Bhagavat Shakyamuni is to shave one's head and beard, wear the robes of a monk and so forth, and to conduct oneself in the form of a monk.

original: tshul 'jig rten du rig pa'i brtul zhugs 'di yang bdag nyid kyi lha'i gzugs ci 'dra ba dang / rjes su mthun par spyod pa dang ting nge 'dzin stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun par spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las langs nas kyang chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: tshul 'jig rten du rig pa'i brtul zhugs 'di yang bdag nyid kyi lha'i gzugs ci 'dra ba dang / rjes su mthun par spyod pa dang ting nge 'dzin stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun par spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las langs nas kyang chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin rtogs pa dang /
translated: The way of the conduct of pure awareness in the world is to engage in conduct that accords with the form of one’s deity, to engage in conduct that accords with the nature of emptiness, the meditative absorption, and to realize that all phenomena are by nature like illusions when rising from meditative absorption.🔽To engage in conduct that accords with that is to train in the mantra.

original: rjes su spyod par mthun par spyod pa dang / de'i sngags slob par byed pa rnams te yan lag de bzhi dang ldan pa ni rig pa'i brtul zhugs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su spyod par mthun par spyod pa dang / de'i sngags slob par byed pa rnams te yan lag de bzhi dang ldan pa ni rig pa'i brtul zhugs zhes pa'o //
translated: To possess those four branches is called “the conduct of pure awareness.”

original: de la kha cig ni brtul zhugs 'di spyod cing sngon du bsnyen pa'i grangs sum 'bum la sogs pa ji skad du gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin du byas nas sgrub pa la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de la kha cig ni brtul zhugs 'di spyod cing sngon du bsnyen pa'i grangs sum 'bum la sogs pa ji skad du gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin du byas nas sgrub pa la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Some maintain that one should engage in this conduct and perform the approach recitation, such as three hundred thousand times, as taught in the scriptures, and then enter into the practice.

original: de ste de bas kyang lhag par bstan par 'dod pas /
analyzed: de ste de bas kyang lhag par bstan par 'dod pas /
translated: If one wishes to do more than that,

original: dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas shing /
analyzed: dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas shing /
translated: They abide in the maṇḍala of the great empowerment, and so on.🔽

original: zla ba drug tu rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zla ba drug tu rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyod par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that one engages in the conduct of pure awareness for six months while abiding in the maṇḍala of the great empowerment and so forth.

original: de bas na brtul zhugs 'di ni dbang chen la sogs pa la gnas /
analyzed: de bas na brtul zhugs 'di ni dbang chen la sogs pa la gnas /
translated: Therefore, this conduct is regarded as the cause for the conduct of the great empowerment and so forth.

original: brtul zhugs kyi rgyu lta bur bltas te rig pa'i brtul zhugs 'di las byung ba'i dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i brtul zhugs ni brtul zhugs gong ma 'di las byung bar blta ste /
analyzed: brtul zhugs kyi rgyu lta bur bltas te rig pa'i brtul zhugs 'di las byung ba'i dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i brtul zhugs ni brtul zhugs gong ma 'di las byung bar blta ste /
translated: The conduct of abiding in the maṇḍala of the great empowerment and so forth that arises from this conduct of pure awareness is regarded as arising from this higher conduct.

original: de bas na brtul zhugs 'dis sngar sems @221b yongs su sbyangs nas phyis brtul zhugs 'og ma la 'jug ste brtul zhugs 'og ma spyod pa dang / lha'i gzugs su bskyed pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las langs nas spyod pa'i tshe yang chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur rtogs shing chags par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: de bas na brtul zhugs 'dis sngar sems @221b yongs su sbyangs nas phyis brtul zhugs 'og ma la 'jug ste brtul zhugs 'og ma spyod pa dang / lha'i gzugs su bskyed pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las langs nas spyod pa'i tshe yang chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur rtogs shing chags par spyod pa dang /
translated: Therefore, having previously refined the mind through this conduct, one later engages in the lower conduct and practices the lower conduct, generating the deity’s form, abiding in the samādhi of emptiness, and when one arises from samādhi and engages in conduct, one realizes that phenomena are like an illusion and engages in conduct with attachment.

original: sngags slob par byed pa'i rim bzhin du spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags slob par byed pa'i rim bzhin du spyad par bya ste /
translated: One should practice in accordance with the stages of learning mantra.

original: lhag pa ni dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas shing de'i rang bzhin la bya ba dang / dbang chen la sogs pa so so'i phyag rgya 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: lhag pa ni dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas shing de'i rang bzhin la bya ba dang / dbang chen la sogs pa so so'i phyag rgya 'ching ba'o //
translated: The remainder is the conduct in the maṇḍala of the great empowerment, and so on, abiding in that nature, and binding the individual mudras of the great empowerment, and so on.

original: rig pa'i brtul zhugs de dris pa yang /
analyzed: rig pa'i brtul zhugs de dris pa yang /
translated: The conduct of vidyā is asked.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la phyag na rdo rjes tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyi don gyi phyir rig pa'i dka' thub kun dris pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /🔽phyag na rdo rje rig pa'i dka' thub dris pa yang dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas shing /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la phyag na rdo rjes tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyi don gyi phyir rig pa'i dka' thub kun dris pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste / phyag na rdo rje rig pa'i dka' thub dris pa yang dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas shing /
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi asked Bhagavān Vairocana with a song in verse, “In order to benefit the bodhisattvas who practice bodhisattva conduct through the door of mantra, ask about the austerity of vidyā.”

original: rig pa'i dka' thub spyod pa de gtsor dris par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i dka' thub spyod pa de gtsor dris par shes par bya'o //
translated: The question about the austerity of vidyā by Vajrapāṇi is to be understood as the principal question about the conduct of the austerity of vidyā, abiding in the maṇḍala of the great empowerment, and so on.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis dris pa ni don dka' zhing zhes pas don gyi tshig dang 'bru rnams mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis dris pa ni don dka' zhing zhes pas don gyi tshig dang 'bru rnams mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The question in verse is for the sake of not corrupting the meaning and the words and syllables, as it is said that the meaning is difficult.

original: sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod pa rnams kyi spyir zhes pa ni phyag na rdo rje nyid dmigs mi mkhyen te /
analyzed: sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod pa rnams kyi spyir zhes pa ni phyag na rdo rje nyid dmigs mi mkhyen te /
translated: The phrase in general for those who practice the conduct of a bodhisattva through the gateway of mantra is because Vajrapāṇi himself does not know the object.

original: 'dri ba ma yin gyi ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dri ba ma yin gyi ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not a question, but for the sake of benefiting future beings who practice the conduct of a bodhisattva through the gateway of mantra.

original: 'di ltar dka' thub spyad pa lags //🔽zhes pa nas rgyal po gtso nyid dbang du zhes pa'i bar du phyag na rdo rjes dris pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dka' thub spyad pa lags // zhes pa nas rgyal po gtso nyid dbang du zhes pa'i bar du phyag na rdo rjes dris pa'i tshig ste /

original: de la sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis gsungs zhes pa las 'di ltar sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis zin na da dri ci dgos she na /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis gsungs zhes pa las 'di ltar sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis zin na da dri ci dgos she na /
translated: This is the question asked by Vajrapāṇi. There, it is said, spoken by the buddhas of the past, but if it is thus grasped by the buddhas of the past, why is it necessary to ask now?

original: bdag nyid sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis bshad pas de'i don 'tshal mod kyis /
analyzed: bdag nyid sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis bshad pas de'i don 'tshal mod kyis /

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du bshad na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du bshad na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du bstan na /

analyzed: rgyal ba gtso nyid dbang du bya // zhes pa'o // dris pa'i tshig gzhan rnams ni @222a * //

analyzed: 'og nas lan ldon pa dang sbyar ro // rig pa'i dka' thub las byung ba'i //
translated: The other questions will be applied to the answers below.🔽The ascetic who arises from the austerity of knowledge

analyzed: dka' thub gnas pa sangs rgyas bzhin //

analyzed: zhes pa ni /

analyzed: rig pa'i dka' thub las byung ba //

translated: This is the explanation of the conduct of the one who has arisen from the knowledge of the four branches endowed with the sign of union with the mind, who abides in the maṇḍala of the great empowerment, and so on.

translated: The ascetic is like the Buddha.🔽Just as the Bhagavān Buddha, when he was completely enlightened, realized that all phenomena are of one characteristic, emptiness, even when he was in samādhi, and when he was in the relative, he knew that phenomena are like illusions, and he was not attached to anything, in the same way, the one who abides in the knowledge of the conduct realizes that all phenomena are the nature of emptiness

analyzed: kun rdzob tu spyod pa'i tshe yang chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur mkhyen pas ji ltar yang mi chags par spyod pa de bzhin du rig pa'i brtul zhugs la gnas pa de yang ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i tshe chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin

analyzed: kun du sangs rgyas pa dang 'dra //

analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ji ltar dka' thub spyad pa la gnas zhes zhus te bshad pa ste / yang dag nyid du bdag byas nas //

translated: “Always without doubt” means

analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar bdag gi de kho na nyid bdag ni lha gang yin pa'i gzugs su bsgyur ba ting nge 'dzin 'khrugs pa dang lha ji bzhin pa'i bar snang ba rnam par rtog pa gzhan med par lha'i gzugs nyid yid la the tshom med par snang
translated: This is to say, one’s suchness is transformed into the form of whatever deity one is, and one’s concentration is disturbed, and the deity appears just as it is, without any other conceptualization, and one’s mind is without doubt that it is the form of the deity.

original: na de / dka' thub spyad pa spyod pa yin //
analyzed: na de / dka' thub spyad pa spyod pa yin //

analyzed: zhes pa dang sbyar ro //

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /

original: nam zhig rtag tu sems thub na //
analyzed: nam zhig rtag tu sems thub na //

original: zhes pa ste mdor na rtag tu sems thub par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste mdor na rtag tu sems thub par bya ste /
translated: In brief, one should always be able to control one’s mind.

analyzed: lha'i gzugs de nyid la brtan pa snang bar ma byas na /
translated: If one does not stabilize one’s appearance in the form of the deity,

analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya sbyar ba tsam dang / gang lta ba de dag bdag go tsam du bsam pa tsam gyis rig pa'i brtul zhugs mi chud ces pa'o //
