analyzed: de ni rig pa dang mthun pa'i gzugs su spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the performance of the form that is in accord with awareness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang chos rnams @222b dang ; gzhan gyi tshul khrims can ma yin zhes pa'i bar du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang chos rnams @222b dang ; gzhan gyi tshul khrims can ma yin zhes pa'i bar du /
translated: The bodhisattvas, the dharmas, and up to not the morality of others,

original: ji ltar tshul khrims la yang gnas //
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims la yang gnas //
translated: how is it that they also abide in morality?

original: zhes zhus pa de bshad pa ste 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems chos sun 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / dge ba bcu'i rang bzhin la bslab pa dang /
analyzed: zhes zhus pa de bshad pa ste 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems chos sun 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / dge ba bcu'i rang bzhin la bslab pa dang /
translated: This is explained as follows: The engaged awakening mind has the characteristic of rejecting the Dharma, and it has conceptual thoughts about the aspects of the aggregates, elements, sense sources, and so forth, and it trains in the nature of the ten virtues.

analyzed: 'dus byas kyi las dang 'bras bu rnams stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gcig tu ldan par chud na /
translated: If one understands that conditioned actions and their results are endowed with the single characteristic of emptiness,

analyzed: tshul khrims de las dang bral ba zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de de bas na gsungs pa /

analyzed: tshul khrims sangs rgyas bzhin rig bya //

analyzed: zhes pa ste ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig tu chud pa bzhin du zhes pa ste /

analyzed: de ni rig pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin spyod pa de sngar bdag gis lha'i gzugs su bsgyur nas /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu rang gi sems yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba de so so nas mi zhig par yid la mi bya ba'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas par bya'o //
translated: in order to purify one's mind, one should abide in the concentration on emptiness, without mentally attending to the deity's form as something real.

original: zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa ste /

original: chos kun la yang dbang thob cing //
analyzed: chos kun la yang dbang thob cing //

analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nas bdag nyid rang gi lha'i gzugs su bsgyur te /
translated: Having dwelt in the maṇḍala of great power and so forth, one should transform oneself into the form of one’s deity.🔽Just as the nature of the earth is hard and solid, one should meditate on one’s body as being like that.

original: ji ltar sa'i rang bzhin sra zhing mkhrang ba ltar bdag gi lus kyang de lta bur sems la zhar la bsgom zhing zla ba gcig tu bzlas shing gnas par bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: ji ltar sa'i rang bzhin sra zhing mkhrang ba ltar bdag gi lus kyang de lta bur sems la zhar la bsgom zhing zla ba gcig tu bzlas shing gnas par bya ba bshad de /
translated: Having recited for one month, one should dwell in that.

original: dbang chen gyi ni lha lta bur //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi ni lha lta bur //
translated: Like the deity of great power,

original: dbang chen dkyil 'khor la 'dug nas //
analyzed: dbang chen dkyil 'khor la 'dug nas //
translated: dwelling in the maṇḍala of great power,

original: zhes pa ni dbang chen gyi snying po yi ge aa chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes par ston pa'i sgra'i de kho na nyid bsgoms nas yi ge de nyid las dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor du gyur pa snga ma bzhin du bsams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang chen gyi snying po yi ge aa chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes par ston pa'i sgra'i de kho na nyid bsgoms nas yi ge de nyid las dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor du gyur pa snga ma bzhin du bsams te /
translated: This means that having meditated on the reality of the sound which teaches that all phenomena are originally unborn, from that very syllable one should imagine the mandala of the great empowerment as before.

original: de'i steng du bdag rang gi lha'i gzugs su bsgyur nas rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings te dbang chen gyi rang bzhin lta bu sra zhing brtan par bsgom zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du bdag rang gi lha'i gzugs su bsgyur nas rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings te dbang chen gyi rang bzhin lta bu sra zhing brtan par bsgom zhes pa'o //
translated: Having transformed oneself into the form of one's deity, one should form the vajra gesture and meditate on the nature of the great empowerment as being firm and stable.

original: rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings nas su //
analyzed: rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings nas su //
translated: Forming the vajra gesture,

original: zhes pa ni sra zhing brtan pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcing ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sra zhing brtan pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcing ba'o //
translated: means forming the vajra gesture because it is in conformity with being firm and stable.

original: zas su rtag par 'o ma btung//
analyzed: zas su rtag par 'o ma btung//
translated: Always drinking milk as food,

original: zhes pa ni zas kyang rjes su mthun par zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni zas kyang rjes su mthun par zhes pa ste /
translated: means that the food is also in conformity with that.

original: 'o ma 'thungs nas lus brtas shing mkhrang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o ma 'thungs nas lus brtas shing mkhrang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one's body becomes strong and firm by drinking milk.

original: 'jig rten na yang sems dang kha zas gnyis kyis lus 'dzin par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang sems dang kha zas gnyis kyis lus 'dzin par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: In the world, the body is sustained by both mind and food.

original: 'dir yang sems mkhrang bar 'gyur ba'i kha zas zos na dbang chen gyi ting nge @223b 'dzin dang mthun par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang sems mkhrang bar 'gyur ba'i kha zas zos na dbang chen gyi ting nge @223b 'dzin dang mthun par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, here, if one eats food that makes the mind firm, it is in accord with the concentration of the great elements.

original: sngags mkhan gyis ni zla gcig bzlas //
analyzed: sngags mkhan gyis ni zla gcig bzlas //
translated: The mantra practitioner recites for one month.

original: srog dang rtsol bas nan tan du'o //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol bas nan tan du'o //
translated: With effort in the prāṇa and āyāma.

original: zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du srog dang rtsol ba bsdams nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du srog dang rtsol ba bsdams nas /
translated: As previously explained, having restrained the prāṇa and āyāma,

original: rang gi snying po zla gcig bzlas //
analyzed: rang gi snying po zla gcig bzlas //
translated: recite one’s essence for one month.

original: zhes pa'o // de nas zla ba gnyis pa'i tshe ;
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de nas zla ba gnyis pa'i tshe ;
translated: Then, in the second month,

original: / zhes pa nas /
analyzed: / zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: de'i tshe zas su chu btung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe zas su chu btung ngo //
translated: at that time, drink water as food.

original: zhes pa'i bar du chu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du chu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas par bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains abiding in the maṇḍala of water.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa bon gyi sgra'i de kho na nyid bsgom pa dang / sa bon de las chu'i dkyil 'khor du bsgoms pas rim pa bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa bon gyi sgra'i de kho na nyid bsgom pa dang / sa bon de las chu'i dkyil 'khor du bsgoms pas rim pa bzhin du bya ste /
translated: The reality of the seed syllable of the maṇḍala of water should be meditated upon, and since that seed syllable is meditated upon as the maṇḍala of water, it should be done in stages.

original: bdag gi lus kyang chu'i rang bzhin ltar sngo bar bsgom zhing padmo'i phyag rgya bcings la zla ba gcig tu bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyang chu'i rang bzhin ltar sngo bar bsgom zhing padmo'i phyag rgya bcings la zla ba gcig tu bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on one's body as blue like the nature of water, make the lotus gesture, and recite for one month.

original: padmo'i phyag rgya bcings pa dang zas su chu btung ba yang de dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: padmo'i phyag rgya bcings pa dang zas su chu btung ba yang de dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The lotus gesture and drinking water as food are for the purpose of being in accord with that.

original: de nas zla ba gsum pa'i tshe //
analyzed: de nas zla ba gsum pa'i tshe //
translated: Then, in the third month,

original: zhes pa nas /🔽lus ngag yid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa nas / lus ngag yid las byung ba'o //
translated: up to

original: zhes pa'i bar du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du /
translated: arising from body, speech, and mind.

original: me yi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i //
analyzed: me yi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i //
translated: Residing on the mandala of fire,🔽one should eat the explained food.

original: bshad pa'i zas bza' ste zhes pa ni me dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ji ltar me skam gsher dang bzang ngan la sogs pa mi rtog par sreg pa bzhin du zhim po la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: bshad pa'i zas bza' ste zhes pa ni me dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir / ji ltar me skam gsher dang bzang ngan la sogs pa mi rtog par sreg pa bzhin du zhim po la sogs pa'am /
translated: For the purpose of being in accord with fire,🔽just as fire does not conceive of dry, wet, good, bad, and so on, but burns, one should eat without conceiving of delicious and so on,

original: 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la mi rtog cing slong bar bza' zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la mi rtog cing slong bar bza' zhes pa'o //
translated: or desirable things, and so on.

original: ral gri'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa //
analyzed: ral gri'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa //
translated: Endowed with the sword gesture,

original: zhes pa yang me dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa yang me dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: is also in accord with fire.

original: ji ltar mes thams cad 'tshig cing gcod pa bzhin du ral gris kyang dngos po thams cad gcod cing med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mes thams cad 'tshig cing gcod pa bzhin du ral gris kyang dngos po thams cad gcod cing med par byed pa'o //
translated: Just as fire burns and cuts everything, so also the sword cuts and destroys all things.

original: sdig pa kun du bsreg pa ni //
analyzed: sdig pa kun du bsreg pa ni //
translated: The burning of all sins

original: lus po nyid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lus po nyid las byung ba'o //
translated: arises from the body itself.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas shing sngags bzlas na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas shing sngags bzlas na /
translated: This means that if one abides in such a samadhi and recites the mantra,

original: lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas sdig pa sbyang ba'i las kyi bag chags las bsams te 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas sdig pa sbyang ba'i las kyi bag chags las bsams te 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: one should contemplate the arising of the karma of purifying sins through the three doors of body, speech, and mind.

original: bzhi la rlung gi ldan par te //
analyzed: bzhi la rlung gi ldan par te //
translated: For four months, abiding in the wind maṇḍala,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /

original: sems thub par ni sngags zlos shig / ces pa'i bar du zla ba gcig rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sems thub par ni sngags zlos shig / ces pa'i bar du zla ba gcig rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa ste /
translated: ... recite the mantra with a focused mind.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ting nge 'dzin du sbyar ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin te /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ting nge 'dzin du sbyar ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin te /
translated: As for applying the wind maṇḍala to samādhi, it is as explained before.

original: khyad par du bdag gi lus rlung gis reg par ldan par yid la bsgom mo //
analyzed: khyad par du bdag gi lus rlung gis reg par ldan par yid la bsgom mo //
translated: In particular, one should meditate on the mind being in contact with the wind touching one's body.

original: zas su rtag par rlung bza'o //
analyzed: zas su rtag par rlung bza'o //
translated: Always eat the wind as food.

original: zhes kha zas kyang de'i rjes @224a * //🔽su mthun par sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: zhes kha zas kyang de'i rjes @224a * // su mthun par sbyar ba ste /
translated: Also, food should be taken in accordance with that.

original: rlung ni nang du rgyu ba lkog mar bags kyis bgags par bsams na bru ba tsha ba dang skom pa med par 'gyur te rlung za ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rlung ni nang du rgyu ba lkog mar bags kyis bgags par bsams na bru ba tsha ba dang skom pa med par 'gyur te rlung za ba zhes bya'o //
translated: If one imagines that the wind moving inside is gradually blocked at the throat, hunger, heat, and thirst will not occur. This is called “eating wind.”

original: de la 'khor lo'i phyag rgya bcings //
analyzed: de la 'khor lo'i phyag rgya bcings //
translated: In that, one should bind the wheel mudra.

original: zhes pa ni 'khor los 'khor zhing g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid pas rlung dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'khor los 'khor zhing g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid pas rlung dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the wheel has the characteristic of revolving and moving, it is in accordance with the wind.

original: sems thub par ni sngags zlos shig pa ni srog dang rtsol ba bsdams pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i rim pa bzhin du bzlas pa'o //🔽dbang chen gyi dang chu dngos las //
analyzed: sems thub par ni sngags zlos shig pa ni srog dang rtsol ba bsdams pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i rim pa bzhin du bzlas pa'o // dbang chen gyi dang chu dngos las //
translated: One should recite the mantra with a controlled mind. This is recitation according to the previously explained stages of the control of life and exertion.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: From “the great lords and the water element”🔽up to

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdzogs 'gyur ro //🔽zhes pa'i bar du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor dang chu'i dkyil 'khor gnyis la gnas te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdzogs 'gyur ro // zhes pa'i bar du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor dang chu'i dkyil 'khor gnyis la gnas te /
translated: “the perfect buddhas will be perfected.”

original: rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa ste /
translated: One should practice the spiritual deportment of awareness abiding in both the maṇḍala of the great lords and the maṇḍala of water.

original: dbang chen dang chu'i dkyil 'khor so so'i snying po las snga ma bzhin du bsams te /
analyzed: dbang chen dang chu'i dkyil 'khor so so'i snying po las snga ma bzhin du bsams te /
translated: The great power and the water maṇḍala, each with their essence, are imagined as before.

original: ro smad ni dbang chen gyi rang bzhin du snga ma bzhin du bsam mo //
analyzed: ro smad ni dbang chen gyi rang bzhin du snga ma bzhin du bsam mo //
translated: The lower part of the body is the nature of the great power, as before.

original: ro stod ni chu'i rang bzhin du bsams te /
analyzed: ro stod ni chu'i rang bzhin du bsams te /
translated: The upper part of the body is imagined as the nature of water.

original: zas su yang 'o ma dang chu gnyis btung zhing zla ba gcig tu bzlas par bya'o //🔽rnyed dang mi rnyed rnam par spangs //
analyzed: zas su yang 'o ma dang chu gnyis btung zhing zla ba gcig tu bzlas par bya'o // rnyed dang mi rnyed rnam par spangs //
translated: One should recite for one month, drinking both milk and water as food.

original: zhes pa ni rnyed na yang dga' ba med ma rnyed na yang mi dga' ba med pa'o //🔽rlung dang me yi ldan pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnyed na yang dga' ba med ma rnyed na yang mi dga' ba med pa'o // rlung dang me yi ldan pa ste //
translated: “ Abandoning gain and non-gain” means that if one gains [food], one should not be happy, and if one does not gain [food], one should not be unhappy.

original: zhes pa nas rnyed pa dang mi rnyed pa rnam par spangs so zhes par rlung dang me gnyis ka'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nas rig pa'i dka' thub spyod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa nas rnyed pa dang mi rnyed pa rnam par spangs so zhes par rlung dang me gnyis ka'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nas rig pa'i dka' thub spyod pa ste /
translated: “ Endowed with wind and fire” means that, having remained in the maṇḍala of both wind and fire, one should practice the austerity of the knowledge consort.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du me'i dkyil 'khor dang / ram gyi sa bon las bsams te /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du me'i dkyil 'khor dang / ram gyi sa bon las bsams te /
translated: The maṇḍala of wind is imagined above the maṇḍala of fire, from the seed syllable raṃ.

original: bdag gi lus ro stod me'i rang bzhin du 'bar ba bzhin du bsam /
analyzed: bdag gi lus ro stod me'i rang bzhin du 'bar ba bzhin du bsam /
translated: Imagine that the upper part of one's body is blazing with the nature of fire.

original: ro smad kyang snga ma bzhin du rlung gi rang bzhin du bsams te /
analyzed: ro smad kyang snga ma bzhin du rlung gi rang bzhin du bsams te /
translated: Also imagine that the lower part is of the nature of wind, as before.

original: zas su yang rlung gi zas kyi sbyor ba snar smos pa bzhin du cung zad bya /
analyzed: zas su yang rlung gi zas kyi sbyor ba snar smos pa bzhin du cung zad bya /
translated: Also, for food, one should perform a little of the practice of wind food, as mentioned in the nose.

original: me'i zas ma blangs par yang cung zad bya ste /
analyzed: me'i zas ma blangs par yang cung zad bya ste /
translated: Also, one should perform a little of the practice of fire food, without taking it.

original: zla ba gcig tu zlas par bya //
analyzed: zla ba gcig tu zlas par bya //
translated: One should recite for one month.

original: zhes pa de dag thams cad kyang rang gi lha'i gzugs su sbyor ba ni so so'i dkyil 'khor kha dog ci 'dra ba bzhin du lha'i gzugs kyi kha dog kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de dag thams cad kyang rang gi lha'i gzugs su sbyor ba ni so so'i dkyil 'khor kha dog ci 'dra ba bzhin du lha'i gzugs kyi kha dog kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Also, all of these should be applied in one's deity form. The color of the deity's form should be known to be the same as the color of one's individual mandala.

original: zla ba gcig tu srog dang rtsol ba bsnams te bzlas pa yang dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su bshad pa'i rim bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig tu srog dang rtsol ba bsnams te bzlas pa yang dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su bshad pa'i rim bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: Also, the recitation while holding the life and exertion for one month should be explained according to the sequence explained in the context of the great sovereign mandala.

original: brgya byin tshangs pa la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: brgya byin tshangs pa la sogs pa'i //
translated: Indra, Brahma, and so on

original: lha rnams zhes pa nas sems can @224b kun la phan byed pa'i bar du de'i mtha' ji ltar rig par bgyi zhes zhus pa'i lan te mthu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: lha rnams zhes pa nas sems can @224b kun la phan byed pa'i bar du de'i mtha' ji ltar rig par bgyi zhes zhus pa'i lan te mthu bshad pa ste /
translated: The reply to the question, How should one know the extent of the gods, etc., up to the benefactors of all sentient beings? is the explanation of the power.

original: brgya byin dang tshungs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang / sha za dang lto 'phye la sogs pa'i rig pa'i dka' thub de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sngags pa de lta bu mthong na /
analyzed: brgya byin dang tshungs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang / sha za dang lto 'phye la sogs pa'i rig pa'i dka' thub de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sngags pa de lta bu mthong na /
translated: When the gods, such as Indra, and the knowledge-vidyadhara-s such as the rakshasa-s and mahoraga-s see such a mantra-practitioner endowed with such knowledge and austerity,

original: rgyang ring po nas phyag 'tshal zhing sngags pa de la srung bar byed /
analyzed: rgyang ring po nas phyag 'tshal zhing sngags pa de la srung bar byed /
translated: they will pay homage from afar and protect that mantra-practitioner.

original: sngags ba des ni ci dgos pa rnams kyang byed par 'gyur ba dang / lha'i sman rnams kyang sngags pa de'i drung na 'khod cing bka' mnyan zhing sman btsal gyis mi rnyed pa dag kyang de'i drung na 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: sngags ba des ni ci dgos pa rnams kyang byed par 'gyur ba dang / lha'i sman rnams kyang sngags pa de'i drung na 'khod cing bka' mnyan zhing sman btsal gyis mi rnyed pa dag kyang de'i drung na 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: That mantra-practitioner will also do whatever is necessary, and the divine medicines will be present before that mantra-practitioner, listening to his orders, and even those medicines that are not available will be seen to be present before him.

original: bgegs dang ma bdun po la sogs pa'i 'jigs par byed pa rnams kyang rgyang ring po nas phyag 'tshal bar byed pa dang / sngags pa'i gnas kyang me 'bar ba ltar snang ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la dbang thob pa dang /
analyzed: bgegs dang ma bdun po la sogs pa'i 'jigs par byed pa rnams kyang rgyang ring po nas phyag 'tshal bar byed pa dang / sngags pa'i gnas kyang me 'bar ba ltar snang ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la dbang thob pa dang /
translated: The abode of the mantrin will appear like a blazing fire, like the Blessed Buddha, and he will attain mastery over the mundane and supramundane.

original: dbang bar 'gyur ba dang mi mthun pa 'dum pa ni phyag na rdo rje lta bu /
analyzed: dbang bar 'gyur ba dang mi mthun pa 'dum pa ni phyag na rdo rje lta bu /
translated: He will become like Vajrapāṇi, reconciling those who are not in harmony.

original: snying rje chen po spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po lta bur gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po lta bur gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: He will become like Avalokiteśvara, the lord of great compassion.

original: de ni zla drug bzlas rnams la //
analyzed: de ni zla drug bzlas rnams la //
translated: For those who recite for six months,

original: dngos grub 'dod bzhin 'bras bu smin //
analyzed: dngos grub 'dod bzhin 'bras bu smin //
translated: the result will ripen as desired.

original: bdag rang dang ni gzhan rnams la'ang //
analyzed: bdag rang dang ni gzhan rnams la'ang //
translated: For oneself and others,

original: rtag tu skyong bar bye dpa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu skyong bar bye dpa'o //
translated: he will always be a protector.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the chapter on the conduct of the bodhisattva.

original: dus dang yul dang bya ba las chos dang // chos min rnam par spong bar byed pa 'dis //
analyzed: dus dang yul dang bya ba las chos dang // chos min rnam par spong bar byed pa 'dis //
translated: By this, which abandons virtue and nonvirtue in terms of time, place, action, and phenomena,

original: ji ltar myur du 'gyur ba'i tshad kyang mgon pos bka' stsol cig / ces pa de bshad pa ste dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom pa'i rim gyis zla ba drug na dus la sogs pa la mi ltos shing bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i grub🔽pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar myur du 'gyur ba'i tshad kyang mgon pos bka' stsol cig / ces pa de bshad pa ste dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom pa'i rim gyis zla ba drug na dus la sogs pa la mi ltos shing bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i grub pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the explanation. By the stage of meditation on the maṇḍala of the great empowerment, and so on, in six months, one will attain the accomplishment that benefits oneself and others, without regard for time, and so on.

original: de lta bu thob pa'i tshad ni zla ba drug go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu thob pa'i tshad ni zla ba drug go zhes pa'o //
translated: The measure of attaining that is six months.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes sngags rnams dang dkyil 'khor yang dris pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes sngags rnams dang dkyil 'khor yang dris pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Next, Vajrapāṇi asked the Bhagavān about the mantras and the maṇḍala.

original: slob dpon gyi de kho na nyid bshad pa ste /
